translated: He will have supreme magical power and great might, and he will be free from shamelessness.

original: lha gzhan rnams kha zas za ba'i dus de'i tshe lha rnams bdag nyid kyis sdig pa dang 'dres pa'i zas kyi las ngan pa bskyed pa des shin tu ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha gzhan rnams kha zas za ba'i dus de'i tshe lha rnams bdag nyid kyis sdig pa dang 'dres pa'i zas kyi las ngan pa bskyed pa des shin tu ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the other gods eat their food, they will be ashamed of the bad karma that they have created by mixing with evil.

original: gang gi ji srid du las kyi rnam pa byas pa de srid du de'i zas kyi rnam pa de lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi ji srid du las kyi rnam pa byas pa de srid du de'i zas kyi rnam pa de lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: For as long as they have created such karmic actions, for that long their food will be like that.

original: zas de mngon par mthong nas lha rnams shin tu ngo tsha bar gyur to //
analyzed: zas de mngon par mthong nas lha rnams shin tu ngo tsha bar gyur to //
translated: When the gods see that food, they will be ashamed.

original: de ltar bdag gi zas shin tu che ba mchog tu zhim po rab tu mang ba de dag bdag nyid kyis mthong na /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi zas shin tu che ba mchog tu zhim po rab tu mang ba de dag bdag nyid kyis mthong na /
translated: “When he sees his own food, which is so vast, so delicious, and so abundant,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he thinks,

original: bdag tshe rabs ji snyed cig tu 'di ltar 'gyur snyam nas des khang pa brtsegs pa'i rtsig pa de nyid la brtags na /
analyzed: bdag tshe rabs ji snyed cig tu 'di ltar 'gyur snyam nas des khang pa brtsegs pa'i rtsig pa de nyid la brtags na /
translated: ‘In how many lives will I be like this?’ He then examines the wall of the kūṭāgāra.

original: dge ba'i las des bdag lha rnams kyi nang du lan bdun /
analyzed: dge ba'i las des bdag lha rnams kyi nang du lan bdun /

original: mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun /
translated: among humans seven times,

original: phan tshun tshe 'pho ba lan bdun mthong nas /
analyzed: phan tshun tshe 'pho ba lan bdun mthong nas /
translated: and seven times he will be reborn in both places.

original: bdag gi tshe 'phob brgyad pa lha rnams dang / mi rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dvags @186b rnams kyi nang du skye ba mthong nas /
analyzed: bdag gi tshe 'phob brgyad pa lha rnams dang / mi rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dvags @186b rnams kyi nang du skye ba mthong nas /
translated: He sees that in his eighth life he will be reborn among the gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and pretas.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks,

original: 'di dag gang du'ang bdag nyid ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gang du'ang bdag nyid ma mthong ste /
translated: ‘I do not see myself anywhere.

original: bdag gang du ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhig gu snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gang du ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhig gu snyam mo //
translated: Where and how will I be reborn?’

original: de bdag nyid gang du'ang ma mthong nas /
analyzed: de bdag nyid gang du'ang ma mthong nas /
translated: He does not see himself anywhere.

original: de shin tu ngo mtshar cher skyes te /
analyzed: de shin tu ngo mtshar cher skyes te /
translated: He was amazed.

original: kye ma / bdag gi tshe brgyad pa ma mthong ngo snyams pas /
analyzed: kye ma / bdag gi tshe brgyad pa ma mthong ngo snyams pas /
translated: “Oh! I have never seen my life span extended like this.”

original: de sems shing 'dug 'dug pa las yun ring zhig lon pa dang / dran pa rnyed de /
analyzed: de sems shing 'dug 'dug pa las yun ring zhig lon pa dang / dran pa rnyed de /
translated: He sat there thinking for a long time, and then he regained his memory.

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las bdag tshe rabs bdun brjes nas rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das las bdag tshe rabs bdun brjes nas rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur la /
translated: “I heard from the Bhagavān that after seven lifetimes had passed, I would become a stream-enterer,

original: phyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes thos so //
analyzed: phyis phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes thos so //
translated: and later enter the realm without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: da ni bdag skal pa de lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: da ni bdag skal pa de lta bu dang ldan par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: Now I have such good fortune.”

original: de ltar brtags nas /
analyzed: de ltar brtags nas /

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bar byed de /

analyzed: yid shin tu dang zhing rnyog pa med pas bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bar byed do //
translated: With a very clear and unclouded mind, he paid homage to the Bhagavān.

original: yid rab tu dga' bas phyag byas nas /
analyzed: yid rab tu dga' bas phyag byas nas /
translated: With a very joyful mind, he paid homage,🔽and then he sat down in front of the Bhagavān.

original: de nas yang gding ba shin tu 'byor ba btags pa las byas pa ma yin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dzambu chu bo'i gser bzang po'i stan de nyid la 'dug pa dang / brgya byin gyi gzugs de nyid rtsig pa'i nang na snang ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas yang gding ba shin tu 'byor ba btags pa las byas pa ma yin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dzambu chu bo'i gser bzang po'i stan de nyid la 'dug pa dang / brgya byin gyi gzugs de nyid rtsig pa'i nang na snang ba mthong ngo //
translated: Then, he sees the excellent seat of excellent gold from the Jambu River, which is not made by anyone, and he sits on that very seat.

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, thinks,

original: 'di ltar bdag yang lha'i mdun sa chos bzang du lha rnams yang dag par blta bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag yang lha'i mdun sa chos bzang du lha rnams yang dag par blta bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: ‘I will now enter the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā to see the gods.’

original: @187a *// de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin stan de las langs nas tshal sna tshogs kyi phyogs ga la ba der 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: @187a *// de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin stan de las langs nas tshal sna tshogs kyi phyogs ga la ba der 'gro bar byed de /

original: der yang lha dang / lha mo'i nang na dga' bar byed /
analyzed: der yang lha dang / lha mo'i nang na dga' bar byed /
translated: There, too, he enjoys himself with gods and goddesses,

original: dga' dgur spyod par byed la /
analyzed: dga' dgur spyod par byed la /
translated: and he indulges in pleasures.

original: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur pas dga' bar byed /
analyzed: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur pas dga' bar byed /
translated: Endowed with and possessing the five divine pleasures, he enjoys himself.

original: yongs su spyod par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su spyod par byed do //
translated: They enjoy themselves.

original: bya dang / shing ljon pa dang / padma'i rdzing dang / lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal gyi rnam pas mdzes par byas pa'i tshal sna tshogs su de dag gis lha'i rgyal po brgya byin de mngon par mthong nas /
analyzed: bya dang / shing ljon pa dang / padma'i rdzing dang / lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal gyi rnam pas mdzes par byas pa'i tshal sna tshogs su de dag gis lha'i rgyal po brgya byin de mngon par mthong nas /
translated: When they see Śakra, King of the Gods, in the various groves, which are beautified by birds, trees, lotus ponds, pools, and parks,

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis sil snyan dang / rol mo rnam pa sna tshogs dag blangs te /

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: They go to where Śakra, King of the Gods, is.

original: dong nas kyang brgya byin la gsong por smras shing brgya byin yongs su bskor nas /
analyzed: dong nas kyang brgya byin la gsong por smras shing brgya byin yongs su bskor nas /
translated: When they have arrived, they greet Śakra, surround him,

original: lha'i tshogs thams cad bro rdung bar byed /
analyzed: lha'i tshogs thams cad bro rdung bar byed /
translated: and all the hosts of gods dance.

original: glu dbyangs len /
analyzed: glu dbyangs len /
translated: They sing songs,

original: rgod par byed do //
analyzed: rgod par byed do //
translated: and they laugh.

original: brgya byin sngar 'gro la /
analyzed: brgya byin sngar 'gro la /
translated: Śakra goes first,🔽and the gods follow him.

original: lha mo cha byad dang / gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa dag phyi bzhin 'brang zhing rol mo'i sgra sna tshogs kyis lha'i mdun sa chos bzang der 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: lha mo cha byad dang / gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa dag phyi bzhin 'brang zhing rol mo'i sgra sna tshogs kyis lha'i mdun sa chos bzang der 'gro bar byed do //
translated: They are followed by goddesses with various appearances and forms, and they proceed to Sudharmā, the divine hall, to the accompaniment of various musical sounds.

original: de dag thams cad yid rab tu dga' bas sil snyan dang / rol mo sna tshogs dang / gar byas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad yid rab tu dga' bas sil snyan dang / rol mo sna tshogs dang / gar byas /
translated: All of them, with their minds filled with joy, dance to the sound of various musical instruments and songs.

original: gad mo bgad /
analyzed: gad mo bgad /
translated: They laugh,

original: dga' bar byas /
analyzed: dga' bar byas /
translated: have fun,

original: rtsed mo rtses nas lhan cig tu 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: rtsed mo rtses nas lhan cig tu 'dong bar byed do //
translated: and play, and then they all go together.

original: de nas chos bzang na gnas pa'i @187b lha brgya byin la rim gro byed par 'dod pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de nas chos bzang na gnas pa'i @187b lha brgya byin la rim gro byed par 'dod pa rnams kyang /

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: go to where Śakra, king of the gods, is.

analyzed: de nas sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs kyi sgra sna tshogs 'byin pa'i lha de rnams kyang phyir byung nas de dag phan tshun 'dus so //

analyzed: lha'i tshogs 'dus shing yang dag par dga' la /

original: mngon par mthong ba de rnams kyi bro gar dang / glu'i sgra shin tu snyan pa sreg pa kun tu ston pa'i sgra des lha'i 'jig rten dang bcas pa thams cad kun tu gang ngo //

translated: The sound of their singing and dancing is so beautiful that it fills the entire world of the gods.

original: sgra de dag thos nas lha gang tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal gzhan rnams kyi nang na 'khod pa dag lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur pas dga' bar byed /🔽rtse bar byed /
analyzed: sgra de dag thos nas lha gang tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal gzhan rnams kyi nang na 'khod pa dag lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur pas dga' bar byed / rtse bar byed /
translated: When the gods who are in other forests and parks hear this sound, they will enjoy themselves with the five divine pleasures.

original: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
translated: They will play and enjoy themselves.

original: de dag kyang lha'i mdun sa chos bzang ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
analyzed: de dag kyang lha'i mdun sa chos bzang ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
translated: Then they will go to Sudharmā, the divine hall.

analyzed: dong nas kyang brgya byin la gsong por smras shing rgyal bar spyon cig ces brjod nas /

analyzed: 'bum phrag du mar yongs su bskor te lha'i mdun sa chos bzang ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //

original: dge ba'i las sna tshogs kyi glu len /
analyzed: dge ba'i las sna tshogs kyi glu len /
translated: They will sing songs about various virtuous actions.

original: bro rdung zhing cha byad dang / rgyan rnam pa bzhi thogs pa der skyes pa dag ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa legs par bsrungs shing bsgoms pa de'i 'bras bu'i rnam pa yin te /🔽de la nye bar spyod par byed do //

translated: They enjoy the results of their meditation.

original: lha'i tshogs thams cad chos bzang du zhugs te /
analyzed: lha'i tshogs thams cad chos bzang du zhugs te /
translated: All the hosts of gods enter the Sudharmā hall

analyzed: brgya byin gyi gnas @188a *// dpag tshad lnga brgyar rgya che zhing gser btso mas rnam par brgyan pa /

analyzed: bee d'urya'i shing ljon pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
translated: The abode of Śakra is five hundred leagues wide and is adorned with refined gold.🔽It is beautified by trees of beryl

analyzed: shing ljon pa gzhan rnams kyis kyang mdzes par byas pa /
translated: and other trees.

analyzed: me tog 'jam pos rgyas pa shin tu dri zhim zhing dpag tshad lnga'i bar du dri rab tu 'byung bar byed pa / yid du 'ong ba dga' bar byed la /
translated: The trees are covered with soft flowers that have a delightful fragrance that spreads for five leagues.🔽They are beautiful and delightful,

original: sdug cing yid du 'thad pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa dag yod do /
analyzed: sdug cing yid du 'thad pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa dag yod do /
translated: pleasing and attractive, and cannot be surpassed by others.

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang lha'i mdun sar brgya byin gyis yongs su bskyangs pa yin no //
translated: All of them are protected by Śakra in the divine assembly hall.

original: de dag lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang bcas shing lha mo'i tshogs bye ba phrag dgu bcu rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de rnams kyis dga' bar byed /
analyzed: de dag lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang bcas shing lha mo'i tshogs bye ba phrag dgu bcu rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po de rnams kyis dga' bar byed /
translated: Together with Śakra, lord of the gods, and with the ninety million goddesses, they enjoy the five divine sense pleasures.

original: rtse bar byed do //
analyzed: rtse bar byed do //
translated: They play and frolic.

original: der zhugs nas; khang bzang rab tu dga' bar gnas pa zhes bya ba de'i nang du 'dong bar byed do //🔽bee d'urya dang / gser dang / dngul dang / spug pas byas pa'i ka ba rnams dang / gser las byas pa'i stan rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: der zhugs nas; khang bzang rab tu dga' bar gnas pa zhes bya ba de'i nang du 'dong bar byed do // bee d'urya dang / gser dang / dngul dang / spug pas byas pa'i ka ba rnams dang / gser las byas pa'i stan rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
translated: They enter the divine palace called Abounding in Joy and go inside.🔽It is adorned with pillars made of beryl, gold, silver, and crystal, and with golden seats.

analyzed: thags su btags pa ma yin pa'i stan khra bo 'jam la nems zhes byed cing 'phar la lhod pa rnams bting ba /
translated: It is covered with multicolored cushions that are soft, yielding, and bouncy.

original: steng du gding ba yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i stan rnams la lha'i tshogs thams cad brgya byin gyis gnang nas 'khod do //
analyzed: steng du gding ba yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i stan rnams la lha'i tshogs thams cad brgya byin gyis gnang nas 'khod do //
translated: All the gods, with Indra’s permission, sat on the seats with perfect qualities that were spread out above.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis lha rnams la @188b 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis lha rnams la @188b 'di skad smras so //

analyzed: bdag cag legs par byas pa'i las des lha'i 'jig rten 'dir skyes la /

original: de zad nas ltung ba ni gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: de zad nas ltung ba ni gdon mi za'o //
translated: But when those are exhausted, we will certainly fall.

original: bdag cag thams cad las kyi 'bras bu'i bgo skal la ji ltar spyod pa bzhin bdag cag lha rnams kyi nang du 'ong la /
analyzed: bdag cag thams cad las kyi 'bras bu'i bgo skal la ji ltar spyod pa bzhin bdag cag lha rnams kyi nang du 'ong la /
translated: We gods will come here according to the share of the results of our actions.

original: de nas yang bdag cag ltung ba'i mthar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas yang bdag cag ltung ba'i mthar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, we will again fall to the end.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: lha dag / sdug bsngal de dag thams cad mngon par shes par byas la dge ba la 'bad par gyis shig /
analyzed: lha dag / sdug bsngal de dag thams cad mngon par shes par byas la dge ba la 'bad par gyis shig /
translated: gods, you should understand all these sufferings and strive for virtue.🔽’

original: de nas brgya byin gyi tshig de thos nas /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyi tshig de thos nas /
translated: When they heard Śakra’s words,

original: de dag kun gyi /
analyzed: de dag kun gyi /
translated: all of them

original: brgya byin la 'di skad smras so /
analyzed: brgya byin la 'di skad smras so /
translated: said to Śakra:🔽‘

analyzed: brgya byin / khyod kyis de ji ltar thugs su chud pa de bzhin lags te /
translated: Śakra, it is just as you have understood.

original: bdag cag kun de ltar rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa lha'i dga' ba dang / bde ba de las ltung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag cag kun de ltar rang gi las kyi 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa lha'i dga' ba dang / bde ba de las ltung bar 'gyur na /
translated: We all experience the results of our own actions in this way. We will fall from this divine happiness and joy.

original: de las gzhan pa bdag cag rgyu gang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba bstan du gsol /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa bdag cag rgyu gang gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba bstan du gsol /
translated: Please teach us what other causes there are that will prevent us from falling.

original: de nas brgya byin gyis lha de rnams la 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyis lha de rnams la 'di skad smras so //
translated: Then Śakra said to the gods,

original: gang 'dus byas kyi rnam pa 'jig pa'i mtha' can rtag par 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: gang 'dus byas kyi rnam pa 'jig pa'i mtha' can rtag par 'gyur ba'am //
translated: “There is no place that is permanent,

original: ther zug tu 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ther zug tu 'gyur ba'am /
translated: stable,🔽unchanging,🔽or enduring,

original: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi gnas de ni 'og gam /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i chos can gyi gnas de ni 'og gam /
translated: whether below,🔽above,

original: thad ka'am / dbus sam /🔽steng na'ang med do //
analyzed: thad ka'am / dbus sam / steng na'ang med do //
translated: or in the middle.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la rtag tu chags pa'i blo des ni cho ga 'grangs te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la rtag tu chags pa'i blo des ni cho ga 'grangs te /
translated: “The mind that is constantly attached to the afflictions is filled with rituals.

original: sdug bsngal la mtha' med cing legs pa med /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la mtha' med cing legs pa med /
translated: Suffering is endless and has no good qualities.

original: bde ba'i rang bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba'i rang bzhin ma yin /
translated: It is not the nature of happiness.

original: rgyu dang / rkyen khong du chud pa skyed pa ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen khong du chud pa skyed pa ma yin /
translated: “ ‘The causes and conditions that give rise to the experience of the fruits of karma are not understood by you.

original: yang dag par @189a *//
analyzed: yang dag par @189a *//
translated: You do not understand

original: skyed pa yin /
analyzed: skyed pa yin /
translated: the causes and conditions that give rise to the experience of the fruits of karma.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' 'di lta bu la rtog par mi byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' 'di lta bu la rtog par mi byed de /
translated: You do not contemplate the limits of suffering.

original: khyed cag phal cher mtho ris nas tshe 'phos te /
analyzed: khyed cag phal cher mtho ris nas tshe 'phos te /
translated: Most of you will die in the higher realms

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
translated: and be reborn among hell beings, starving spirits, and animals.

original: de nas yang legs par byas pa'i las kyis 'dir skyes pa rnams rang gi las kyi 'bras bu'i bgo skal la spyod pa mtho ris na lha'i bde ba dag myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas yang legs par byas pa'i las kyis 'dir skyes pa rnams rang gi las kyi 'bras bu'i bgo skal la spyod pa mtho ris na lha'i bde ba dag myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “ ‘Then, due to your past positive actions, you will be reborn here and experience the fruits of your own actions, enjoying the pleasures of the higher realms.

original: de nas yang las kyis gzings pa rnams ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas yang las kyis gzings pa rnams ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, due to your karmic actions, you will fall again,

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du nye bar spyod par 'gyur gyi lha rnams de la shin tu bag yod par gyis shig /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du nye bar spyod par 'gyur gyi lha rnams de la shin tu bag yod par gyis shig /
translated: experiencing the realms of hell beings, starving spirits, and animals. Therefore, gods, be careful!’

original: 'di ltar bdag gis gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'i chos de kho na dang / gzhan gang gis 'khor ba las thar par 'gyur ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis mdor bsdus te gsungs pa'i chos de kho na dang / gzhan gang gis 'khor ba las thar par 'gyur ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, I will explain the Dharma that was taught in brief by the Buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, and also that by which one is liberated from cyclic existence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: With ignorance as condition, there are volitions.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: With volitions as condition, there is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang / gzugs /
translated: With consciousness as condition, there is name and form.

original: ming dang / gzugs kyi rkyan gyis skye mched drug /
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs kyi rkyan gyis skye mched drug /
translated: With name and form as condition, there are the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: With the six sense spheres as condition, there is contact.🔽With contact as condition, there is feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /🔽srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa / srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: With feeling as condition, there is craving.🔽With craving as condition, there is grasping.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: With grasping as condition, there is existence.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: With existence as condition, there is birth.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya @189b ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya @189b ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: grief, lamentations, suffering, unhappiness, and turmoil.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this entire great mass of suffering comes into being.

original: yang ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag par 'gyur la /
translated: “Moreover, through the cessation of ignorance, formations cease.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of formations, consciousness ceases.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang / gzugs 'gag /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang / gzugs 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of consciousness, name and form cease.

original: ming dang / gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
analyzed: ming dang / gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of name and form, the six sense sources cease.

original: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of the six sense sources, contact ceases.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of contact, feeling ceases.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of feeling, craving ceases.

original: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
analyzed: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of craving, grasping ceases.

original: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of grasping, becoming ceases.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
translated: Through the cessation of becoming, birth ceases.

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga ba dang / na pa dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga ba dang / na pa dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: With the cessation of birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife will all come to cease.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, this great mass of pure suffering will cease.

original: de ltar lha dag /
analyzed: de ltar lha dag /
translated: In this way, gods,

original: 'khor ba 'di'i 'jug pa dang / ldog pa zhes bya ba mthong zhing shes na nyon mongs pa zad nas thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'di'i 'jug pa dang / ldog pa zhes bya ba mthong zhing shes na nyon mongs pa zad nas thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: when you see and understand the process of entering and exiting cyclic existence, you will attain freedom through the exhaustion of afflictions.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba /
translated: You will attain nirvana,

original: 'jig pa med pa /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa /
translated: which is not subject to destruction,🔽is permanent,

original: rtag pa / dga' ba med pa /
analyzed: rtag pa / dga' ba med pa /
translated: is free from joy,

original: 'chi ba med pa /
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa /
translated: is free from death,

original: zag pa med pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa 'thob ste /
translated: and is free from defilements.

original: de ltar lha dag /🔽srog chags rnams 'khor ba 'di las thar bar @190a *//
analyzed: de ltar lha dag / srog chags rnams 'khor ba 'di las thar bar @190a *//
translated: In this way, gods,🔽sentient beings will attain freedom from cyclic existence.

original: 'gyur ro // gang 'dus byas kyi rnam pa 'jig pa med pa'i mtha'am /🔽zad pa med pa'i mtha' pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gang 'dus byas kyi rnam pa 'jig pa med pa'i mtha'am / zad pa med pa'i mtha' pa /
translated: Those who see the end of conditioned phenomena,🔽the end of non-exhaustion,

original: chud za ba med pa'i mtha'am /
analyzed: chud za ba med pa'i mtha'am /
translated: the end of non-wastage,🔽and the end of non-destruction🔽will attain freedom from cyclic existence.

original: tshe rabs su 'gag pa med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i gnas gzhan 'khor ba na med do //
analyzed: tshe rabs su 'gag pa med pa'i chos zhes bya ba'i gnas gzhan 'khor ba na med do //
translated: In other realms within cyclic existence, there is no such thing as the Dharma that is free from cessation throughout one’s lives.

original: gang na gtan du bde bar 'gyur ba dang / ltung ba'i mtha' med pa dang / zad pa dang / 'jig pa'i mtha' med pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa med do //
analyzed: gang na gtan du bde bar 'gyur ba dang / ltung ba'i mtha' med pa dang / zad pa dang / 'jig pa'i mtha' med pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur ba'i chos can ma yin pa med do //
translated: There is no place where there is lasting happiness, no place where there is no falling, no place where there is no end to exhaustion and destruction, and no place that is not subject to arising and destruction.

original: de nas brgya byin gyi kha nas tshig de dag thos nas /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyi kha nas tshig de dag thos nas /
translated: ” When Śakra hears these words,

original: lha gang tshe rab gzhan dag tu sems bsgoms pa dam pa'i chos la mngon par dga' zhing blo shin tu zhen pa de dag ni yid la bag yod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lha gang tshe rab gzhan dag tu sems bsgoms pa dam pa'i chos la mngon par dga' zhing blo shin tu zhen pa de dag ni yid la bag yod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: those gods who have cultivated their minds in other lives, who delight in the sublime Dharma and whose minds are very focused, will become careful in their minds.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rnams la gcig tu dad la mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa bon bde ba'i las 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rnams la gcig tu dad la mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa bon bde ba'i las 'phen par byed do //
translated: They will have single-pointed faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and they will project the seeds of the happiness of the transcendence of suffering.

original: yid ma bsgoms pa gang yin pa de dag ni de nas yang bag med cing sems 'khrugs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yid ma bsgoms pa gang yin pa de dag ni de nas yang bag med cing sems 'khrugs par 'gyur la /
translated: Those whose minds have not been cultivated will then again become careless and their minds will be disturbed.

original: sred pas bslus pa rnams lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: sred pas bslus pa rnams lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: Deceived by craving, they enjoy themselves, possessing and reveling in the five divine sense pleasures.

original: de nas yang des bslus pa rnams rtse ba don du byed cing dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang des bslus pa rnams rtse ba don du byed cing dga' bar byed de /
translated: Then, deceived by craving, they enjoy themselves, playing and reveling.

original: de ltar de dag gi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal mtha' med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal mtha' med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, their suffering in cyclic existence is endless.

original: de ltar lha'i rgyal po brgya byin des chos bshad pa na 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi rnams lha'i @190b 'dun sa chos bzang dag tu so sor 'khod de /
analyzed: de ltar lha'i rgyal po brgya byin des chos bshad pa na 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi rnams lha'i @190b 'dun sa chos bzang dag tu so sor 'khod de /
translated: “When Śakra, king of the gods, has thus taught the Dharma, the four guardians of the world will each take their seats in the divine assembly hall of the Well-Arrayed Heaven.

original: 'di ltar lha'i rgyal po brgya byin lha rnams dang lhan cig gang na bzhugs zhes dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lha'i rgyal po brgya byin lha rnams dang lhan cig gang na bzhugs zhes dpyod par byed do //
translated: They will then discuss, ‘Where is Śakra, king of the gods, now staying with the gods?’

original: de nas de ltar brgya byin lha'i stan la 'dug cing lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor la gzi brjid 'bar ba na /
analyzed: de nas de ltar brgya byin lha'i stan la 'dug cing lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor la gzi brjid 'bar ba na /
translated: “When they see Śakra sitting on his divine seat, surrounded by the assembly of gods, shining with splendor,

original: lha yul gyi bde ba dpe med pa du ma dang ldan pa rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha yul gyi bde ba dpe med pa du ma dang ldan pa rgyang ring po nas mthong ngo //
translated: and endowed with the many incomparable pleasures of the god realms, they will see him from afar.

original: de mthong nas 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi rnams brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: de mthong nas 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi rnams brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Seeing this, the four guardians of the world will approach Śakra.

original: dong nas brgya byin la gsong bor smra ste /🔽lha'i stan mchog tu nyams dga' ba bzang po la phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;de nas yang stan mchog tu nyams dga' ba bzang po de dag las langs te /
analyzed: dong nas brgya byin la gsong bor smra ste / lha'i stan mchog tu nyams dga' ba bzang po la phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;de nas yang stan mchog tu nyams dga' ba bzang po de dag las langs te /
translated: Having approached, they will speak to Śakra in a friendly way:🔽‘Please sit on these excellent and delightful divine seats.’🔽Then, having risen from those excellent and delightful seats,

original: brgya byin ga la ba de logs su phyogs nas 'dug ste /
analyzed: brgya byin ga la ba de logs su phyogs nas 'dug ste /
translated: they will sit to one side facing Śakra

original: brgya byin la 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: brgya byin la 'di skad smras so //
translated: and speak to him in this way:

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: ‘Lord of the gods,

original: 'di ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la mngon par brtson zhing chos la dga' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar dzambu'i gling gi mi rnams ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la mngon par brtson zhing chos la dga' ba /
translated: the humans of Jambudvīpa are now diligently engaged in the ten virtuous actions and delight in the Dharma.

original: mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgan rabs la gus par bgyid kyi /
analyzed: mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgan rabs la gus par bgyid kyi /
translated: They respect their mothers, respect their fathers, respect mendicants, respect brahmins, and respect their elders.

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: Lord of the gods,

original: khyod dgyes par mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: khyod dgyes par mdzad du gsol //
translated: please rejoice!

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshig de dag thos nas 'di skad smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshig de dag thos nas 'di skad smras so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, having heard these words, said this:

original: lha dag / bdag ni dga'o //
analyzed: lha dag / bdag ni dga'o //
translated: “Gods, I am delighted!

original: rgyal po chen po /🔽khyed cag ni 'jig rten skyong zhing 'jig rten la phan par 'dod pa phan gdags par @191a *//
analyzed: rgyal po chen po / khyed cag ni 'jig rten skyong zhing 'jig rten la phan par 'dod pa phan gdags par @191a *//
translated: Great kings,

original: rab tu zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu zhugs pa yin te /
translated: you are the guardians of the world, wishing to benefit the world, engaged in bestowing benefits.

original: bdag gi dga' ba'ang thos nas /
analyzed: bdag gi dga' ba'ang thos nas /
translated: Having heard my delight,

original: khyed bde legs su gyur cig /
analyzed: khyed bde legs su gyur cig /
translated: may you be well!

original: de nas dzambu'i gling du chos dang mi ldan zhing chos ma yin pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i mi de dag de bzhin du 'jig rten skyong ba rnams brgya byin la smra bar byed de /🔽dzambu'i gling na mi chos dang mi ldan zhing chos ma yin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dbang /
analyzed: de nas dzambu'i gling du chos dang mi ldan zhing chos ma yin pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i mi de dag de bzhin du 'jig rten skyong ba rnams brgya byin la smra bar byed de / dzambu'i gling na mi chos dang mi ldan zhing chos ma yin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dbang /
translated: Then in Jambudvīpa, those people who are not righteous and follow unrighteousness speak thus to the guardians of the world, who in turn speak to Śakra:

original: dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgan rabs kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa dag mchis te /
analyzed: dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi rgan rabs kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa dag mchis te /
translated: “In Jambudvīpa there are people who are not righteous and follow unrighteousness, who do not respect their mothers, who do not respect their fathers, who do not respect ascetics, who do not respect brahmins, and who do not follow the elders of their clans.

original: bdud kyi phyogs ni 'phel lo //
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs ni 'phel lo //
translated: The forces of Māra are on the rise.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni 'grib bo zhes bsnyad do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni 'grib bo zhes bsnyad do //
translated: The forces of the true Dharma are in decline.”

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyis de thos nas /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyis de thos nas /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, heard this and

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa ji ltar phyogs pa rnams la bos nas smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa ji ltar phyogs pa rnams la bos nas smras pa /
translated: summoned the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings and the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, saying,

original: lha ma yin brtan pa dang / rab spro la sogs pa /
analyzed: lha ma yin brtan pa dang / rab spro la sogs pa /
translated: “The asuras Dṛḍha, Prahlāda, and so forth,

original: klu chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa rab 'joms la sogs pa sa'i 'og nas langs te /
analyzed: klu chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa rab 'joms la sogs pa sa'i 'og nas langs te /
translated: and the nāgas who are not Dharma practitioners, Pramatha and so forth, have risen up from below the earth

original: bdag cag la g-yul 'gyed du'ong go /
analyzed: bdag cag la g-yul 'gyed du'ong go /
translated: and are coming to do battle with us.

original: lha khyed rnams chos shig /
analyzed: lha khyed rnams chos shig /
translated: Gods, you must prepare yourselves!”

original: de nas brgya byin gyi bka' de mnos nas /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyi bka' de mnos nas /
translated: Then, having received Śakra’s order,

original: gang rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams brgya byin gyi bkas shin tu rings par lag cha dang / mtshon cha sna tshogs snga ma bzhin tshogs te /
analyzed: gang rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams brgya byin gyi bkas shin tu rings par lag cha dang / mtshon cha sna tshogs snga ma bzhin tshogs te /
translated: the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings quickly assembled their various weapons and armaments, as before,

original: ri bo zla ba zhes bya ba'i rig la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: ri bo zla ba zhes bya ba'i rig la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: and went to the mountain called Moon.

original: de nas 'jig rten skyong ba de rnams dong ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin yang @191b lha'i tshogs sna tshogs kyis ni bskor /
analyzed: de nas 'jig rten skyong ba de rnams dong ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin yang @191b lha'i tshogs sna tshogs kyis ni bskor /
translated: “When the guardians of the world have departed, Śakra, lord of the gods, surrounded by various hosts of gods,

original: lha'i phreng ba dang / gos ni gyon /
analyzed: lha'i phreng ba dang / gos ni gyon /
translated: wearing divine garlands and clothes,

original: lang tsho la bab pa'i gzugs rgyan sna tshogs kyis ni brgyan /
analyzed: lang tsho la bab pa'i gzugs rgyan sna tshogs kyis ni brgyan /
translated: adorned with various ornaments in the prime of youth,

original: lha mo rnams ni rjes su 'brang zhing lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba dang lhan cig thams cad mngon par 'byor ces bya ba ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
analyzed: lha mo rnams ni rjes su 'brang zhing lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba dang lhan cig thams cad mngon par 'byor ces bya ba ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
translated: accompanied by goddesses who follow him, and surrounded by hosts of gods, will go to the place called All-Pervading.

original: skyed mos tshal gang yin pa de ri rab dang / skra lta bur cung zad 'dra ba'i dper bya na /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal gang yin pa de ri rab dang / skra lta bur cung zad 'dra ba'i dper bya na /
translated: “The park is similar to Mount Sumeru and its hair-like features.

original: 'di ltar zla ba rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba lta bu dang / nyi ma gza'i tshogs kyis bskor ba mi mthun par mthong ba lta bu dang / ri rab gser gyi ri stong gis bskor ba lta bu dang / shing ljon pa lha'i gser dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar zla ba rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba lta bu dang / nyi ma gza'i tshogs kyis bskor ba mi mthun par mthong ba lta bu dang / ri rab gser gyi ri stong gis bskor ba lta bu dang / shing ljon pa lha'i gser dang /
translated: It is like the moon surrounded by the host of stars, like the sun surrounded by the host of planets, like Mount Sumeru surrounded by a thousand golden mountains, like a tree of divine gold and jewels, like a cloud in the sky, and like a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / mthon ka dang / padma r'a ga'i mdog lta bu rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i skyed mos tshal de lha'i me tog gis mdzes par byas shing bya'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor la sgra skad snyan pa 'byin pa lha'i padma'i rdzing rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / mthon ka dang / padma r'a ga'i mdog lta bu rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i skyed mos tshal de lha'i me tog gis mdzes par byas shing bya'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor la sgra skad snyan pa 'byin pa lha'i padma'i rdzing rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin no //
translated: It is adorned with silver, beryl, sapphire, and ruby trees. The park is beautified by divine flowers and surrounded by flocks of birds that sing sweetly. It is also adorned with divine lotus ponds.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bu zhes bya ba skyed mos tshal chen po de na rdzing de dag snga ma bzhin yod pa'i nang na bal glang mo dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bu zhes bya ba skyed mos tshal chen po de na rdzing de dag snga ma bzhin yod pa'i nang na bal glang mo dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: In that great park, Śakra, lord of the gods, and his elephant king, Airāvaṇa, play together with the female elephants in the ponds as described before.

original: gser dang; bee d'urya'i padma'i 'dam bu'i nang na bal glang mo dang lhan cig rtse zhing yul der 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: gser dang; bee d'urya'i padma'i 'dam bu'i nang na bal glang mo dang lhan cig rtse zhing yul der 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Together with the female elephants, they play among the golden and beryl lotuses and travel through the land.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin lha'i tshogs dang / lha mo'i tshogs sna tshogs kyis @192a *//
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin lha'i tshogs dang / lha mo'i tshogs sna tshogs kyis @192a *//
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, together with various groups of gods and goddesses,

original: yongs su bskor ba ltar /
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba ltar /
translated: He is surrounded by a retinue of many hundreds of thousands of elephants.

original: glang po che'i rgyal po de'ang de lta bu yin la /
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po de'ang de lta bu yin la /
translated: This king of elephants is like that.🔽He is beautified by the radiance of his excellent light, which is like a lotus or refined gold, and which shines like a hundred thousand suns in the sky.

original: padma gser bcom lta bu dang / nam mkha' la nyi ma 'bum phrag 'char ba de lta bu'i 'od bzang po 'char ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa der de dga' bar byed /
analyzed: padma gser bcom lta bu dang / nam mkha' la nyi ma 'bum phrag 'char ba de lta bu'i 'od bzang po 'char ba dang ldan pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa der de dga' bar byed /
translated: He enjoys himself there,

original: yongs su spyod par byed /
analyzed: yongs su spyod par byed /
translated: he indulges in pleasures,

original: rtsed mo byed /
analyzed: rtsed mo byed /
translated: and he plays.

original: dud 'gror gyur kyang lha'i bde ba myong ba yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gror gyur kyang lha'i bde ba myong ba yin no //
translated: Even though he is an animal, he experiences the happiness of the gods.

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin der song nas lag pa gnyis kyis byugs shing phyi bdar byed la /
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin der song nas lag pa gnyis kyis byugs shing phyi bdar byed la /
translated: Then Śakra, King of the Gods, goes there and rubs and cleans him with both hands.

original: kye; bdag gi glang po che'i rgyal po 'di ni g-yul 'gyed pa la dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: kye; bdag gi glang po che'i rgyal po 'di ni g-yul 'gyed pa la dgos pa yin te /
translated: “Oh, this king of elephants is needed for battle!

original: lha dang / lha ma yin 'thab pa'i tshe 'di'i steng nas bdag rgyal ba thob bo //
analyzed: lha dang / lha ma yin 'thab pa'i tshe 'di'i steng nas bdag rgyal ba thob bo //
translated: When the gods and asuras fight, I will obtain victory riding on him!”

original: de nas glang po che mchog phyi bdar byas nas /
analyzed: de nas glang po che mchog phyi bdar byas nas /
translated: Then, after cleaning the supreme elephant,

original: skyed mos tshal thams cad 'byor ldan na khang bzang mya ngan bral zhes bya ba ga la ba der 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal thams cad 'byor ldan na khang bzang mya ngan bral zhes bya ba ga la ba der 'gro bar byed de /
translated: When all the parks are filled, they go to the palace called Free of Sorrow.

original: chu'i zam pa lta bu'i skad de las 'dzegs nas /
analyzed: chu'i zam pa lta bu'i skad de las 'dzegs nas /
translated: They climb up the stairs that are like a bridge of water

original: der lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: der lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te 'jug par byed do //
translated: and enter there, surrounded by a retinue of gods and goddesses.

original: der zhugs nas lha'i rgyal po de lha mo bye ba phrag dgu'i mdun na rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: der zhugs nas lha'i rgyal po de lha mo bye ba phrag dgu'i mdun na rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed do //
translated: Once they have entered, the king of the gods plays and enjoys himself in the presence of nine hundred million goddesses.

original: lha'i rgyal po de rnams dang lhan cig lha'i 'dod ba'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur bar rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po de rnams dang lhan cig lha'i 'dod ba'i yon tan lnga rnams 'byor cing ldan par gyur bar rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: The king of the gods and the goddesses play, enjoy themselves, and celebrate together, endowed with and possessing the five heavenly pleasures.

original: yongs su spyod par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su spyod par byed do //
translated: They play, enjoy themselves, and celebrate together.

original: lha'i rgyal po rang gi las dang mthun par longs spyod 'byor te /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po rang gi las dang mthun par longs spyod 'byor te /
translated: The king of the gods experiences wealth in accordance with his own karmic actions.

original: lha de dag dang / lha'i @192b rgyal po de ji srid du 'dod pa /
analyzed: lha de dag dang / lha'i @192b rgyal po de ji srid du 'dod pa /
translated: The gods and the king of the gods enjoy themselves for as long as they wish.

original: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa dang / so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba bde ba'i rnam par smin pa /🔽bde ba so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zad par ma gyur ba de srid du 'di lta skyed mos tshal brgya snyed kyis brgyan pa'i lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang gi skyed mos tshul de na ba de ba kun dang ldan zhing lha'i tshogs thams
analyzed: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa dang / so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba bde ba'i rnam par smin pa / bde ba so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las zad par ma gyur ba de srid du 'di lta skyed mos tshal brgya snyed kyis brgyan pa'i lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang gi skyed mos tshul de na ba de ba kun dang ldan zhing lha'i tshogs thams
translated: They will experience the ripening of their actions, which are attractive, delightful, and accumulated, and which are the cause of the ripening of happiness.

original: cad dang bcas pas yan lag lha dang ldan pa'i rol mo rnams kyis rtse bar byed dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: cad dang bcas pas yan lag lha dang ldan pa'i rol mo rnams kyis rtse bar byed dga' bar byed do //
translated: Until their actions that cause the experience of happiness have been exhausted, they will enjoy themselves and play in the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā, which is adorned with hundreds of parks, together with the assembly of gods and with the music of the gods.

original: de dag phyis lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag phyis lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Later, they will die in the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā.

original: shi nas kyang ji ltar las de dang nye bar 'gro zhing myong bar 'gyur ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang ji ltar las de dang nye bar 'gro zhing myong bar 'gyur ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, they will be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals, in accordance with their karmic actions.

original: gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: If they are reborn with the general lot in life of humans,

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par mchog tu bde ba dang / rig pa'i blo dri ma med pa dang / phan tshun gyi gtso bo'am /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par mchog tu bde ba dang / rig pa'i blo dri ma med pa dang / phan tshun gyi gtso bo'am /
translated: in accordance with their causal actions they will be supremely happy, have a stainless intellect, and be a leader among their friends,

original: grong gi gtso bo'am /🔽yul gyi gtso bo'am /
analyzed: grong gi gtso bo'am / yul gyi gtso bo'am /
translated: a leader of the village,🔽a leader of the country,

original: grong khyer gyi gtso bo'am /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi gtso bo'am /
translated: a leader of the city,

original: phan tshun gyi gnyen 'dab dang / rtsa lag dang bde bar lhan cig 'khong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi gnyen 'dab dang / rtsa lag dang bde bar lhan cig 'khong par 'gyur ro //
translated: and a friend to their relatives and companions.

original: lha'i rgyal bo de ni ngan song gi sgo bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal bo de ni ngan song gi sgo bcad pa yin te /
translated: “The king of the gods closes the doors to the lower realms.

analyzed: lha de dag gi 'chi 'pho ba la mngon par btags nas 'di ltar tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: He will be reborn in the higher realms and, as he is about to die and transmigrate, he will utter the following verses:

original: sa gang yin pa de dag gi /
analyzed: sa gang yin pa de dag gi /
translated: “ ‘The grounds are🔽Adorned with various lotus groves,

original: tshal ni padma sna tshogs dang / rtse mo mchog ste nyams dga' dang / @193a *//
analyzed: tshal ni padma sna tshogs dang / rtse mo mchog ste nyams dga' dang / @193a *//
translated: The supreme and delightful peaks,🔽And various precious stones.

original: rin po che dang ldan pa dang // mtsho dang 'bab chu rin po che'i //
analyzed: rin po che dang ldan pa dang // mtsho dang 'bab chu rin po che'i //
translated: The lakes and rivers are adorned

original: rdo ba sna tshogs rnams kyis brgyan //
analyzed: rdo ba sna tshogs rnams kyis brgyan //
translated: With various precious stones.

original: ljon shing me tog sna tshogs dang // bya ni sna tshogs dag gis khebs //
analyzed: ljon shing me tog sna tshogs dang // bya ni sna tshogs dag gis khebs //
translated: and various birds.

original: gser las byas pa'i dpag bsam shing //
analyzed: gser las byas pa'i dpag bsam shing //
translated: Some wish-fulfilling trees are made of gold,

original: kha cig dri med bee d'urya //
analyzed: kha cig dri med bee d'urya //
translated: some are of stainless beryl,

original: dngul dang gser ni btso ma yin //
analyzed: dngul dang gser ni btso ma yin //
translated: some are of silver and refined gold.

original: tshal ni rnam par 'dres pa bskyed //
analyzed: tshal ni rnam par 'dres pa bskyed //
translated: They produce a mixed forest.

original: bung ba rnams ni sgra 'byin pas //🔽padma'i rdzing ni rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: bung ba rnams ni sgra 'byin pas // padma'i rdzing ni rnam par mdzes //
translated: The bees make a humming sound🔽and the lotus ponds are beautiful.

original: khang bzang mchog ni nyams dga' zhing //
analyzed: khang bzang mchog ni nyams dga' zhing //
translated: The best of palaces are delightful

original: rin po che ni che dang ldan //
analyzed: rin po che ni che dang ldan //
translated: and endowed with great jewels.

original: rnam par brgyan pa nyams dga' ste //
analyzed: rnam par brgyan pa nyams dga' ste //
translated: They are delightful with various ornaments

original: lha la 'os pa thams cad yod //
analyzed: lha la 'os pa thams cad yod //
translated: and have everything suitable for the gods.

original: de dag thams cad de bzhin 'dug /
analyzed: de dag thams cad de bzhin 'dug /
translated: All of them remain just as they were,

original: skye bo rnams ni yongs su 'gyur //
analyzed: skye bo rnams ni yongs su 'gyur //
translated: but the beings are completely transformed.

original: kye ma sred pas bslus pa yi //
analyzed: kye ma sred pas bslus pa yi //
translated: Alas! The gods deceived by craving

original: lha rnams kun gyi bde ba ni //
analyzed: lha rnams kun gyi bde ba ni //
translated: all their pleasures🔽are like an illusion, a bubble, foam,

original: sgyu ma chu bur dbu ba dang // dri za'i grong khyer lta bu yin //
analyzed: sgyu ma chu bur dbu ba dang // dri za'i grong khyer lta bu yin //
translated: and a city of gandharvas.

original: sred pa dug dang me 'dra ba //
analyzed: sred pa dug dang me 'dra ba //
translated: Craving is like poison and fire,

original: 'jig rten 'jig pa'i phyir gnas te //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig pa'i phyir gnas te //
translated: and abides for the destruction of the world.

original: sred pa'i mtshor ni 'khyam byed cing //
analyzed: sred pa'i mtshor ni 'khyam byed cing //
translated: They wander in the ocean of craving,🔽And all those beings are destroyed.

original: skye bo de kun 'jig par byed; ;'dod pa longs pas chog mi shes //
analyzed: skye bo de kun 'jig par byed; ;'dod pa longs pas chog mi shes //
translated: They are never satisfied with their enjoyment of pleasures,

original: bde ba 'dong pas chog mi shes //
analyzed: bde ba 'dong pas chog mi shes //
translated: Nor with their pursuit of happiness.

original: 'chi ba'i me yis rnam bsregs pa //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i me yis rnam bsregs pa //
translated: They are burned by the fire of death,

original: lha tshogs de dag ga las 'ongs //
analyzed: lha tshogs de dag ga las 'ongs //
translated: Where do those divine beings come from?

original: srid 'dis 'jig rten gzengs pa rnams //
analyzed: srid 'dis 'jig rten gzengs pa rnams //
translated: These existences elevate the world,

original: ye nas ngan te 'phags pa min //
analyzed: ye nas ngan te 'phags pa min //
translated: But they are always bad and not noble.

original: gang gis rnam par rmongs pa'i lha //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par rmongs pa'i lha //
translated: Those gods who are confused

original: 'chi ba yi ni dbang du song //
analyzed: 'chi ba yi ni dbang du song //
translated: Fall under the power of death.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin //
translated: Gods, humans, and asuras,

analyzed: gnod sbyin sems @193b can dmyal ba klu // 'chi ba'i zhags pa mi bzad par //
translated: Yakṣas, beings, hell beings, and nāgas—🔽All of them will helplessly go

original: thams cad dbang med 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad dbang med 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: Under the terrible noose of death.

original: khams gsum pa ste 'di dag kun //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ste 'di dag kun //
translated: All of these three realms

original: 'chi ba'i zhags pas sbrel gyur kyang //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i zhags pas sbrel gyur kyang //
translated: Are bound by the noose of death,

original: sred pa'i rmongs pas rmongs pa rnams //
analyzed: sred pa'i rmongs pas rmongs pa rnams //
translated: But those who are confused by the delusion of craving

original: dbang med mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang med mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Do not see it, though they are powerless.

original: de ltar brgya byin gyis rtag tu lha de rnams kyi skye ba dang / gzhan mi rtag pa 'chi ba dag mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltar brgya byin gyis rtag tu lha de rnams kyi skye ba dang / gzhan mi rtag pa 'chi ba dag mthong nas /
translated: In this way, Śakra always sees the birth of those gods and the impermanence of others who die.

original: lha dag shin tu go bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: lha dag shin tu go bar bya ba'i tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: Then, in order to make the gods understand, he spoke these verses:🔽“I pay homage to the Blessed One,

original: 'byung po kun la phan bzhed pa //🔽bcom ldan de la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽gang gi sred pa dug 'dra 'di //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la phan bzhed pa // bcom ldan de la phyag 'tshal lo // gang gi sred pa dug 'dra 'di //
translated: who wishes to benefit all beings.🔽He has taught extensively to the world

original: 'jig rten pa la mang du gsungs //🔽mdor na shes dang shes bya dag /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la mang du gsungs // mdor na shes dang shes bya dag /
translated: that craving is like poison.🔽In brief, he has understood

original: de yis 'di kun thugs su chud //
analyzed: de yis 'di kun thugs su chud //
translated: all this through knowledge and the knowable.

original: shes dang shes bya ma gtogs par //
analyzed: shes dang shes bya ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from knowledge and the knowable,

original: gsum pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: a third object does not occur.

original: 'di ni mi rtag sdug bsngal stong //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag sdug bsngal stong //
translated: This is impermanent, suffering, empty,

original: byed pa po yang spangs pa yin //
analyzed: byed pa po yang spangs pa yin //
translated: and also devoid of a creator.

original: de nyid lam ni rnam ston pa //
analyzed: de nyid lam ni rnam ston pa //
translated: He has revealed the path itself

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'khor ba gsungs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni 'khor ba gsungs //
translated: and the Buddha has taught saṃsāra.

original: de ltar dbang po 'di phyag rgya 'dis btab pa'i yid dri ma med pas bcom ldan 'das la bstod do //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po 'di phyag rgya 'dis btab pa'i yid dri ma med pas bcom ldan 'das la bstod do //
translated: In this way, with a stainless mind sealed with this mudrā of the sense faculties, he praises the Blessed One.

original: bstod nas de nas yang lha'i bde ba'ang nyams su myong bar byed de /
analyzed: bstod nas de nas yang lha'i bde ba'ang nyams su myong bar byed de /
translated: Having praised him, he will then again experience divine pleasures.

original: de ltar de lha'i bde ba thams cad myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lha'i bde ba thams cad myong ba yin no //
translated: In this way, he will experience all divine pleasures.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum @194a *//
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum @194a *//
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realms of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas mtho ba na gnas ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽sems can dag las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas mtho ba na gnas ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // sems can dag las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the Heaven of the Thirty-Three has a realm called Dwelling in High Places.🔽Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na 'di ltar gang gzhan gyis gsod pa po dag nyi ma gcig tsam du srog gcod pa spong ba'i tshul khrims srung du bcug la /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na 'di ltar gang gzhan gyis gsod pa po dag nyi ma gcig tsam du srog gcod pa spong ba'i tshul khrims srung du bcug la /
translated: He will then notice how some people may have caused others to give up killing for just a single day.

original: 'khor ba las thar pa 'dod pa rnams ma byin par len pa dang / rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs nas 'bras bu chung dur 'gyur ba yang spong du 'jug na /
analyzed: 'khor ba las thar pa 'dod pa rnams ma byin par len pa dang / rgyal po'i chad pas 'jigs nas 'bras bu chung dur 'gyur ba yang spong du 'jug na /
translated: Those who wish to be free from cyclic existence will be made to give up stealing and, out of fear of the king’s punishment, even the smallest amount of theft.

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang na mtho ba'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang na mtho ba'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When they later separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: gnas mtho ba de'ang ri rab kyi steng na mtho ba yin la khyed cag gi las sna tshogs snang ba bzhin gser dang / dngul gyi bkra bas phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas mtho ba de'ang ri rab kyi steng na mtho ba yin la khyed cag gi las sna tshogs snang ba bzhin gser dang / dngul gyi bkra bas phye ba yin no //
translated: “The higher realm is located on top of Mount Sumeru, and it is divided into various sections of gold and silver that appear due to the gods’ various karmic actions.

original: lha rnams mtho ba'i gnas der 'dzegs nas ri rab kyi drung thams cad lta bar byed de /

analyzed: dga' dgur spyod bar byed do // der tshal de lta bu de dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: They play and enjoy themselves.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “In that realm, the following forests will appear:

analyzed: tshal rtag tu rab dga' zhes bya ba dang / tshal rtag tu mngon dga' zhes bya ba dang / tshal sprin ltar dkar @197a *//
translated: the forest called Always Delightful, the forest called Always Appealing, the forest called White Like Clouds,🔽

original: brtsegs zhes bya ba dang / tshal kun nas mngon dga' zhes bya ba dang / tshal zla ba 'dra zhes bya ba dang / tshal gangg'a'i steng du rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brtsegs zhes bya ba dang / tshal kun nas mngon dga' zhes bya ba dang / tshal zla ba 'dra zhes bya ba dang / tshal gangg'a'i steng du rgyu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the forest called Always Delightful, the forest called Always Appealing, the forest called Cloud-like White Mound, the forest called Completely Appealing, the forest called Moon-like, and the forest called Flowing on the Ganges.

original: tshal 'di dag ni ri rtse na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: tshal 'di dag ni ri rtse na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi yin no //
translated: These are the forests of the gods who dwell on the peaks of the mountains.

original: tshal de rnams kyi nang du lha dag bde ba du ma dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: tshal de rnams kyi nang du lha dag bde ba du ma dang ldan zhing /
translated: Within these forests, the gods experience numerous pleasures.

original: bud med kyi dga' ba rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: bud med kyi dga' ba rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: Together with their female companions, they play and enjoy themselves.

original: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
translated: They indulge in all kinds of pleasures.

original: btung ba'i chu bo rnams kyang /
analyzed: btung ba'i chu bo rnams kyang /
translated: There are also rivers of beverages,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

analyzed: chu bo sna tshogs zhes bya ba dang / chu bo lag mthil gyis byug cing reg pa zhes bya ba dang / chu bo ngoms mi myong zhes bya ba dang / chu bo me tog ku mu da dang / autpal skye zhes bya ba ste / chu bo dag gi 'gram gnyis ka ril khebs pa yin no // dngul dang / shel dang / gser gyi shing ljon pa 'bras bu dang ldan zhing me tog dang ldan pa rnams kyis lha'i sa gzhi de dag nyams dga' bar brgyan pa'i sa gzhi der dge ba'i las sna tshogs dang / las byas pa sna tshogs kun nas bslang ba rnams kyis tshal de dag dang /
translated: The rivers are called Various, River of Anointing and Touching with the Palm, River of Unsatisfied Thirst, and River of the Growth of Kumuda and Utpala Flowers.🔽The banks of the rivers are covered with silver, crystal, and golden trees that are laden with fruits and flowers.🔽In those groves, on those riverbanks, and on those delightful grounds adorned with divine trees, the gods enjoy various kinds of virtuous actions and the results of various actions.

original: chu bo da dag dang / sa gzhi de dag dang / zas dang / skom chu bo ltar 'bab pa de dag tu /
analyzed: chu bo da dag dang / sa gzhi de dag dang / zas dang / skom chu bo ltar 'bab pa de dag tu /
translated: In those groves, on those riverbanks, and on those delightful grounds adorned with divine trees, the gods enjoy various kinds of virtuous actions and the results of various actions.

original: lha de rnams lha'i rol mo dang / lha'i gnas chen po dang; thags su btags pa ma yin pa'i lha'i gos rnams kyis dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: lha de rnams lha'i rol mo dang / lha'i gnas chen po dang; thags su btags pa ma yin pa'i lha'i gos rnams kyis dga' bar byed do //
translated: The gods enjoy themselves with divine music, great divine abodes, and divine garments that are not woven.

original: lha de rnams rang las 'od 'byung la /
analyzed: lha de rnams rang las 'od 'byung la /
translated: The gods are self-luminous.

original: sha dang / rus pa dang / rnag khrag dang bral ba /
analyzed: sha dang / rus pa dang / rnag khrag dang bral ba /
translated: They are free from flesh, bones, pus, and blood.

original: @197b lus dang / ngag dang / yid ngal ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: @197b lus dang / ngag dang / yid ngal ba dang bral ba /
translated: They are free from physical, verbal, and mental fatigue.🔽Their bodies and minds are always delighted.

original: lus dang / yid rtag tu kun nas dga' ba rnams ji srid du lus dang / ngag gi 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba shin tu bsil ba rnam par smin pa mchog tu bad ba mtho ris su skye ba nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i las ma zad pa de srid du 'gros 'chos shin dga' bar byed /🔽rtse bar byed /
analyzed: lus dang / yid rtag tu kun nas dga' ba rnams ji srid du lus dang / ngag gi 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba shin tu bsil ba rnam par smin pa mchog tu bad ba mtho ris su skye ba nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i las ma zad pa de srid du 'gros 'chos shin dga' bar byed / rtse bar byed /
translated: “As long as their virtuous actions, which are certain to be experienced in the higher realms, are not exhausted, they will continue to enjoy themselves, take pleasure in each other, and indulge in their desires.🔽They will frolic and play.

original: yongs su sbyod par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su sbyod par byed do //
translated: They will enjoy themselves.

original: de dag las zad de lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag las zad de lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur la /
translated: When their actions are exhausted, they will die and leave their divine world.

original: shi nas kyang las ji ltar byas pa bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba mir 'grub pa'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
analyzed: shi nas kyang las ji ltar byas pa bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba mir 'grub pa'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
translated: After death, they will be born among hell beings, animals, or hungry ghosts, in accordance with their karmic actions.

original: de las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag tu longs spyod can du 'gyur zhing rtag tu shes pa la dga' ba /
analyzed: de las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag tu longs spyod can du 'gyur zhing rtag tu shes pa la dga' ba /
translated: “If, due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, in accordance with their causal karmic actions they will always be wealthy and enjoy being knowledgeable.

original: yid la rgod pa dang / rtsed mo dang / rtse ba dang / yul bzang por skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: yid la rgod pa dang / rtsed mo dang / rtse ba dang / yul bzang por skye bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: They will be restless, play, and enjoy themselves, and they will be born in pleasant places.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will consider the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum na lha rnams kyi gnas gzhan gang zhig yod snyam nas /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum na lha rnams kyi gnas gzhan gang zhig yod snyam nas /
translated: ‘What are the other abodes of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three?’

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice

original: blta na sdug pa gnas pa zhes bya ba'i gnas ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: blta na sdug pa gnas pa zhes bya ba'i gnas ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw the realm called Beautiful to Behold.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur ba @198a *//
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur ba @198a *//
translated: He thought, “By what karma are sentient beings born there?”

original: snyam nas / des brtags na gang tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am /🔽sems can gzhan chus khyer ba'am /
analyzed: snyam nas / des brtags na gang tshul khrims dang ldan pa'am / sems can gzhan chus khyer ba'am /
translated: He noticed that those who are endowed with ethical discipline🔽or who rescue sentient beings from being carried away by water

original: mtshon gyis gsod par bya ba srog phyung zhing nor rdzas sam /
analyzed: mtshon gyis gsod par bya ba srog phyung zhing nor rdzas sam /
translated: or from being killed by weapons,🔽who rescue them from water without regard for their own wealth🔽or for their own lives,

original: bdag nyid la mi lta bar chu nas phyung ba dang / bkres bzhin du lam du 'gro ba na gzhan gyis ma byin par blang ba la rab tu spro ba bskyed kyang len par mi byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid la mi lta bar chu nas phyung ba dang / bkres bzhin du lam du 'gro ba na gzhan gyis ma byin par blang ba la rab tu spro ba bskyed kyang len par mi byed /
translated: who do not steal even when they are hungry and are urged to do so by others while traveling,

original: gzhan yang / phyogs dpen par phyin la 'tsho ba nyam nga bar gyur kyang 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dag ma byin par len par mi byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang / phyogs dpen par phyin la 'tsho ba nyam nga bar gyur kyang 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dag ma byin par len par mi byed cing /
translated: who go to a remote place and, even though they are in a desperate situation, do not take fruit or roots that have not been given to them,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma gus par bslab pa'i gzhi rdul phra mo tsam ral ba la'ang 'jigs par lta na de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro grong khyer chen po blta na sdug tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma gus par bslab pa'i gzhi rdul phra mo tsam ral ba la'ang 'jigs par lta na de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro grong khyer chen po blta na sdug tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If those who are endowed with moral discipline, but who are disrespectful, are afraid of even the smallest infraction of the precepts, then when they separate from their bodies, they will go to the happy realms and be born in the great city of Sudarśana.

original: grong khyer de'ang dpag tshad khri yod la; khyams khris legs par rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer de'ang dpag tshad khri yod la; khyams khris legs par rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: That city is ten thousand yojanas in size and is divided into ten parts.

analyzed: grong khyer de'i sa gzhi dzambu chu bo'i gser las byas la /
translated: The ground of that city is made of gold from the Jambū River.

original: kun nas khang pa chen po bee d'urya las byas pa dang / gzhan yang dngul las byas pa dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: kun nas khang pa chen po bee d'urya las byas pa dang / gzhan yang dngul las byas pa dang / gzhan yang /

analyzed: dzambu chu bo'i gser las byas pa dang / mthon ka sna tshogs las byas pa dang / gzhan yang /

analyzed: rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i khri dag gis bkra bar phye ba yin no //

analyzed: de dag gi srang yang kun nas shin tu rnam par phye ba yin la /

analyzed: bzhi mdo dang / ba gam dang / sgo dang / pu shu'i rtse mo dang / khang bzang @198b gi ris shin tu rnam par phye ba yin no //

original: khang pa de dag kyang nyi ma gang med kyang /
analyzed: khang pa de dag kyang nyi ma gang med kyang /
translated: Even when the sun is not shining,

original: sgron ma lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgron ma lta bur 'gyur te /

analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma med na sgron ma gsal bar byed pa de ltar nyi ma med kyang khang pa'i mchog de rnams las de ltar 'od 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as when the sun is not shining, a lamp illuminates, in the same way, even when the sun is not shining, light comes from those excellent houses.

analyzed: grong khyer de dag kun nas tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal de rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin te /

analyzed: tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal kha cig bee d'urya las byas pa dag la mu tig gi dra bas bres / kha cig gser gyi shing ljon pa dag la dngul gyi dra bas bres /

analyzed: kha cig dngul gyi shing ljon pa dag la gser gyi dril bu g-yer ka'i sgra 'byin /
translated: Some have silver trees that ring with the sound of golden bells.

analyzed: kha cig ni rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa'i skyed mos tshal bkra ba yin la /
translated: Some are groves of trees of the seven precious substances.

original: kha cig dpag bsam gyi shing yin te /
analyzed: kha cig dpag bsam gyi shing yin te /

analyzed: lha gang dag gi yid la bsams pa de tshal de dag las thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshal kha cig aanda rnyil dang / bee d'urya las byas pa yin te /

analyzed: de na gser gyi bya rnams sgra snyan pa sna tshogs 'byin la / gser gyi tshal gang yin pa de na dngul gyi bya rnams skad snyan pa 'byin cing rtse /

analyzed: mthon ka'i tshal gang yin pa de na bya padma r'a ga'i mdog tu 'dug pa rnams skad snyan pa 'byin cing rtse /
translated: In the groves of emerald, birds the color of red lotuses sing sweetly and play.

analyzed: gser gyi tshal gang yin pa de na bya lus sna tshogs 'dres pa rnams skad snyan pa 'byin cing rtse ste /
translated: In the golden groves, birds with various mixed-colored bodies sing sweetly and play.

translated: In this way, the city of Sudarśana is beautiful with its parks.🔽The streets and golden houses are adorned with silver pillars and beryl trees.🔽The golden streets have beryl pillars and are adorned with golden trees and houses.

original: srang dang / khyim 'dres pas mdzes par byas pa gang yin pa de na bya gser gyi mdog can yod de /
analyzed: srang dang / khyim 'dres pas mdzes par byas pa gang yin pa de na bya gser gyi mdog can yod de /
translated: The streets and houses are adorned with mixed colors. There are birds with golden feathers.

original: grong khyer blta na sdug gang dang / gang du snang ba de dang / de dpe med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: grong khyer blta na sdug gang dang / gang du snang ba de dang / de dpe med par mthong ngo //
translated: Wherever one looks in the city of Sudarśana, one sees incomparable beauty.

analyzed: grong khyer de'ang kun nas tshal chen po bzhi rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin te /🔽'di lta ste /

analyzed: dra ba'i phreng ba dang / shing chen po dang / 'od gsal ba dang / mthong na dga' bas so //
translated: the garland of nets, the great tree, the bright light, and the delightful to behold.

original: tshal thams cad dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu yod de /
analyzed: tshal thams cad dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu yod de /
translated: All the forests are two hundred and fifty yojanas in size.
