analyzed: tshal de thams cad na chu bo chen po khri yod pa gser gyi padmas khebs pa yin no //
translated: In all of them there are ten thousand great rivers covered with golden lotuses.

original: chu bo de dag shin tu nyams dga' ba yin zhing 'gram gnyis ka zhig pa med la /
analyzed: chu bo de dag shin tu nyams dga' ba yin zhing 'gram gnyis ka zhig pa med la /
translated: Those rivers are very delightful, their banks are not eroded,

original: de dag gser dang / dngul dang / shel dang / aanda rnyil dang / shing ljon pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gser dang / dngul dang / shel dang / aanda rnyil dang / shing ljon pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin no //

analyzed: tshal chen po de dag bung ba 'dab ma bee d'u rya la lus dngul du 'dug pa'i tshogs rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yin te /
translated: Those great forests are adorned with flocks of birds with beryl wings and silver bodies.

analyzed: gang bung ba rnams kyi sgra snyan pa'i drung na mi'i gling bu'i sgras bcu drug gi char yang mi phod @199b do; ;bee d'u rya'i shing ljon pa rnams la 'bras bu gser gyi mdog can shin tu dri zhim zhing khar snyib pas ches lhag pa'i ro dag yod
translated: The fruits of the beryl trees are golden in color, very fragrant, and have an even sweeter taste.

original: la / 'bras bu rnams kyi dri gang yin pa dpag tshad du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: la / 'bras bu rnams kyi dri gang yin pa dpag tshad du 'byung ngo //
translated: The fragrance of the fruits spreads for a league.

original: bya rnams ngo bo nyid kyis rgyags pa yin la /
analyzed: bya rnams ngo bo nyid kyis rgyags pa yin la /
translated: The birds are naturally intoxicated,

original: de nas dri gang yin pa des brgya 'gyur du shin tu rgyags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dri gang yin pa des brgya 'gyur du shin tu rgyags par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gser gyi shing ljon pa gang yin pa de rnams la dngul gyi 'bras bu lha'i dri dang / mdog dang / ro lnga dang ldan pa dag 'byung /
translated: The golden trees bear silver fruits with the fragrance, color, and five tastes of the gods.

original: shing ljon pa bee d'urya'i sdong po dang / gser gyi 'dab ma yod pa gang yin pa de rnams la 'bras bu kha dog sna tshogs yod pa dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: shing ljon pa bee d'urya'i sdong po dang / gser gyi 'dab ma yod pa gang yin pa de rnams la 'bras bu kha dog sna tshogs yod pa dag 'byung ste /
translated: The trees with beryl trunks and golden leaves bear fruits of various colors.

original: de ltar tshal kha dog rnam pa du ma /
analyzed: de ltar tshal kha dog rnam pa du ma /
translated: In this way, the forest is surrounded by many colors,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dpe med pa gzhan dang mi 'dra bas /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dpe med pa gzhan dang mi 'dra bas /

original: lha gzhan de dag srin bu me khyer bzhin gsal ba med do //
analyzed: lha gzhan de dag srin bu me khyer bzhin gsal ba med do //
translated: The other gods are as dim as fireflies in their presence.’

original: lha'i ris der lha der lha de skyes ma thag tu lha mo de dag thams cad lha de ga la ba der rgyug cing skyes ma thag tu rgyan thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i ris der lha der lha de skyes ma thag tu lha mo de dag thams cad lha de ga la ba der rgyug cing skyes ma thag tu rgyan thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: “As soon as the gods are born in that realm, all the goddesses will rush to them, and as soon as they are born, all their ornaments will appear.

original: gang gi gtsug gi nor bu mthon ka chen po'i 'od kyis dpag chad dag tu 'od snang bar byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi gtsug gi nor bu mthon ka chen po'i 'od kyis dpag chad dag tu 'od snang bar byed pa bzhin du /
translated: “The gods’ crowns are adorned with great maṇḍala jewels that shine with light for a distance of one league.

original: 'od gang gis gzhan mtho ris na gnas pa'i 'od de dag thams cad dang / phyi rol gyi nor bu de dag thams cad der ltar zil gyis @208a *//🔽gnon par byed do //🔽ji ltar nyi ma shar bas srin bu me khyer rnams kyi 'od zil gyil gnon par byed pa de bzhin du lha de dag zil gyis gnon par byed do; ;de nas skyes ma thag tu rin po che sna bdun gyi cod pan dpag tshad brgyar 'od 'phro ba
analyzed: 'od gang gis gzhan mtho ris na gnas pa'i 'od de dag thams cad dang / phyi rol gyi nor bu de dag thams cad der ltar zil gyis @208a *// gnon par byed do // ji ltar nyi ma shar bas srin bu me khyer rnams kyi 'od zil gyil gnon par byed pa de bzhin du lha de dag zil gyis gnon par byed do; ;de nas skyes ma thag tu rin po che sna bdun gyi cod pan dpag tshad brgyar 'od 'phro ba
translated: The light of the gods is outshone by the light of the newly born god, and the light of all the jewels in the external world is also outshone.🔽Just as the light of fireflies is outshone by the rising sun, so the light of the gods is outshone by the light of the newly born god.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Immediately after birth, a crown ornament of the seven precious substances appears, shining with light for a hundred leagues.

original: 'od kun gyis brgyan cing 'od zer 'byung la /
analyzed: 'od kun gyis brgyan cing 'od zer 'byung la /
translated: It is adorned with all kinds of light and emits light rays.

original: gang gi 'od sngon po dang; ;ser po dang / btsod ka dang / ljang khu dang / dkar po dag 'byung ba 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi 'od sngon po dang; ;ser po dang / btsod ka dang / ljang khu dang / dkar po dag 'byung ba 'gyur ro //
translated: Blue, yellow, red, green, and white light emerges from it.

original: de'i 'og tu rin po che sna bdun gyi mgul rgyan dpag tshad brgyar 'od 'phro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rin po che sna bdun gyi mgul rgyan dpag tshad brgyar 'od 'phro ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, a necklace of the seven precious substances appears, shining with light for a hundred leagues.

original: de ltar de'i 'og tu rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyan phreng 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i 'og tu phreng ba 'chang ba rdo rjes brgyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de'i 'og tu rin po che sna bdun gyi rgyan phreng 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de'i 'og tu phreng ba 'chang ba rdo rjes brgyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, a garland of the seven precious substances will appear.🔽After that, a garland of vajras will appear.

original: de'i 'og tu da'i rked pa'i phreng rgyan ji ltar 'ja'i kha dog lta bur skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i 'og tu de'i lham rin chen sna bdun gyis spras pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu da'i rked pa'i phreng rgyan ji ltar 'ja'i kha dog lta bur skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de'i 'og tu de'i lham rin chen sna bdun gyis spras pa /
translated: After that, a garland of fire-colored jewels will appear.

original: 'od sna tshogs dang ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur te; shugs gang gis rim pa 'di de ltar 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: 'od sna tshogs dang ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur te; shugs gang gis rim pa 'di de ltar 'gro ba ni /
translated: After that, a pair of shoes will appear, adorned with the seven precious substances and endowed with various lights.🔽The speed with which these things appear is as follows:

original: gang gi tshe lha de 'di snyam du 'di ltar bdag che ge mo zhig tu nam mkha' las 'gro'o snyam du bsams nas bskyed ma thag tu lha yul du 'byung ba'i lham des lha de bteg ste nam mkha' la khyer nas gnas der 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha de 'di snyam du 'di ltar bdag che ge mo zhig tu nam mkha' las 'gro'o snyam du bsams nas bskyed ma thag tu lha yul du 'byung ba'i lham des lha de bteg ste nam mkha' la khyer nas gnas der 'gro ste /
translated: When the god thinks, ‘I will now fly through the sky to such and such a place,’ the shoes that appear in the god realm will immediately lift the god into the sky and carry him to the desired location.

original: lus ngal ba med cing gnod pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus ngal ba med cing gnod pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The god will not feel any physical fatigue and will be free from all harm.

original: gang de'i 'og tu de'i @208b gos thags su btags pa ma yin pa rin po che sna tshogs las byas pa 'od gsal ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽gang gi 'od kyis lha'i ris nyams dga' ba des /
analyzed: gang de'i 'og tu de'i @208b gos thags su btags pa ma yin pa rin po che sna tshogs las byas pa 'od gsal ba 'byung bar 'gyur te / gang gi 'od kyis lha'i ris nyams dga' ba des /
translated: “After that, the garments of the gods will appear, not woven by humans but made of various precious substances and shining with light.

original: de nas yang shin tu nyams dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas yang shin tu nyams dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The light of those garments will make the divine realms even more delightful.

original: lha de skyes ma thag tu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: lha de skyes ma thag tu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “The gods will then think, ‘As soon as we are born here, we will experience the effects of our past actions.

original: las byas pa gang gis bdag 'dir skyes shig gu snyam nas /
analyzed: las byas pa gang gis bdag 'dir skyes shig gu snyam nas /
translated: What actions have caused us to be born here?

original: des brtags na las legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i gzhi dzambu gling de nas bdag shi ste /🔽der gang bya ba legs par bya ba'am /🔽nyes par byas pa'am /🔽nyes par byas pa de 'dir nye bar spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des brtags na las legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa'i gzhi dzambu gling de nas bdag shi ste / der gang bya ba legs par bya ba'am / nyes par byas pa'am / nyes par byas pa de 'dir nye bar spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: When we examine this, we will see that we died in Jambudvīpa, the land of good and bad actions,🔽and that we are now experiencing the effects of our good and bad actions.

original: de dag gis legs par byas pa'i las kyi rgyu des bdag 'dir skyes te /
analyzed: de dag gis legs par byas pa'i las kyi rgyu des bdag 'dir skyes te /
translated: We have been born here because of the causes of our good actions.

original: rgyu med pas ni ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: rgyu med pas ni ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: This is not due to any lack of causes.’

original: de de ltar bsams pa dang thang cig lha mo gzugs dang / lang tsho phun sum tshogs pa ji snyed pa thams cad nyid nye bar 'ong bar byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar bsams pa dang thang cig lha mo gzugs dang / lang tsho phun sum tshogs pa ji snyed pa thams cad nyid nye bar 'ong bar byed de /
translated: “When he thinks this, all the goddesses with perfect bodies and youth will come to him.

original: de dag gi rgyan gyi sgra ji ltar mi yul na sil snyan yan lag lnga dang shin tu ldan pa de dag gi sgra 'byung ba de ltar de rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar byed do; ;de dag gi dri'ang dpag tshad gnyis su gang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyan gyi sgra ji ltar mi yul na sil snyan yan lag lnga dang shin tu ldan pa de dag gi sgra 'byung ba de ltar de rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar byed do; ;de dag gi dri'ang dpag tshad gnyis su gang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The sound of their ornaments will be like the sound of the five types of instruments in the human realm. The scent of their bodies will spread for two leagues,

original: dri gang gis me tog thams cad kyi dri zil gyis gnon par 'gyur /
analyzed: dri gang gis me tog thams cad kyi dri zil gyis gnon par 'gyur /
translated: and their scent will overpower the scent of all flowers.

original: de dag gi gzugs dang / lang tsho sngon ma byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhing tshim pa dang / dga' ba 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag gi gzugs dang / lang tsho sngon ma byung ba 'byung bar 'gyur zhing tshim pa dang / dga' ba 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Their bodies and youth will be unlike anything that has come before, and they will experience satisfaction and joy.

original: sngon gyi gos kyi yon tan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi gos kyi yon tan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The qualities of their garments will also be unlike anything that has come before.

original: lha de'i legs par byas pa'i las des /
analyzed: lha de'i legs par byas pa'i las des /
translated: “The gods’ past positive actions

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: will cause

original: @209a *// nyi ma shar ba'i nyi ma'i 'od kyis me tog thams cad rab tu rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar lha de'i 'od byung bas lha mo de dag thams cad kyi gzugs rab tu rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @209a *// nyi ma shar ba'i nyi ma'i 'od kyis me tog thams cad rab tu rgyas par 'gyur ba de ltar lha de'i 'od byung bas lha mo de dag thams cad kyi gzugs rab tu rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the light of the rising sun causes all flowers to bloom, the light of the gods causes the bodies of the goddesses to bloom.

original: de dag dang de phrad nas 'dzum zhing dga' ba dag gis rtsed mo byed do //🔽de dag gis de pang du blangs te tshal dang nye ba'i tshal ga la ba de nyid du 'gros sdug gus khyer zhing lha de'i mdun du sil snyan sna tshogs dang rgod pa'i sgras dga' bar byed pa de dag lha la lta zhing tshal dang /
analyzed: de dag dang de phrad nas 'dzum zhing dga' ba dag gis rtsed mo byed do // de dag gis de pang du blangs te tshal dang nye ba'i tshal ga la ba de nyid du 'gros sdug gus khyer zhing lha de'i mdun du sil snyan sna tshogs dang rgod pa'i sgras dga' bar byed pa de dag lha la lta zhing tshal dang /
translated: When they meet, they smile and play with each other.🔽The goddesses take the gods into their laps and, with beautiful steps, they proceed to the forests and parks.

original: nye ba'i tshal de dag ga la ba der gdong bar byed do //🔽lha de'i gnas su tshal 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye ba'i tshal de dag ga la ba der gdong bar byed do // lha de'i gnas su tshal 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: With various musical instruments and playful sounds, they delight the gods and, looking at the gods, they proceed to the forests and parks.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The following forests and parks appear in the gods’ realm:

original: padma rmad byung gi tshal yod de /
analyzed: padma rmad byung gi tshal yod de /
translated: The Forest of Wonderful Lotuses.

original: tshal de na gang gi tshe lha de 'jug pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: tshal de na gang gi tshe lha de 'jug pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the gods enter that forest,

original: gom pa 'dor ba'i sa dag la padma sdong bu ni bee d'urya /
analyzed: gom pa 'dor ba'i sa dag la padma sdong bu ni bee d'urya /
translated: The ground where they walk is adorned with lotus flowers, with stems of beryl,

original: myu gu ni rdo rje /
analyzed: myu gu ni rdo rje /
translated: stalks of diamond,

original: snying po ni gser /
analyzed: snying po ni gser /
translated: petals of gold,

analyzed: lo ma ni 'jam zhing 'dab ma 'jam pa dang bung ba'i tshogs kyis mdzes par byed pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: and soft leaves and petals beautified by swarms of bees.

original: de dag la lha de'i rkang pa gnyis 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de dag la lha de'i rkang pa gnyis 'jog par byed do //
translated: The gods place their two feet on these lotuses.

analyzed: de nas rkang pa bteg pa dang padma gzhan dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhing snga ma zhum par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they lift their feet, other lotuses appear, and the previous ones disappear.

original: de padma'i tshal de nas sbrang rtsi'i chu'i tshal zhes bya ba sbrang rtsi'i chu'i tshal ga la ba der 'dod par byed de /
analyzed: de padma'i tshal de nas sbrang rtsi'i chu'i tshal zhes bya ba sbrang rtsi'i chu'i tshal ga la ba der 'dod par byed de /
translated: “From the lotus grove, the gods will proceed to the forest known as Honey Water.

original: tshal de na lha'i shing ljon pa gser las byas pa de dag thams cad las lha'i rgun chang 'dzag ste /
analyzed: tshal de na lha'i shing ljon pa gser las byas pa de dag thams cad las lha'i rgun chang 'dzag ste /
translated: In that forest, all the divine trees made of gold drip divine wine.

original: lha'i ro @209b dang / dri dang ldan pa'i rgun chang de dag la lha'i mchog de 'thung bar byed de /
analyzed: lha'i ro @209b dang / dri dang ldan pa'i rgun chang de dag la lha'i mchog de 'thung bar byed de /
translated: The gods will drink this wine, which has a divine taste and smell.

original: myos pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i sbrang rtsi de dag la lha rnams 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: myos pa'i skyon dang bral ba'i sbrang rtsi de dag la lha rnams 'thung bar byed do //
translated: The gods drink the honey that is free from the fault of intoxication.

analyzed: dri dang / ro sngon ma byung ba de de dag la 'thungs nas kyang tshal gsum mdzes zhes bya ba ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: Having drunk the honey that has a fragrance and taste never experienced before, they go to the forest called Three Beautiful Groves.

original: der gsum mdzes dpe med pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: der gsum mdzes dpe med pa 'byung ste /
translated: There, the incomparable Three Beautiful Groves appears.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: bya dang / bung ba'i tshogs sgra 'byin pa dang / gzhan dang mi 'dra ba'i sgra dang / lha mo rol mo byed pa 'byung ngo // lha'i mchog de tshal gsum mdzes de na /
translated: The sound of flocks of birds and bees resound, and the sound of goddesses playing music arises.🔽Those supreme gods,

original: skyed mos tshal nas /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal nas /
translated: in that Three Beautiful Groves,

original: skyed mos tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal nas nye ba'i tshal dang / padma'i rdzing nas padma'i rdzing dang / lteng ka nas lteng kar dga' bar byed /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal nas nye ba'i tshal dang / padma'i rdzing nas padma'i rdzing dang / lteng ka nas lteng kar dga' bar byed /
translated: from park to park, from pleasure grove to pleasure grove, from lotus pond to lotus pond, from pool to pool, they enjoy themselves,

original: rtse bar byed /
analyzed: rtse bar byed /
translated: play,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and make love.

original: bya sgra sna tshogs 'byin pa la nyan cing dbang po lnga yul lnga la tshim pa med pa'i yid sred pa'i mes sreg pa na /
analyzed: bya sgra sna tshogs 'byin pa la nyan cing dbang po lnga yul lnga la tshim pa med pa'i yid sred pa'i mes sreg pa na /
translated: Listening to the various sounds of the birds, the mind that is never satisfied with the five sense faculties and their five objects is burned by the fire of craving.

original: ji srid du de'i legs par byas pa'i las ma zad pa de srid du dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: ji srid du de'i legs par byas pa'i las ma zad pa de srid du dga' bar byed do //
translated: As long as his positive actions are not exhausted, he will continue to enjoy himself.

original: de las de zad nas de nas yang lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las de zad nas de nas yang lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: When his actions are exhausted, he will die and leave that god realm.

original: shi nas kyang las kyi thag pas bcings pa rang gis byas pa'i las rnams kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang; dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang las kyi thag pas bcings pa rang gis byas pa'i las rnams kyis sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang; dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, he will be bound by the ropes of karma and be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals due to his own past actions.

original: gal te mi'i so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi'i so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
translated: If, due to karmic actions to be experienced by humans, he is born among humans,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par de @210a *//
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de @210a *//
translated: he will, in accordance with his causal actions,

original: gzugs dang / rigs dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs shing kun nas mchog tu bde ba dang ldan pa dang / rang dang 'brel ba las 'tsho zhing gzhan la rag ma lus pa dang / rang 'dod pa bzhin spyod cing nad med pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / rigs dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs shing kun nas mchog tu bde ba dang ldan pa dang / rang dang 'brel ba las 'tsho zhing gzhan la rag ma lus pa dang / rang 'dod pa bzhin spyod cing nad med pa dang /
translated: They will have perfect bodies, perfect families, and perfect qualities, and they will be endowed with perfect happiness. They will live in a way that is independent of others, and they will not be dependent on others. They will be able to act as they wish, and they will be free from disease.🔽They will be free from harm, free from thorns, and very wealthy.

original: gnod pa med pa dang / tsher ma med pa dang / shin tu 'byor ba dang / de bzhin du gsum ldan gyi dus su'am /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa dang / tsher ma med pa dang / shin tu 'byor ba dang / de bzhin du gsum ldan gyi dus su'am /
translated: They will be like that during the three junctures of the day.

original: de bzhin du gtso bo'i nang du'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtso bo'i nang du'am /
translated: They will be like that in the inner circle.

original: de bzhin du rgyal srid phyed la dbang ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal srid phyed la dbang ba'am /
translated: They will be like that when they rule half a kingdom.

original: rgyal tshab bam /
analyzed: rgyal tshab bam /
translated: They will be like that when they are a regent.

original: tshong pa 'byor ba'i mchog nor dang / 'bru dang / gser dngul thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshong pa 'byor ba'i mchog nor dang / 'bru dang / gser dngul thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: They will be like that when they are wealthy merchants who possess all kinds of wealth, grain, gold, and silver.”

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then continue to examine the realms of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas shing gseb na gnas pa zhes ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas shing gseb na gnas pa zhes ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, he will then see that the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have a realm called Forest of Trees.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there,

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: he will examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: gang gis rkun po chad pas bcad par 'os pa bzung ba /
analyzed: gang gis rkun po chad pas bcad par 'os pa bzung ba /
translated: He will then notice how some people may arrest a thief who deserves to be punished by law.

original: gang 'jig rten pha rol la 'jigs pa'i bsam bas; de la chad pas mi gcod cing gnod par mi byed pa dang / pha rol gzhan gyis rkun po bzung ba de'ang sems can la phan par 'dod pa /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pha rol la 'jigs pa'i bsam bas; de la chad pas mi gcod cing gnod par mi byed pa dang / pha rol gzhan gyis rkun po bzung ba de'ang sems can la phan par 'dod pa /
translated: If they do not punish or harm the thief out of fear of the next world, and if they release the thief who was caught by others, with the wish to benefit beings,

original: byams par gzhol ba'i sems @210b dang ldan pa'i bsam pas thar bar byed pa dang / ma la'ang mal cha dang / na ba'i rkyen gyi gso sman dang / yo byad sbyin par byed cing gong ma'i rdzas bsgrubs pa de dag rku ba'i sems kyis mi rku ba dang /
analyzed: byams par gzhol ba'i sems @210b dang ldan pa'i bsam pas thar bar byed pa dang / ma la'ang mal cha dang / na ba'i rkyen gyi gso sman dang / yo byad sbyin par byed cing gong ma'i rdzas bsgrubs pa de dag rku ba'i sems kyis mi rku ba dang /
translated: and if they give their mother a bed, medicine, and other necessities, and if they do not steal the property of others with the intention to steal,

original: tshig 'jam zhing tshig nyung la phan par smra ba dang / nyin gcig bzhin sangs rgyas la gus par phyag 'tshal zhing /
analyzed: tshig 'jam zhing tshig nyung la phan par smra ba dang / nyin gcig bzhin sangs rgyas la gus par phyag 'tshal zhing /
translated: speaking gently, speaking little, and speaking beneficially;🔽paying homage to the Buddha every day with devotion,

original: sangs rgyas la spos sam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la spos sam /
translated: offering incense,

original: me tog gam /
analyzed: me tog gam /
translated: flowers,

original: bdug pa dag phul te phyag 'tshal la /
analyzed: bdug pa dag phul te phyag 'tshal la /
translated: and incense for fumigation to the Buddha, and paying homage to him;🔽recollecting his qualities;

original: de'i yon tan yang rjes su dran pa dang / bla ma la lus kyis kyang gus par byed cing /
analyzed: de'i yon tan yang rjes su dran pa dang / bla ma la lus kyis kyang gus par byed cing /
translated: respecting the guru with one’s body;🔽quickly rising;🔽respectfully paying homage;🔽always speaking pleasantly;

original: myur du ldang ba dang / gus par phyag 'tshal ba dang / rtag tu snyan par smra ba dang; sdig pa'i grogs po mthong na shin tu 'dre bar mi byed la /
analyzed: myur du ldang ba dang / gus par phyag 'tshal ba dang / rtag tu snyan par smra ba dang; sdig pa'i grogs po mthong na shin tu 'dre bar mi byed la /
translated: not associating with sinful friends;

original: de dag dang lhan cig dga' ba dang / 'gro ba dang / phrad pa dang / mngon par smra bar mi byed /
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig dga' ba dang / 'gro ba dang / phrad pa dang / mngon par smra bar mi byed /
translated: not delighting in, going to, meeting, or conversing with them;

original: mi nyon mongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mi nyon mongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: not delighting in those who are not free of afflictive emotions;

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa /
translated: not delighting in those who are not noble;

original: 'jig rten pas spangs pa rnams dang lhan cig dga' bar mi byed la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas spangs pa rnams dang lhan cig dga' bar mi byed la /
translated: not delighting in those who are rejected by the world;

original: thad kar lta zhing 'dug par mi byed pa dang / rgan po la legs par lta ste; rgan po shes pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thad kar lta zhing 'dug par mi byed pa dang / rgan po la legs par lta ste; rgan po shes pa dang ldan pa /
translated: They look properly at the elderly and the wise.

original: sems can la byams shing pha rol gdung bar mi byed pa /
analyzed: sems can la byams shing pha rol gdung bar mi byed pa /
translated: They are loving toward sentient beings and do not harm others.

original: 'jig rten kun gyis bkur ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyis bkur ba /
translated: They are respected by the whole world.

original: snyan par smra ba /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba /
translated: They speak pleasantly.🔽They are gentle in speech.

original: 'jam por smra ba dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing; yang dag par rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul khrims kyang yod pa dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba rnams la rgyu med par 'tsho bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jam por smra ba dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing; yang dag par rnam par 'byed pa'i tshul khrims kyang yod pa dang / bran pho dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba rnams la rgyu med par 'tsho bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: They do not live off their servants, slaves, workers, and employees without cause.

original: @211a *// bza' ba mang du mi za ba dang / 'dod dgur 'gro ba'i tshul du mi byed pa dang / gnod pa'i tshul med pa dang / glo bur du mi 'khrug pa dang / shan pa dang / nyo tshong dang / khyi yis 'tsho ba dang /
analyzed: @211a *// bza' ba mang du mi za ba dang / 'dod dgur 'gro ba'i tshul du mi byed pa dang / gnod pa'i tshul med pa dang / glo bur du mi 'khrug pa dang / shan pa dang / nyo tshong dang / khyi yis 'tsho ba dang /
translated: They do not eat a lot. They do not act in a way that is contrary to their wishes. They do not act harmfully. They do not suddenly become angry. They do not live off butchers, trade, or dogs.

original: snyis 'tsho ba dri ma dang bcas pa la sogs pa dang / nyo tshong la sogs pa chos ma yin pa dang yang dag par 'brel bar mi byed pa dang / chang 'tshong gi khyim du dga' ba med pa dang / bud med la rag las shing sdig pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: snyis 'tsho ba dri ma dang bcas pa la sogs pa dang / nyo tshong la sogs pa chos ma yin pa dang yang dag par 'brel bar mi byed pa dang / chang 'tshong gi khyim du dga' ba med pa dang / bud med la rag las shing sdig pa byed pa dang /
translated: He does not engage in commerce and so forth that is not in accord with the Dharma. He does not take pleasure in the home of a liquor seller. He does not rely on women who engage in negative actions.

original: spyod pa nyams pa dang / rtab rtab por mi 'gro ba dang / smra ba na gzhan gyi gsang mi shor ba dang / grogs po rnams la glags lta zhing gsang ste dgra mi byed pa dang / gnad btsal te rgyal po la mi smra ba dang /
analyzed: spyod pa nyams pa dang / rtab rtab por mi 'gro ba dang / smra ba na gzhan gyi gsang mi shor ba dang / grogs po rnams la glags lta zhing gsang ste dgra mi byed pa dang / gnad btsal te rgyal po la mi smra ba dang /
translated: He does not go about in a way that is degenerate in conduct or in a way that is agitated. When he speaks, he does not divulge the secrets of others. He does not look for opportunities to harm his friends or to keep secrets from them. He does not speak to the king about others’ weak points.

original: gzhan gyi zhing rnams la skye ba'i ldum ra mthong na bdag nyid kyir mi byed pa dang / yul mi'i dpya nar ma drug cha gcig 'bul ba las lhag par mi 'bebs pa dang / gzhan gyi zhing dang / chu dang / skal ba byin pa mi 'phrog pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhing rnams la skye ba'i ldum ra mthong na bdag nyid kyir mi byed pa dang / yul mi'i dpya nar ma drug cha gcig 'bul ba las lhag par mi 'bebs pa dang / gzhan gyi zhing dang / chu dang / skal ba byin pa mi 'phrog pa dang /
translated: When he sees a garden on someone else’s field, he does not take it for his own. He does not impose more than the standard one-sixth share of the harvest as tax on the people of the land. He does not steal the fields, water, or property that has been given to others.

original: mtshan mo'am / nyin mo gzhan gyi 'bras bu mi 'phrog pa dang / rku sems thams cad dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan mo'am / nyin mo gzhan gyi 'bras bu mi 'phrog pa dang / rku sems thams cad dang bral ba'am /
translated: He does not steal the fruits of others’ labor at night or during the day, and he is free from all thoughts of stealing.

original: re re dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: re re dang bral ba'am /
translated: He is free from each of these,

original: nyung ngur bral ba yin te /
analyzed: nyung ngur bral ba yin te /
translated: and he is free from a small amount of these.

original: ji ltar na nyung ngur bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nyung ngur bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is he free from a small amount of these?

original: las kyi nyer bsdogs mi byed pa dang / las bar ma dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: las kyi nyer bsdogs mi byed pa dang / las bar ma dang bral ba yin te /
translated: He does not prepare to commit a misdeed, and he is free from a middling misdeed.

original: gang byas pa 'chags par byed cing skyon du rtsi la mi byed pa dang / chen po dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: gang byas pa 'chags par byed cing skyon du rtsi la mi byed pa dang / chen po dang bral ba yin te /
translated: He confesses what he has done, and he does not consider it to be a fault. He is free from a great misdeed.

original: las kyi nyer @211b bsdogs mi byed pa dang / de bzhin byed du mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: las kyi nyer @211b bsdogs mi byed pa dang / de bzhin byed du mi 'jug cing /
translated: He does not prepare to commit a misdeed, and he does not allow others to do so.

original: gzhan gyis byas nas kyang 'chags su 'jug pa dang / so sor rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pa dang / mi ngan pa de rnam pa spong bar byed la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas nas kyang 'chags su 'jug pa dang / so sor rjes su yi rang bar mi byed pa dang / mi ngan pa de rnam pa spong bar byed la /
translated: He makes others confess what they have done, and he does not rejoice in it. He abandons that bad person.

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po byed pa de chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i 'bras bu la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po byed pa de chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i 'bras bu la spyod pa yin te /
translated: He experiences the results of a small, middling, or great misdeed as small, middling, or great.

original: de ltar legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa /
analyzed: de ltar legs par byas pa'i las kyi mtha' spyod pa /
translated: Thus, one should practice the right limits of action.

original: nyes par byed pa rnam par spangs pa de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes par byed pa rnam par spangs pa de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Thus, those who engage in positive actions and avoid negative ones will, upon separating from their bodies, go to the joyous higher realms and be born among the gods in the realm of the gods who dwell in the midst of trees.

original: de der skyes nas kyang lha'i lus sha dang / rus pa dang / rnag khrag dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: de der skyes nas kyang lha'i lus sha dang / rus pa dang / rnag khrag dang bral ba yin te /
translated: “Once born there, they will assume a divine body free from flesh, bones, pus, and blood.

original: gang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba de'i dpe bya bar yang sla ba ma yin mod kyi /🔽cung zad cig dper bya na /
analyzed: gang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba de'i dpe bya bar yang sla ba ma yin mod kyi / cung zad cig dper bya na /
translated: The experience of their bliss is not easy to illustrate.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Nevertheless, I will give a brief example.🔽“

original: sems can gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos su skye ba dang / gang gser gyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyad par gang yin pa dang / lha'i bde ba myong ba'i mi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi pa'i rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa'i khyad par gang yin pa'i khyad par de ni shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de'i dper cung zad bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gang sems can dmyal ba yang sos su skye ba dang / gang gser gyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i khyad par gang yin pa dang / lha'i bde ba myong ba'i mi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi pa'i rin po che sna bdun dang ldan pa'i khyad par gang yin pa'i khyad par de ni shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de'i dper cung zad bya ba yin no //
translated: The difference between a being born in the Reviving Hell and a golden wheel-turning king, and the difference between a human experiencing divine bliss and a wheel-turning king possessing the seven jewels of the four continents, is like a small fraction of the example of the god dwelling in the forest.

original: shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de ri rab kyi steng dpag tshad sum stong yod par dpal dang ldan pa rin po che sna bdun gyi lha'i shing ljon pa dang / chu bos mdzes par byas pa lta bur /
analyzed: shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de ri rab kyi steng dpag tshad sum stong yod par dpal dang ldan pa rin po che sna bdun gyi lha'i shing ljon pa dang / chu bos mdzes par byas pa lta bur /
translated: That god dwelling in the forest, on top of Mount Meru, three thousand yojanas high, is glorious, like a divine tree of the seven precious substances beautified by streams.

original: phyogs de na tshal kun spyod @212a *//
analyzed: phyogs de na tshal kun spyod @212a *//
translated: In that direction, the forest is delightful.

original: ces bya ba gser gyi shing ljon pa yod pa der 'di ltar lha rnams kyi sems la gang du bdag cag 'gro bar bya ba der shing ljon pa dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du de ltar 'ong bar shog cig snyam mo //
analyzed: ces bya ba gser gyi shing ljon pa yod pa der 'di ltar lha rnams kyi sems la gang du bdag cag 'gro bar bya ba der shing ljon pa dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du de ltar 'ong bar shog cig snyam mo //
translated: “When the gods think, ‘We should go to such and such a place,’ the wish-fulfilling trees will immediately follow them there.

original: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams gar 'gro ba de dag gi phyi bzhin du de ltar 'ong ste /
analyzed: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams gar 'gro ba de dag gi phyi bzhin du de ltar 'ong ste /
translated: As soon as the gods think of going somewhere, the trees that dwell in the forest will follow them there.

original: dper na; 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po sems bskyed ma thag nyid du 'khor lo nam mkha' la 'gro ba de ltar lha rnams kyi sems bskyed ma thag nyid du shing ljon pa dag nam mkha' las 'ong ngo //
analyzed: dper na; 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po sems bskyed ma thag nyid du 'khor lo nam mkha' la 'gro ba de ltar lha rnams kyi sems bskyed ma thag nyid du shing ljon pa dag nam mkha' las 'ong ngo //
translated: Just as the wheel of a universal monarch immediately follows the king through the sky, so the wish-fulfilling trees will immediately follow the gods through the sky.

original: lha rnams gar 'dod pa der yang sa'i steng du 'bab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha rnams gar 'dod pa der yang sa'i steng du 'bab par 'gyur te /
translated: Wherever the gods wish to go, the trees will descend to the ground.

original: dper na / bya dag sa'i phyogs gang dang / gang du 'gro zhing gnas pa de dang de nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du shing ljon pa de dag thams cad de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / bya dag sa'i phyogs gang dang / gang du 'gro zhing gnas pa de dang de nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du shing ljon pa de dag thams cad de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: For example, wherever birds go and stay, that place becomes their home. In the same way, all the trees become like that.

original: 'di ni shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi rang gis byas pa'i las kyi mthu gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi rang gis byas pa'i las kyi mthu gcig yin no //
translated: This is one power of the gods living in the forest that is created by their own past actions.

original: de nas yang mthu 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas yang mthu 'byung ste /
translated: Then another power arises:

original: de ltar legs par byas pa'i las de dag gi mthu ni lha rnams gang du 'dong ba der bya dag sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa lta bu'i sgra 'byin bzhin du phyi bzhin 'brang zhing 'dong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar legs par byas pa'i las de dag gi mthu ni lha rnams gang du 'dong ba der bya dag sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa lta bu'i sgra 'byin bzhin du phyi bzhin 'brang zhing 'dong ngo //
translated: By the power of those good actions, wherever the gods go, birds follow them, singing like the five types of instruments.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: Then another power arises:

original: legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi mthu ni lha rnams nam mkha' la 'dod pa dang bcas par 'gro ba'i lha dag padma'i @212b rdzing na bung ba myos pa'i sgra 'byin pa dang / gser gyi bya ngang pas mdzes par byas shing /
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyi mthu ni lha rnams nam mkha' la 'dod pa dang bcas par 'gro ba'i lha dag padma'i @212b rdzing na bung ba myos pa'i sgra 'byin pa dang / gser gyi bya ngang pas mdzes par byas shing /
translated: The power of their positive actions causes the gods to travel through the sky, accompanied by the humming of bees in lotus pools and beautified by golden geese.

original: bya ka randa pa dang / ngur pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: bya ka randa pa dang / ngur pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: The gods are also beautified by karandavas and chakravākas.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: “ ‘Moreover,

original: shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi legs par byas pa'i mthu ni lha /
analyzed: shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi legs par byas pa'i mthu ni lha /
translated: the power of the gods’ positive actions causes the gods who dwell in the forests to travel through the sky.

original: lha'i phreng ba dang / gos gyon pa dag nam mkha' gang la 'gro ba'i nam mkha' der /
analyzed: lha'i phreng ba dang / gos gyon pa dag nam mkha' gang la 'gro ba'i nam mkha' der /
translated: The gods wear divine garlands and garments, and as they travel through the sky,

original: lha'i padma sdong bu bee d'urya las byas pa'i gnas dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i padma sdong bu bee d'urya las byas pa'i gnas dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: the sky will be filled with divine lotuses with stems made of beryl.

original: 'dab ma stong yod pa'i 'dab ma de re re la lha mo 'khod nas /
analyzed: 'dab ma stong yod pa'i 'dab ma de re re la lha mo 'khod nas /
translated: On each of the lotuses with a thousand petals, goddesses will be seated,

original: lha ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: and they will travel to where the gods are.

original: de nas yang shing gseb na gnas pa'i legs par byas pa rnams kyi las kyi mthu ni /
analyzed: de nas yang shing gseb na gnas pa'i legs par byas pa rnams kyi las kyi mthu ni /
translated: “Next, the power of the karmic actions of those who have engaged in positive actions in the forest will cause the gods to sit on divine lotuses.

original: lha dag lha'i padma la 'dug nas gang du 'gro ba nger nam mkha' de las lha'i ba tung bas gang ba'i lha'i snod dag lag tu 'ong ste /
analyzed: lha dag lha'i padma la 'dug nas gang du 'gro ba nger nam mkha' de las lha'i ba tung bas gang ba'i lha'i snod dag lag tu 'ong ste /
translated: As they travel through the sky, divine vessels filled with divine beverages will appear in their hands.

original: btung ba de dag lha dang / lha mo de dag dang lhan cig 'thung zhing dga' bar byed /
analyzed: btung ba de dag lha dang / lha mo de dag dang lhan cig 'thung zhing dga' bar byed /
translated: Together with the gods and goddesses, they will drink the beverages and enjoy themselves.

original: glu dbyangs len /
analyzed: glu dbyangs len /
translated: They will sing songs,

original: yongs su spyod par byed la /
analyzed: yongs su spyod par byed la /
translated: and they will enjoy themselves.

original: phyogs gzhan gang du 'dong bar yang 'gro'o //🔽de nas gzhan yang /🔽shing gseb na gnas pa rnams kyi las kyi mthu ni /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan gang du 'dong bar yang 'gro'o // de nas gzhan yang / shing gseb na gnas pa rnams kyi las kyi mthu ni /
translated: They will also travel to other places.

original: lha rnams gang dang / gang 'dod pa de dang / de thams cad 'byor bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lha rnams gang dang / gang 'dod pa de dang / de thams cad 'byor bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Next, the power of the karmic actions of those who live in the forest will cause the gods to obtain whatever they wish for.

original: lha'i 'jig rten gyi gnas nas gnas gzhan du rnam pa gang gzhan gyis 'gro 'dod pa'i ri dang / ri'i rtse mo de dag tu'ang /
analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten gyi gnas nas gnas gzhan du rnam pa gang gzhan gyis 'gro 'dod pa'i ri dang / ri'i rtse mo de dag tu'ang /
translated: From the divine world, they will travel to other places, such as mountains and mountain peaks, in any way they wish.

original: lha'i me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / chu bo phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal phun @213a *//🔽sum tshogs pa dag nam mkha' las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / chu bo phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal phun @213a *// sum tshogs pa dag nam mkha' las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: divine flowers, fruits, and abundant rivers, and excellent forests and parks will appear in the sky.

original: lha gnas pa de rnams lha mo dag gis yongs su bskor la lhan cig tu lha'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i glu dbyangs nye ba na len cing /
analyzed: lha gnas pa de rnams lha mo dag gis yongs su bskor la lhan cig tu lha'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i glu dbyangs nye ba na len cing /
translated: The gods who dwell there, surrounded by goddesses, will sing and play divine music with the five types of instruments.

original: de dag nyid dang yul nas yul du nam mkha' la 'gro ba na /
analyzed: de dag nyid dang yul nas yul du nam mkha' la 'gro ba na /
translated: As they travel through the sky from one place to another,

original: de nas chos bzang na gnas pa dang / blta na sdug pa na gnas pa yid dga' bas gnas mthon po mthong ste /🔽ji ltar dzambu'i gling na mi rgyu ba dag /
analyzed: de nas chos bzang na gnas pa dang / blta na sdug pa na gnas pa yid dga' bas gnas mthon po mthong ste / ji ltar dzambu'i gling na mi rgyu ba dag /
translated: the gods who dwell in Sudarśana and Aṭaṭa will see with joy the high abodes of the gods who dwell in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: lha gzhal med khang gsal ba na gnas pas mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lha gzhal med khang gsal ba na gnas pas mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the gods who dwell in the celestial palaces can see the humans who roam Jambudvīpa,🔽the gods who dwell in Sudarśana and Aṭaṭa will see the gods who dwell in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de ltar chos bzang na gnas pa'i lha de dag dang / blta na sdug na gnas pa'i lha de dag phan tshun du /
analyzed: de ltar chos bzang na gnas pa'i lha de dag dang / blta na sdug na gnas pa'i lha de dag phan tshun du /
translated: The gods who dwell in Sudarśana and Aṭaṭa will see the gods who dwell in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: kye / 'di ltar shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de dag bde ba mchog dang ldan te /
analyzed: kye / 'di ltar shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de dag bde ba mchog dang ldan te /
translated: “ ‘Ah! The gods who dwell in the forest are endowed with supreme bliss.

original: bdag cag pas khyad ches bde la; lha'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa dag nye bar len cing gang dga' mgur rgyu ba /
analyzed: bdag cag pas khyad ches bde la; lha'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa dag nye bar len cing gang dga' mgur rgyu ba /
translated: They are much happier than we are. They enjoy divine music with the five types of instruments, and they roam about as they please.

original: gar 'dod par 'gro ba /
analyzed: gar 'dod par 'gro ba /
translated: They go wherever they wish.

original: ci bder gnas /
analyzed: ci bder gnas /
translated: They stay wherever they like.

original: thogs pa med par 'gro ba /
analyzed: thogs pa med par 'gro ba /
translated: They move without any obstruction.🔽They go from one place to another.

original: yul nas yul du 'gro'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yul nas yul du 'gro'o zhes brjod do //
translated: One says: I will go from this place to that place.

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin yang padma 'dab ma stong la sdong bu lha'i gser dang / bee d'urya las byas pa'i steng du 'dug nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin yang padma 'dab ma stong la sdong bu lha'i gser dang / bee d'urya las byas pa'i steng du 'dug nas /
translated: “At that point Śakra, King of the Gods, will sit upon a lotus with a thousand petals, its stem made of divine gold and beryl.

original: lha mo bzang mo dag dang lhan cig nam mkha' las 'gro'o //
analyzed: lha mo bzang mo dag dang lhan cig nam mkha' las 'gro'o //
translated: Together with the excellent goddesses, he will then travel through the sky.

original: legs par byas pa'i las kyis sprul pa'i padma de'ang nyams dga' ba 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las kyis sprul pa'i padma de'ang nyams dga' ba 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: The lotus that is emanated by his positive karmic actions is delightful in the following ways.

original: 'dab ma thams cad la lha mo lha'i phreng pa dang / gos @213b gyon pa gser rgyan gyis brgyan pa thams cad yid rab tu dga' ba /
analyzed: 'dab ma thams cad la lha mo lha'i phreng pa dang / gos @213b gyon pa gser rgyan gyis brgyan pa thams cad yid rab tu dga' ba /
translated: On all its petals are goddesses wearing divine garlands and garments, and adorned with golden ornaments. They are all very happy.

original: thams cad sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dga' bas myos pa /
analyzed: thams cad sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dga' bas myos pa /
translated: All of them are intoxicated by the joy of the five types of musical instruments.

original: thams cad brgya byin la phyogs pa /
analyzed: thams cad brgya byin la phyogs pa /
translated: All of them are focused on Śakra.

original: so so gzugs dang / lang tsho dar la bab pa'i dregs pas myos pa lnga 'khod de /
analyzed: so so gzugs dang / lang tsho dar la bab pa'i dregs pas myos pa lnga 'khod de /
translated: Each of them is intoxicated by the arrogance of their own form and youth.

original: de dag thams cad lha'i rgyal po brgya byin dang lhan cig tu shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams ga la ba der nam mkha' las 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad lha'i rgyal po brgya byin dang lhan cig tu shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha rnams ga la ba der nam mkha' las 'dong bar byed do //
translated: All of them fly through the sky together with Śakra, king of the gods, to where the gods in the forest groves are.

original: shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de dag gis kyang brgya byin de mthong nas phyir zhing yid rab tu dga' la /
analyzed: shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha de dag gis kyang brgya byin de mthong nas phyir zhing yid rab tu dga' la /
translated: The gods in the forest groves also see Śakra and become even more delighted.

original: yang ji ltar bshad pa'i gnas de dag las babs nas /
analyzed: yang ji ltar bshad pa'i gnas de dag las babs nas /
translated: They descend from the places they were explained before

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: and go to where Śakra, king of the gods, is.

original: dong nas brgya byin de la spyi bos phyag btsal te /
analyzed: dong nas brgya byin de la spyi bos phyag btsal te /
translated: Having arrived, they bow their heads to Śakra

original: tshig gis kyang bstod do //
analyzed: tshig gis kyang bstod do //
translated: and praise him with words.

original: brgya byin gyi sngon du 'gro ba dang / shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha snying dga' ba rnams kyis brgya byin de yongs su bskor nas /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi sngon du 'gro ba dang / shing gseb na gnas pa'i lha snying dga' ba rnams kyis brgya byin de yongs su bskor nas /
translated: The gods who are Śakra’s attendants and the gods who live in the forest of Joyful Hearts surround Śakra.🔽They go to the place that Śakra desires,

original: brgya byin mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas sam /🔽skyed mos tshal lam /
analyzed: brgya byin mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas sam / skyed mos tshal lam /
translated: whether it is a pleasure grove,🔽a mountaintop,

original: ri bo'i steng ngam /🔽tshal lam; nye ba'i tshal lam /
analyzed: ri bo'i steng ngam / tshal lam; nye ba'i tshal lam /
translated: a forest, a park,

original: padma'i rdzing ngam /
analyzed: padma'i rdzing ngam /
translated: a lotus pond,

original: gnas gzhan ga la ba der nam mkha' las 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: gnas gzhan ga la ba der nam mkha' las 'dong bar byed do //
translated: or another location. They travel through the sky.

original: brgya byin gyi sngon du 'gro ba de rnams der yun ring du rtses nas /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi sngon du 'gro ba de rnams der yun ring du rtses nas /
translated: When Śakra’s attendants have played there for a long time,

original: de nas yang rang gi gnas ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang rang gi gnas ga la ba der 'dong bar byed de /
translated: they return to their own abodes.

original: brgya byin gyi sngon du 'gro ba rnams ji ltar song ba de ltar slar 'ong bar byed do //🔽de nas brgya byin yang lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga @214a *//
analyzed: brgya byin gyi sngon du 'gro ba rnams ji ltar song ba de ltar slar 'ong bar byed do // de nas brgya byin yang lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang ga @214a *//
translated: They return by the same route by which they came.

original: la ba der 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: la ba der 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Then Śakra goes to the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya sdug gus myos pa'i lha de dag kyang ji srid du sdug pa /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya sdug gus myos pa'i lha de dag kyang ji srid du sdug pa /
translated: The gods are intoxicated by the beauty of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures.🔽

original: 'dod pa / yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du dga' bar byed do //🔽de phyis lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa / yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las de zad par ma gyur pa de srid du dga' bar byed do // de phyis lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: The gods who are intoxicated by beautiful forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures will continue to enjoy themselves until finally their completed and accumulated acts with attractive, desirable, and delightful effects have been exhausted.

original: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When they later die and leave their divine world, they will, in accordance with their causal deeds, take birth among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals.

original: gal te mi dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi dang skal ba mnyam par mi'i nang du skyes na /
translated: If they are born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag tu bde ba mchog dang ldan zhing rtag tu nad med pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / nor dang shin tu ldan zhing mchog tu bde ba dang / de bzhin du sde gzhan gyis 'jigs pa med pa'i bar gyi gling dag gi rgyal por 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag tu bde ba mchog dang ldan zhing rtag tu nad med pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / nor dang shin tu ldan zhing mchog tu bde ba dang / de bzhin du sde gzhan gyis 'jigs pa med pa'i bar gyi gling dag gi rgyal por 'gyur ba'am /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will constantly experience supreme happiness, be free from illness, be free from harm, be endowed with wealth, and experience supreme bliss.

original: rgyal tshab tu 'gyur bar mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: rgyal tshab tu 'gyur bar mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: They will become kings of the islands that are free from the fear of other armies, or they will become regents.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas shing rta sna tshogs na gnas pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo; ;der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas shing rta sna tshogs na gnas pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo; ;der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realms of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.🔽With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see the realm of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three known as Abodes in Various Chariots.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: mchod rten gyi gnas rnams su sngon yo byad sbyar ba rnams rgyal @214b po mi rigs pa'am /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi gnas rnams su sngon yo byad sbyar ba rnams rgyal @214b po mi rigs pa'am /
translated: The king took the wealth that had been set aside for the stūpas and used it for other purposes.

original: blon po mi rigs pa'am /
analyzed: blon po mi rigs pa'am /
translated: “If, in the presence of stūpas, the king or a minister, or someone else who is greedy and has no regard for right and wrong,

original: mi rigs par chags pa la brkam pa /🔽las la 'jigs pa med pa /
analyzed: mi rigs par chags pa la brkam pa / las la 'jigs pa med pa /
translated: or someone who is attached to what is inappropriate,

original: gang gis gcod par byed pa la /
analyzed: gang gis gcod par byed pa la /
translated: or someone who is not afraid of the consequences of his actions,🔽should destroy the offerings that have been made,

original: skyes bu dam pa yid dang / sems bsgoms pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan mngon par dran pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa yid dang / sems bsgoms pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan mngon par dran pa'am /
translated: then a holy person who has trained his mind and is mindful of the qualities of the Buddha

original: tshig shin tu snyan cing gsal bas sangs rgyas la bstod nas de phyir zlog par byed dam /
analyzed: tshig shin tu snyan cing gsal bas sangs rgyas la bstod nas de phyir zlog par byed dam /
translated: may stop him by praising the Buddha with very pleasant and clear words.

original: 'tsho ba par byed na /
analyzed: 'tsho ba par byed na /
translated: If he does so,

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi nang shing rta sna tshogs na gnas pa'i sar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi nang shing rta sna tshogs na gnas pa'i sar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, when he later separates from his body, he will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in the realm of Various Chariots in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: der skyes nas kyang shin tu dge ba'i las byed pa de sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas dga' bar byed /🔽rtse bar byed /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang shin tu dge ba'i las byed pa de sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas dga' bar byed / rtse bar byed /
translated: “Once born there, he will enjoy himself with the five types of musical instruments.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed /
translated: He will play, enjoy himself, and indulge in pleasures.

original: gnas par byed do //
analyzed: gnas par byed do //
translated: He is able to remain there.

original: sa der las kyi 'bras bu gzhan gyis kyang skye bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: sa der las kyi 'bras bu gzhan gyis kyang skye bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The other karmic results that occur in this realm are

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len par spangs pas 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len par spangs pas 'gyur te /
translated: the results of abandoning killing and stealing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: How is this?

original: khyis 'tsho ba las ri dvags thar par byed la /
analyzed: khyis 'tsho ba las ri dvags thar par byed la /
translated: He rescues deer from hunters.

original: bdag nyid kyang mi byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mi byed /
translated: He does not kill himself,🔽nor does he cause others to kill.

original: byed du'ang mi 'jug ;gzhan gyis byas pa la rjes su yi rang bar yang mi byed pa dang / ji ltar ma byin par len pa mi byed de /
analyzed: byed du'ang mi 'jug ;gzhan gyis byas pa la rjes su yi rang bar yang mi byed pa dang / ji ltar ma byin par len pa mi byed de /
translated: He does not rejoice in the killing done by others.

original: ma byin par len pa ji ltar spangs pa yin zhe na /🔽bdag nyid yul gyi bdag po'am /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa ji ltar spangs pa yin zhe na / bdag nyid yul gyi bdag po'am /
translated: How does he abandon stealing?🔽He does not punish others with fines

original: rgyal po'am / blon por gyur pas pha rol la chad pas gcod par mi byed cing /
analyzed: rgyal po'am / blon por gyur pas pha rol la chad pas gcod par mi byed cing /
translated: when he is the lord of the land, a king, or a minister.

original: gzhan byed pa'ang zlog par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan byed pa'ang zlog par byed la /
translated: He stops others from doing it.

original: chos sam / khrims la 'jog par byed pa de dag ni @215a *//
analyzed: chos sam / khrims la 'jog par byed pa de dag ni @215a *//
translated: He establishes them in the Dharma or in the law.

original: shing rta sna tshogs su skyes par 'gyur ba'i las rnam pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: shing rta sna tshogs su skyes par 'gyur ba'i las rnam pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: These are the two kinds of actions that lead to rebirth as a king of the gandharvas.

original: tshal gyi rgya dpag tshad sum stong yod pa de na /
analyzed: tshal gyi rgya dpag tshad sum stong yod pa de na /
translated: The forest is three thousand leagues in size.

original: lha dag shing rta sna tshogs rnams kyis dga' bar byed de /
analyzed: lha dag shing rta sna tshogs rnams kyis dga' bar byed de /
translated: The gods enjoy various chariots in that forest.

original: des na shing rta sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i ming du btags la /
analyzed: des na shing rta sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i ming du btags la /
translated: Therefore, it is called the forest of various chariots.

original: shing rta sna tshogs der gnas pa'i lha rnams rtse bar byed do //
analyzed: shing rta sna tshogs der gnas pa'i lha rnams rtse bar byed do //
translated: The gods who dwell in the forest of various chariots play there.

original: shing rta dang / shing rta'i nang na gser dang / dngul gyi padma ma bee d'urya shin tu blta na sdug ba dri mchog tu yid du 'thad pa'i rdzing 'byung la /
analyzed: shing rta dang / shing rta'i nang na gser dang / dngul gyi padma ma bee d'urya shin tu blta na sdug ba dri mchog tu yid du 'thad pa'i rdzing 'byung la /
translated: In the chariots and within the chariots, ponds of gold, silver, and beryl that are very beautiful and have an extremely pleasant fragrance appear.

original: bung pa bee d'urya'i mdog lta bu'i tshogs lding ba rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bung pa bee d'urya'i mdog lta bu'i tshogs lding ba rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa yin no //
translated: They are beautified by swarms of bees that have the color of beryl.

original: tshal der bkra pa 'di dag kun 'byung bar 'gyur te de brjod pa /🔽padma'i rdzing rnams su padma bkra ba 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: tshal der bkra pa 'di dag kun 'byung bar 'gyur te de brjod pa / padma'i rdzing rnams su padma bkra ba 'byung ba ni /
translated: All of these splendors appear in that forest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The beautiful lotuses that appear in the ponds are as follows.

original: padma la la padma'i phyed mthon ka las byas pa /
analyzed: padma la la padma'i phyed mthon ka las byas pa /
translated: Some lotuses are half-made of sapphire.

original: phyed bee d'urya las byas pa yin te bkra ba gcig yin no //
analyzed: phyed bee d'urya las byas pa yin te bkra ba gcig yin no //
translated: half of it is made of beryl, and half of it is made of gold.

original: yang bkra ba gzhan ni phyed bee d'urya las byas la phyed gser las byas pa yin te bkra ba gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang bkra ba gzhan ni phyed bee d'urya las byas la phyed gser las byas pa yin te bkra ba gzhan yin no //
translated: Another colorful thing is that half of it is made of beryl, and half of it is made of gold.

original: yang bkra pa gzhan ni padma 'dab ma brgya pa thams cad kyi padma la padma phyed kyi padma'i 'dab ma ni gser las byas la gzhan ni padma r'a ga'i mdog lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang bkra pa gzhan ni padma 'dab ma brgya pa thams cad kyi padma la padma phyed kyi padma'i 'dab ma ni gser las byas la gzhan ni padma r'a ga'i mdog lta bu yin no //
translated: Another colorful thing is that a hundred-petaled lotus has lotus petals that are half gold and half the color of rubies.

original: yang bkra ba gzhan 'byung ba ni; padma bee d'urya'i 'dab ma dag la bud ba gser gyi mdog can rgyu la /
analyzed: yang bkra ba gzhan 'byung ba ni; padma bee d'urya'i 'dab ma dag la bud ba gser gyi mdog can rgyu la /
translated: Another colorful thing is that on beryl lotus petals there are golden bees,

original: dngul gyi 'dab ma dag la bung ba padma rla ga'i mdog can rgyu'o //
analyzed: dngul gyi 'dab ma dag la bung ba padma rla ga'i mdog can rgyu'o //
translated: and on silver petals there are bees the color of rubies.

original: yang bkra ba gzhan 'byung ba ni bee d'urya'i @215b padma'i sdong bu la ni gser gyis yongs su dkris /
analyzed: yang bkra ba gzhan 'byung ba ni bee d'urya'i @215b padma'i sdong bu la ni gser gyis yongs su dkris /
translated: Another colorful thing is that on beryl lotus stems there are golden coils,

original: gser gyi padma'i sdong bu la ni rin po ches yongs su dkris /
analyzed: gser gyi padma'i sdong bu la ni rin po ches yongs su dkris /
translated: and on golden lotus stems there are jeweled coils.

original: dngul gyi padma'i sdong bu la ni spug gis yongs su dkris /🔽rin po che ma rgad kyi kha dog lta bu'i sdong bu la ni dzambu chu bo'i gser gyis yongs su dkris so //
analyzed: dngul gyi padma'i sdong bu la ni spug gis yongs su dkris / rin po che ma rgad kyi kha dog lta bu'i sdong bu la ni dzambu chu bo'i gser gyis yongs su dkris so //
translated: The silver lotus stalks are wrapped in coral.🔽The stalks the color of cat’s eye gems are wrapped in gold from the Jambū River.

original: bung ba sgra 'byin pa kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dug pa rnams kyis padma'i rdzing bu de dag khebs pa yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bung ba sgra 'byin pa kha dog rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dug pa rnams kyis padma'i rdzing bu de dag khebs pa yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The lotus ponds are covered with humming bees in various colors.

original: dzambu'i gling na me tog tsu la sa'i dog pa la bung ba rnams kyis rtag tu khebs pa ltar shing rta sna tshogs kyi'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dzambu'i gling na me tog tsu la sa'i dog pa la bung ba rnams kyis rtag tu khebs pa ltar shing rta sna tshogs kyi'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In Jambudvīpa, the flowers of the jasmine tree are always covered with bees. The same is true of the various chariots.

original: de nas legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyis gnas sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /🔽dzambu'i gling na lag bzo mkhas pa'am /🔽lag bzo'i slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis rtsig ngos la bkra ba 'dab ma sna tshogs bkod pa /
analyzed: de nas legs par byas pa'i las rnams kyis gnas sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste / dzambu'i gling na lag bzo mkhas pa'am / lag bzo'i slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis rtsig ngos la bkra ba 'dab ma sna tshogs bkod pa /
translated: Then, due to their good karma, various places appear.

original: tshon rtsi sna tshogs kyis bris pa ltar /
analyzed: tshon rtsi sna tshogs kyis bris pa ltar /
translated: In Jambudvīpa, a skilled artisan or a skilled apprentice artisan might paint a wall with various colors and various designs.

original: tshal gyi gnas de na'ang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: tshal gyi gnas de na'ang de lta bu yin no //
translated: Such is the case in that forest.

original: yang shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal gyi bkra ba gzhan ni bya sna tshogs kyi sgro dang / rkang pa dang / mgo dang / lto dang / mig bkra ba dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal gyi bkra ba gzhan ni bya sna tshogs kyi sgro dang / rkang pa dang / mgo dang / lto dang / mig bkra ba dag 'byung ste /
translated: “Another marvel of the Vairocana forest is the appearance of birds with various colors of feathers, feet, heads, bellies, and eyes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bya gang gi lto gser du 'dug pa de'i sgro dngul yin la /
analyzed: bya gang gi lto gser du 'dug pa de'i sgro dngul yin la /
translated: the birds with golden bellies have silver feathers,

original: rgyab padma r'a ga'i mdog dang / mig rin po che ke ke ru'i mdog /
analyzed: rgyab padma r'a ga'i mdog dang / mig rin po che ke ke ru'i mdog /
translated: ruby-colored backs, and eyes the color of sapphire.

original: de bzhin du gang dngul gyi ltor 'dug pa de'i sgro gser la mig bee d'urya'i mdog dang / mig gi 'bras bu padma r'a ga'i mdog la rgyab bkra bar 'dug ste /🔽rin po che sna @216a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dngul gyi ltor 'dug pa de'i sgro gser la mig bee d'urya'i mdog dang / mig gi 'bras bu padma r'a ga'i mdog la rgyab bkra bar 'dug ste / rin po che sna @216a *//
translated: Similarly, the birds with silver bellies have golden feathers, eyes the color of beryl, ruby-colored eyes, and colorful backs.🔽The various birds, which are the colors of the seven precious substances,

original: bdun gyi mdog lta bu'i bya sna tshogs rnams kyis nye bar mdzes pa babs so //
analyzed: bdun gyi mdog lta bu'i bya sna tshogs rnams kyis nye bar mdzes pa babs so //
translated: beautify the forest.

original: 'di ni shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal gyi bkra ba gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal gyi bkra ba gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another marvel of the Vairocana forest.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ri'i rtse mo 'byung ba dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ri'i rtse mo 'byung ba dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: the appearance of mountain peaks,

original: mthon ka dang / bee d'urya dang / sbug dang / rin po che ke ke ru dang / gser te /
analyzed: mthon ka dang / bee d'urya dang / sbug dang / rin po che ke ke ru dang / gser te /
translated: and gold.

original: de rnams kyi 'od kyis tshal de sbras shing brgyan pa yin no //🔽tshal de phan tshun gyi 'od zer 'khyil bas shin tu gang la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'od kyis tshal de sbras shing brgyan pa yin no // tshal de phan tshun gyi 'od zer 'khyil bas shin tu gang la /
translated: The light of these gems illuminates and adorns the forest.

original: lha'i 'od zer gyi mthus shin tu mdzes bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i 'od zer gyi mthus shin tu mdzes bar byas pa yin no //
translated: The light of the gods shines forth and makes the forest extremely beautiful.

original: yang tshal sna tshogs bkra ba gzhan ni lcug ma 'phyang ba dang; shing gel ba sna tshogs dag phan tshun 'dzings par 'dug la /
analyzed: yang tshal sna tshogs bkra ba gzhan ni lcug ma 'phyang ba dang; shing gel ba sna tshogs dag phan tshun 'dzings par 'dug la /
translated: In another colorful forest, vines and various shrubs intertwine with each other.

original: kha dog gsum 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha dog gsum 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Three colors appear:

original: bee d'urya'i lcug ma la padma r'a ga'i mdog gi 'bras bu de 'phyang bar 'gyur zhing /🔽aanda rnyil gyi mdog lta bus lhan cig dkris pa yin /
analyzed: bee d'urya'i lcug ma la padma r'a ga'i mdog gi 'bras bu de 'phyang bar 'gyur zhing / aanda rnyil gyi mdog lta bus lhan cig dkris pa yin /
translated: sapphire vines with fruits the color of rubies hang down,🔽and cat’s eye vines are wrapped in sapphire vines.

original: dngul gyi lcug ma la padma r'a ga'i mdog gi 'od kyis lhan cig bskor ba yin /
analyzed: dngul gyi lcug ma la padma r'a ga'i mdog gi 'od kyis lhan cig bskor ba yin /
translated: Silver vines are surrounded by the light of rubies.

original: de bzhin du spug dang / gser gyi lcug ma la gser gyi lcug mas lhan cig dkris pa yin /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du spug dang / gser gyi lcug ma la gser gyi lcug mas lhan cig dkris pa yin / 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, the golden vines are entwined with golden vines.

original: rin po che ke ke ru'i mdog lta bu'i lcug ma la dngul gyis yongs su dkris pa yin te /
analyzed: rin po che ke ke ru'i mdog lta bu'i lcug ma la dngul gyis yongs su dkris pa yin te /
translated: The vines that are the color of the precious stone ke-ke-ru are entwined with silver.

original: de ltar lcug ma kha dog gnyis pa 'phyang pa yongs su dkris pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lcug ma kha dog gnyis pa 'phyang pa yongs su dkris pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the vines that hang down in two colors are entwined.

original: lcug ma 'phyang ba kha dog gsum pa rnams la yongs su dkris pa ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lcug ma 'phyang ba kha dog gsum pa rnams la yongs su dkris pa ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The vines that hang down in three colors are entwined.

original: bee d'urya'i lcug ma la gser @216b dang; ke ke ru'i mdog lta bus kun tu dkris pa yin /🔽de bzhin du lcug ma ke ke ru'i mdog lta bu la gser dang / dngul lta bus yongs su dkris pa yin /
analyzed: bee d'urya'i lcug ma la gser @216b dang; ke ke ru'i mdog lta bus kun tu dkris pa yin / de bzhin du lcug ma ke ke ru'i mdog lta bu la gser dang / dngul lta bus yongs su dkris pa yin /
translated: The vines that are the color of beryl are entwined with gold and the color of ke-ke-ru.🔽In the same way, the vines that are the color of ke-ke-ru are entwined with gold and silver.

original: de bzhin du dngul gyi lcug ma la padma spug dang / mthon ka lta bus yongs su dkris pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngul gyi lcug ma la padma spug dang / mthon ka lta bus yongs su dkris pa yin te /
translated: The silver vines are entwined with ruby and sapphire.

original: de ltar lcug ma re re la gnyis gnyis kyis kun tu dkris pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lcug ma re re la gnyis gnyis kyis kun tu dkris pa yin no //
translated: Thus, each vine is entwined with two others.

original: yang shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal du bkra ba gzhan 'byung ba ni gser gyi lcug ma dag las me tog bee d'urya'i mdog lta bu 'byung /🔽de bzhin du dngul gyi lcug ma dag las me tog mthon ka'i mdog lta bu 'byung /
analyzed: yang shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal du bkra ba gzhan 'byung ba ni gser gyi lcug ma dag las me tog bee d'urya'i mdog lta bu 'byung / de bzhin du dngul gyi lcug ma dag las me tog mthon ka'i mdog lta bu 'byung /
translated: “In the Forest of Various Chariots, there are other colorful trees. Golden vines produce flowers that are the color of beryl.🔽Silver vines produce flowers that are the color of sapphire.

original: de bzhin du gser gyi lcug ma dag las me tog ke ke ru'i mdog lta bu 'byung /
analyzed: de bzhin du gser gyi lcug ma dag las me tog ke ke ru'i mdog lta bu 'byung /
translated: Golden vines produce flowers that are the color of chrysoberyl.

original: de bzhin du spug gi lcug ma dag las me tog bee d'urya'i mdog lta bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du spug gi lcug ma dag las me tog bee d'urya'i mdog lta bu 'byung ste /
translated: Coral vines produce flowers that are the color of beryl.

original: de ltar lcug ma sna tshogs dag las me tog sna tshogs dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar lcug ma sna tshogs dag las me tog sna tshogs dag 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, various vines produce various flowers.

original: las sna tshogs kyis bskyed pa /
analyzed: las sna tshogs kyis bskyed pa /
translated: They are produced by various karmic actions,

original: sems sna tshogs kyis bslad pa /
analyzed: sems sna tshogs kyis bslad pa /
translated: corrupted by various minds,

original: rgyu sna tshogs dang mthun pa ni yang dag par skyes pa sna tshogs dag yin te /
analyzed: rgyu sna tshogs dang mthun pa ni yang dag par skyes pa sna tshogs dag yin te /
translated: and are in accord with various causes.

original: de ltar las rnams kyi rgyu dang / gzhi des de ltar shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal thams cad bkra ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar las rnams kyi rgyu dang / gzhi des de ltar shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal thams cad bkra ba yin no //
translated: Thus, due to the causes and bases of various karmic actions, the entire Forest of Various Chariots is colorful.🔽“

original: ji ltar sa bon las 'bras bu 'byung ba de bzhin du rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon las 'bras bu 'byung ba de bzhin du rgyu dang mthun par 'bras bu 'byung ste /
translated: Just as a result arises from a seed, so a result arises in accordance with its cause.

original: gang 'dir las byed pa rnam pa gang ji ltar 'phangs pa dang / gang gi tshe zhing gi rnam pa ji lta bu dang / sems pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu nas /
analyzed: gang 'dir las byed pa rnam pa gang ji ltar 'phangs pa dang / gang gi tshe zhing gi rnam pa ji lta bu dang / sems pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu nas /
translated: Whatever action is done here, in whatever way it is projected, in whatever field, in whatever manner, in whatever time,

original: sna tshogs su slong bar byed pa'i @217a *//
analyzed: sna tshogs su slong bar byed pa'i @217a *//
translated: up to the various ways of instigation,

original: bar las rnam pa sna tshogs byas pa'i 'bras bu ni de ltar rgya'i 'bur lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽mtho ris sam /
analyzed: bar las rnam pa sna tshogs byas pa'i 'bras bu ni de ltar rgya'i 'bur lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro // mtho ris sam /
translated: the result of the various actions done will arise in the same way as a raised seal.🔽There is no result of karma in the higher realms

original: sems can dmyal ba gang rgyu med par 'bras bu 'byung ba de med de /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba gang rgyu med par 'bras bu 'byung ba de med de /
translated: or in the hells that arises without a cause.

original: gzhan gyis byas la rnam par smin pa gzhan la 'byung ba de ni gnas med do //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas la rnam par smin pa gzhan la 'byung ba de ni gnas med do // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: It is impossible for what is done by one to be experienced by another.

original: shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal bkra ba dang / 'jig rten bkra ba la'ang rtog par byed de /
analyzed: shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal bkra ba dang / 'jig rten bkra ba la'ang rtog par byed de /
translated: “ ‘Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the variegated forest of various chariots and the variegated world.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i shing rta sna tshogs na lha rnams las ci zhig byed cig gu snyam nas /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i shing rta sna tshogs na lha rnams las ci zhig byed cig gu snyam nas /
translated: “What do the gods in the pleasure grove of Vaijayanta do?”

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
