translated: He will then examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: 'di ltar dus gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar dus gang gi tshe /
translated: He will think, ‘When

original: mi chos dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: mi chos dang mi ldan pa /
translated: people do not follow the Dharma,

original: chos ma yin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: but follow what is not the Dharma,

original: mar mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: mar mi 'dzin pa /
translated: do not respect their mothers,🔽do not respect their fathers,

original: phar mi 'dzin pa; dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phar mi 'dzin pa; dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa /
translated: do not respect ascetics,

original: bram zer mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bram zer mi 'dzin pa /
translated: do not respect brahmins,

original: rigs kyi rgan rabs la gus par mi byed pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi rgan rabs la gus par mi byed pa /
translated: do not respect their elders,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen du mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen du mi 'dzin pa /
translated: do not respect spiritual teachers,

original: las dang / 'bras bu la yid mi ches pa /
analyzed: las dang / 'bras bu la yid mi ches pa /
translated: do not believe in the ripening of karma,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba med pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba med pa /
translated: do not have right view,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba'i sngon du 'gro ba med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba'i sngon du 'gro ba med pa de'i tshe /
translated: and do not have the prerequisites for right view,

original: bdud sdig can dag dga' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdud sdig can dag dga' bar 'gyur la /
translated: then the evil Māra will be delighted.

original: de'i chos dang / chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i 'khor bzhi po de dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i chos dang / chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i 'khor bzhi po de dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The four retinues that follow the Dharma and the Dharma teacher will appear in the world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba 'thab pa zhes bya ba dang / bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba g-yeng byed ces bya ba @217b gang chos spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems g-yeng bar byed pa'am dam pa'i chos nyan pa gnyid log par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba 'thab pa zhes bya ba dang / bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba g-yeng byed ces bya ba @217b gang chos spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems g-yeng bar byed pa'am dam pa'i chos nyan pa gnyid log par byed pa dang /
translated: The māra class of world guardians called “battle” and the māra class of world guardians called “distraction” cause the minds of beings who practice the Dharma to become distracted and cause those who listen to the sublime Dharma to fall asleep.

original: gsum pa lhag par chags par rmongs pa zhes bya ba sbyin bdag gtong ba na /
analyzed: gsum pa lhag par chags par rmongs pa zhes bya ba sbyin bdag gtong ba na /
translated: The third is called “delusion of excessive attachment.”🔽When a donor or a master of generosity is giving,

original: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag rnams kyi sems chags pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag rnams kyi sems chags pa skyed par byed de /
translated: it causes the minds of donors and masters of generosity to become attached.🔽“What will my children and wife eat and wear?

original: 'di ltar bdag gis gang dge sbyong dang / bram ze zhing du gyur pa rnams la sbyin du bdag gi bu dang / chung ma ci bza'/🔽ci bgo snyam du sems par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis gang dge sbyong dang / bram ze zhing du gyur pa rnams la sbyin du bdag gi bu dang / chung ma ci bza'/ ci bgo snyam du sems par byed de /
translated: I will give to those who are fields of virtue, to ascetics and brahmins.”

original: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba gsum pa dag sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed cing 'jig rten na rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba gsum pa dag sems can rnams rnam par rmongs par byed cing 'jig rten na rgyu bar byed do //
translated: The third class of māra world guardians causes beings to become deluded and wanders in the world.

original: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi ba 'du shes log pa zhes bya ba de 'jig rten na rgyu zhing de rab tu 'byung ba rnams kyi sems rab tu mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi ba 'du shes log pa zhes bya ba de 'jig rten na rgyu zhing de rab tu 'byung ba rnams kyi sems rab tu mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The four world guardians of the class of Māra, called “perverted perception,” are active in the world, and they cause the minds of those who have gone forth to be unpeaceful.

original: dang po ni chags pa dang / sbyor ba dang / grong du 'jug pa dang / tshong zong nyo tshong byed pa dang / bud med la lta 'dod pa dang / chang 'tshong gi khyim du 'jug pa dang / 'thab rtsod dang / dge 'dun 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: dang po ni chags pa dang / sbyor ba dang / grong du 'jug pa dang / tshong zong nyo tshong byed pa dang / bud med la lta 'dod pa dang / chang 'tshong gi khyim du 'jug pa dang / 'thab rtsod dang / dge 'dun 'byed pa dang /
translated: The first is the generation of a mind that is attached, engaged, entering the village, buying and selling merchandise, desiring to see women, entering a tavern, quarreling, dividing the Saṅgha,

original: rmi lam gyi gnod pa'i sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnod pa'i sems skyed par byed do //
translated: and generating a mind that is harmed by dreams.

original: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi po de dag gang gi tshe chos dang mi ldan pa'i skye dgu dzambu'i gling du byed pa nus pa dang ldan pa 'byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi po de dag gang gi tshe chos dang mi ldan pa'i skye dgu dzambu'i gling du byed pa nus pa dang ldan pa 'byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When those four world guardians of the class of Māra are able to act in the world of Jambudvīpa,

original: bdud sdig can dag la /
analyzed: bdud sdig can dag la /
translated: then Māra, the evil one, says to them:

original: lha dag / dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni 'grib bo //
analyzed: lha dag / dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni 'grib bo //
translated: “Gods, the side of the true Dharma is declining.

original: bdud kyi phyogs ni 'phel te dgyes par mdzod cig ces bsnyad do //
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs ni 'phel te dgyes par mdzod cig ces bsnyad do //
translated: The forces of the māras are on the rise. Rejoice in this!

original: de dag las thos nas @218a *//
analyzed: de dag las thos nas @218a *//
translated: Having heard this,

original: bdud sdig can dag gi rjes su 'brangs pa de dag la bdag cag gi phyogs ji ltar 'phel /
analyzed: bdud sdig can dag gi rjes su 'brangs pa de dag la bdag cag gi phyogs ji ltar 'phel /
translated: they asked, “How can we increase our own forces

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ji ltar 'gribs zhes dris so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ji ltar 'gribs zhes dris so //
translated: and diminish the forces of the true Dharma?”

original: de dag gis lho dzambu'i gling na mi chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de dag gis lho dzambu'i gling na mi chos ma yin pa dang ldan pa /
translated: They replied, “In the southern continent of Jambudvīpa, people are unrighteous,

original: chos ma yin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa /🔽mar mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i rjes su 'jug pa / mar mi 'dzin pa /
translated: they follow unrighteousness,🔽they do not respect their mothers,

original: phar mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phar mi 'dzin pa /
translated: they do not respect their fathers,

original: dge sbyod du mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyod du mi 'dzin pa /
translated: they do not respect ascetics,

original: bram zer mi 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bram zer mi 'dzin pa /
translated: they do not respect brahmins,

original: rigs kyi rgan rabs kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi rgan rabs kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa /
translated: they do not follow the elders of their families,

original: bdag cag gi 'dod chags kyi chags pas zil gyis mnan cing dam pa'i chos nyan pa la'ang gnod par bgyid do //
analyzed: bdag cag gi 'dod chags kyi chags pas zil gyis mnan cing dam pa'i chos nyan pa la'ang gnod par bgyid do //
translated: and they are overcome by the bonds of desire. They even harm those who listen to the true Dharma.”

original: de nas rab tu 'byung ba'i blos phal cher rab tu byung ba rnams dang / khyim na gnas pa sdom pa blangs shing tshangs par spyod pa rnams kyi rmi lam du'ang bud med gyi gzugs su sprul nas rmi lam gyi gnod pa bgyid du stsal /
analyzed: de nas rab tu 'byung ba'i blos phal cher rab tu byung ba rnams dang / khyim na gnas pa sdom pa blangs shing tshangs par spyod pa rnams kyi rmi lam du'ang bud med gyi gzugs su sprul nas rmi lam gyi gnod pa bgyid du stsal /
translated: We will manifest in the form of women in their dreams and cause them harm.

original: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag rnams kyi sbyin pa gtong ba na bu dang / chung ma la rag las ba'i sems kyis yid chags par gyur pa bgyis /
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag rnams kyi sbyin pa gtong ba na bu dang / chung ma la rag las ba'i sems kyis yid chags par gyur pa bgyis /
translated: When donors and benefactors give, we will cause them to be attached to their sons and wives.

original: yid mdza' ba dang / 'khrugs par bgyis /
analyzed: yid mdza' ba dang / 'khrugs par bgyis /
translated: We will cause them to be loving and agitated.

original: rab tu byung ba'ang nyo tshong gi zong la sems brtson par bgyis /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'ang nyo tshong gi zong la sems brtson par bgyis /
translated: We will cause those who have gone forth to be attached to the goods of buying and selling.

original: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'tshang 'drud pa la dga' bar bgyis te /
analyzed: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'tshang 'drud pa la dga' bar bgyis te /
translated: We will cause them to delight in fighting, arguing, and quarreling.

original: de ltar bdag cag gi thabs 'di rnams kyis bdud kyi phyogs ni spel /
analyzed: de ltar bdag cag gi thabs 'di rnams kyis bdud kyi phyogs ni spel /
translated: In this way, we will increase the side of Māra

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni bshig go zhes smras so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni bshig go zhes smras so //
translated: and destroy the side of the sublime Dharma.”

original: bdud sdig can gyis de thos nas /
analyzed: bdud sdig can gyis de thos nas /
translated: When Māra the Evil One heard this,🔽he was delighted and elated, and he exclaimed,🔽“Excellent, excellent, my friends!

original: lha ma yin sgra @218b gcan dang / brtan pa dang / rab dgod dang / gzhan dag dang / klu rab 'joms la sogs pa dag la 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni yongs su dmas so //
analyzed: lha ma yin sgra @218b gcan dang / brtan pa dang / rab dgod dang / gzhan dag dang / klu rab 'joms la sogs pa dag la 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni yongs su dmas so //
translated: The asuras Rāhu, Dṛdha, Prahasta, and others, and the nāgas Apalāla and so on, were told: The teachings of the Buddha are declining.

original: bdag cag gi phyogs ni 'phel te /
analyzed: bdag cag gi phyogs ni 'phel te /
translated: Our side is increasing.

original: khyed dga' bar gyis shig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: khyed dga' bar gyis shig ces bsgo'o //
translated: Rejoice! they were told.

original: de ltar yang 'jig rten skyong ba de dag nyid yang sa'i 'og tu gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'jig rten skyong ba de dag nyid yang sa'i 'og tu gtong bar byed de /
translated: In this way, the world protectors sent them back down to the underworld.

original: sa'i 'og tu song nas /
analyzed: sa'i 'og tu song nas /
translated: When they had gone down to the underworld,

original: rab dgod dang / thags bzad ris la snga ma bzhin du bsnyad do //
analyzed: rab dgod dang / thags bzad ris la snga ma bzhin du bsnyad do //
translated: they told Prahasta and Bali what had happened.

original: de thos nas lha ma yin rnams rab tu dga' ste /
analyzed: de thos nas lha ma yin rnams rab tu dga' ste /
translated: When the asuras heard this, they were overjoyed.

original: klu rab 'joms la sogs pa chos dang mi ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa rnams la bsnyad do //
analyzed: klu rab 'joms la sogs pa chos dang mi ldan zhing chos kyi rjes su mi 'jug pa rnams la bsnyad do //
translated: The nāgas Apalāla and so on are not righteous and do not follow the Dharma, they said.

original: longs spyod ldan na gnas pa'i klu de rnams kyis thos nas kyang shin tu dga' ste /
analyzed: longs spyod ldan na gnas pa'i klu de rnams kyis thos nas kyang shin tu dga' ste /
translated: When the nāgas living in the realm of enjoyment heard this, they were also very happy.

original: de dag mi rnams la snga ma bzhin du bgegs byed do //
analyzed: de dag mi rnams la snga ma bzhin du bgegs byed do //
translated: They will create obstacles for humans as before, they said.

original: de dag kyang 'phags skyes po la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba gzhan dag las de dag thams cad snga ma bzhin du thos nas /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'phags skyes po la sogs pa 'jig rten skyong ba gzhan dag las de dag thams cad snga ma bzhin du thos nas /
translated: Having heard all this from the other world protectors such as Virūḍhaka,

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang lhan cig shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang lhan cig shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal du 'jug par byed do //
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, together with the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, enters the Grove of Various Chariots.

original: de zhugs nas lha rnams bos te /
analyzed: de zhugs nas lha rnams bos te /
translated: Having entered, he calls out to the gods:

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten skyong ba 'di dag na re /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten skyong ba 'di dag na re /
translated: ‘The world protectors say this:

original: 'di ltar bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams rab tu mthu dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams rab tu mthu dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: “The gods of the class of Māra are very powerful.

original: lha ma yin thags bzang ris dang; rab dgod la sogs pa dang / klu rab 'joms la sogs pa mthu rab tu che'o zhes zer gyi /
analyzed: lha ma yin thags bzang ris dang; rab dgod la sogs pa dang / klu rab 'joms la sogs pa mthu rab tu che'o zhes zer gyi /
translated: The asura Vemacitrin, Santuṣita, and so forth, and the nāgas Pramatha and so forth are very powerful.”

original: de la lha khyed cag gis lha'i tshogs thams cad 'dir bsdu bar rigs so //
analyzed: de la lha khyed cag gis lha'i tshogs thams cad 'dir bsdu bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, gods, it is fitting that you gather all the hosts of gods here.

original: 'dus @219a *// nas kyang bdag cag lha'i tshogs thams cad lha ma yin dang g-yul sprad pa'i phyir rin po ches brgyan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa sna tshogs su 'dong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus @219a *// nas kyang bdag cag lha'i tshogs thams cad lha ma yin dang g-yul sprad pa'i phyir rin po ches brgyan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa sna tshogs su 'dong ngo //
translated: Having assembled, they will say, ‘We, the assembly of gods, will go to the various jeweled palaces in order to do battle with the asuras.’

original: de thos nas lha thams cad kyis de ltar 'tshal lo zhes smras nas /
analyzed: de thos nas lha thams cad kyis de ltar 'tshal lo zhes smras nas /
translated: Having heard this, all the gods will say, ‘We will do as you say.’

original: rang gi gnas ga la ba der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi gnas ga la ba der 'dong ngo //
translated: Then they will return to their own abodes.

original: dong nas lha gzhan thams cad bsdus nas /
analyzed: dong nas lha gzhan thams cad bsdus nas /
translated: Having returned, they will gather all the other gods

original: mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus te /
translated: and, in short,

original: shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal ga la ba der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal ga la ba der 'dong ngo //
translated: they will go to the forest of Various Chariots.

original: dong nas skyed mos tshal shing rta sna tshogs kyi gnas nyid du 'khod cing sil snyan sgra dbyangs sna tshogs dang / glu dag len pa na /
analyzed: dong nas skyed mos tshal shing rta sna tshogs kyi gnas nyid du 'khod cing sil snyan sgra dbyangs sna tshogs dang / glu dag len pa na /
translated: Having arrived there, they will gather in the park of Various Chariots and, while playing various musical instruments and singing songs,

original: shing rta sna tshogs kyis bkra ba rnams su dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: shing rta sna tshogs kyis bkra ba rnams su dga' bar byed do //
translated: they will enjoy themselves in the colorful forest of Various Chariots.

original: gang shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal na rtag pa rtag pa nyid du 'khod pa'i lha de dag ni skyed mos tshal gar yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gang shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal na rtag pa rtag pa nyid du 'khod pa'i lha de dag ni skyed mos tshal gar yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: The gods who are always present in the forest of Various Chariots do not go to any pleasure grove.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po des lha de dag bsdus nas shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal de nas dong ngo //🔽shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal na gnas pa'i lha de dag kyang ji srid du 'dod pa /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po des lha de dag bsdus nas shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal de nas dong ngo // shing rta sna tshogs kyi tshal na gnas pa'i lha de dag kyang ji srid du 'dod pa /
translated: Then, the lord of the gods gathers the gods and they leave the forest of Various Chariots.

original: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las zad par ma gyur pa de srid du de na dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug pa / yid du 'ong ba byas shing bsags pa'i las zad par ma gyur pa de srid du de na dga' bar byed do //
translated: The gods who live in the forest of Various Chariots enjoy themselves there until finally their completed and accumulated actions that produce desirable, attractive, and delightful effects are exhausted.

original: de zad nas lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de zad nas lha'i ris de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: When that happens, they die and leave that celestial realm.

original: shi nas kyang nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, they are born among hell beings, hungry ghosts, or animals, in accordance with their actions.

original: gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
translated: If they are born among humans,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag tu bde bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag tu bde bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: in accordance with their causal actions they will always be happy.

original: na tshod thog ma nas @219b 'chi ba'i bar du me tog gi phreng ba sdug gu thogs shing cha byad sna tshogs dang / shing rta sna tshogs la dga' ba dang / skye bo kun dga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: na tshod thog ma nas @219b 'chi ba'i bar du me tog gi phreng ba sdug gu thogs shing cha byad sna tshogs dang / shing rta sna tshogs la dga' ba dang / skye bo kun dga' bar 'gyur /
translated: From the time of their birth until their death, they wear beautiful flower garlands and various costumes, and they enjoy various chariots. They are loved by everyone.

original: gal te de rab tu byung na de seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas chos dang / gtam sna tshogs smra ba dang / gtam sna tshogs kyis 'khor kyang kun nas shin tu dga' bar byed pa mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: gal te de rab tu byung na de seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas chos dang / gtam sna tshogs smra ba dang / gtam sna tshogs kyis 'khor kyang kun nas shin tu dga' bar byed pa mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: If they go forth, they will sit on lion thrones and teach the Dharma and various topics, and they will delight their retinues with various stories.”

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Again, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will consider the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas dga' ba na gnas pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi gnas dga' ba na gnas pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have a realm known as Abiding in Pleasure.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: If one examines that with knowledge arisen from hearing,🔽one will see that a holy person with a virtuous mind does not kill, nor does he cause others to kill.🔽He does not steal, nor does he cause others to steal.🔽He does not commit adultery, nor does he cause others to commit adultery.🔽He does not lie, nor does he cause others to lie.

original: skyes bu dam pa bsam pa dge bar gyur pa gang gis srog gcod pa mi byed cing ma byin par len pa'ang mi byed la /🔽byed du ma bcug /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa bsam pa dge bar gyur pa gang gis srog gcod pa mi byed cing ma byin par len pa'ang mi byed la / byed du ma bcug /
translated: He does not drink alcohol, nor does he cause others to drink alcohol.

original: pha rol byed pa'ang bzlog /🔽bdag nyid mi byed /
analyzed: pha rol byed pa'ang bzlog / bdag nyid mi byed /
translated: He does not engage in sexual misconduct, nor does he cause others to engage in sexual misconduct.

original: byed du ma bcug /
analyzed: byed du ma bcug /
translated: He does not engage in idle speech, nor does he cause others to engage in idle speech.🔽He does not engage in malicious speech, nor does he cause others to engage in malicious speech.

original: byas na'ang 'chags par byed cing skyon du bgrang bar byed la sdig pa'i grogs po de yongs su spong bar byed do //🔽de la srog gcod pa dang bral ba ni gang yin /🔽rnam pa ni du yod cig gu snyam nas /
analyzed: byas na'ang 'chags par byed cing skyon du bgrang bar byed la sdig pa'i grogs po de yongs su spong bar byed do // de la srog gcod pa dang bral ba ni gang yin / rnam pa ni du yod cig gu snyam nas /
translated: He does not engage in harsh speech, nor does he cause others to engage in harsh speech.🔽He does not engage in gossip, nor does he cause others to engage in gossip.🔽He does not have a covetous mind, nor does he cause others to have a covetous mind.

original: 'di ni bya ne'u bzung bar thar bar byed cing sdom pa len du bcug nas bdag nyid mi byed la so sor 'chags par byed pa'am /🔽bya bas bya bzung ba nor rdzas kyis blus te thar par byed la /🔽gzhan yang @220a *//
analyzed: 'di ni bya ne'u bzung bar thar bar byed cing sdom pa len du bcug nas bdag nyid mi byed la so sor 'chags par byed pa'am / bya bas bya bzung ba nor rdzas kyis blus te thar par byed la / gzhan yang @220a *//
translated: He does not have a malicious mind, nor does he cause others to have a malicious mind.

original: de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed /
analyzed: de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed /
translated: He does not have a mind of wrong view, nor does he cause others to have a mind of wrong view.🔽He does not have a mind of anger, nor does he cause others to have a mind of anger.🔽He does not have a mind of malice, nor does he cause others to have a mind of malice.🔽He does not have a mind of jealousy, nor does he cause others to have a mind of jealousy.🔽He does not have a mind of miserliness, nor does he cause others to have a mind of miserliness.🔽He does not have a mind of deceit, nor does he cause others to have a mind of deceit.🔽He does not have a mind of arrogance, nor does he cause others to have a mind of arrogance.🔽He does not have a mind of wrong view, nor does he cause others to have a mind of wrong view.🔽He does not have a mind of doubt, nor does he cause others to have a mind of doubt.🔽He does not have a mind of desire, nor does he cause others to have a mind of desire.🔽He does not have a mind of hatred, nor does he cause others to have a mind of hatred.🔽He does not have a mind of ignorance, nor does he cause others to have a mind of ignorance.

original: rab tu dga' bar byed /
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar byed /
translated: He does not have a mind of

original: rab tu spro bar byed pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: rab tu spro bar byed pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: How does one give up stealing?

original: ma byin par len pa spangs pa gang yin zhig gu snyam na /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs pa gang yin zhig gu snyam na /
translated: What is it to give up stealing?

original: 'dir sdud pa bor gyur nas grong rnams 'dzin tam /
analyzed: 'dir sdud pa bor gyur nas grong rnams 'dzin tam /
translated: Here, if one has been a thief who has taken over a village,

original: tshong rdal lam /
analyzed: tshong rdal lam /
translated: a market town,🔽a city,

original: grong rdal lam /🔽phyugs kyi lhas 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: grong rdal lam / phyugs kyi lhas 'dzin pa'am /
translated: a pasture,

original: rgyal pos 'di ltar lug dang / ba lang dang / bong bu la sogs pa sdus shig ces bsgo ba las /
analyzed: rgyal pos 'di ltar lug dang / ba lang dang / bong bu la sogs pa sdus shig ces bsgo ba las /
translated: or if one has been ordered by a king to round up sheep, cattle, donkeys, and so on,

original: de'ang sdom pa'i 'jigs pas skrag nas ma byin par len pa mi byed na /
analyzed: de'ang sdom pa'i 'jigs pas skrag nas ma byin par len pa mi byed na /
translated: and out of fear of punishment one does not steal,

original: de las dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang dga' ba'i tshal du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang dga' ba'i tshal du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, when separated from that karma, one will go to the happy realms and be born among the gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three in the forest of Delight.

original: las gzhan gyis kyang 'gyur te /
analyzed: las gzhan gyis kyang 'gyur te /
translated: This can also happen through other karmic actions.

original: chos 'chad pa'ang chos nyan pa po rnams dga' bar bya ba'i phyir tshes grangs dang / yul dang / dus dang ldan par byas la de dag kyang dga' bar byas te /
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'ang chos nyan pa po rnams dga' bar bya ba'i phyir tshes grangs dang / yul dang / dus dang ldan par byas la de dag kyang dga' bar byas te /
translated: Furthermore, when teaching the Dharma, the Dharma teacher should please the audience by teaching at an auspicious time, in an auspicious place, and in an auspicious season.

original: de dag yid rab tu dga' ba sems rtse gcig gis chos nyan na /
analyzed: de dag yid rab tu dga' ba sems rtse gcig gis chos nyan na /
translated: If the audience is pleased, they will listen to the Dharma with a one-pointed mind.

original: dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i slob dpon de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten dga' ba'i tshal du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'chad pa'i slob dpon de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten dga' ba'i tshal du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the Dharma teacher, after separating from the body, goes to a good realm and is born in the Heaven of Joy,

original: sbyin pa thams cad kyi nang na sbyin ba'i mchog 'di yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa thams cad kyi nang na sbyin ba'i mchog 'di yin te /
translated: this is the best of all gifts.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is it?

original: chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //🔽rgyu 'dis kyang lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang na dga' ba'i tshal du @220b skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o // rgyu 'dis kyang lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang na dga' ba'i tshal du @220b skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is called the gift of the Dharma.🔽By this cause, after separating from the body, he will go to a good realm and be born in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, in the Heaven of Joy.

original: der skyes nas kyang de lha'i bde ba phun sum tshogs ba dpe med pa brgya phrag stong du ma myong ba na /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang de lha'i bde ba phun sum tshogs ba dpe med pa brgya phrag stong du ma myong ba na /
translated: Having been born there, he will experience the incomparable, perfect happiness of the gods, a hundred thousand times greater than any other happiness.

original: 'di ltar gang du tshal de'i phyogs kyi cha ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang du tshal de'i phyogs kyi cha ni 'di yin te /
translated: In this way, the forest is located in a particular direction,

original: dpag tshad sum stong yod la rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dpag tshad sum stong yod la rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa yin te /
translated: three thousand leagues in size, and beautified by trees made of the seven precious substances.

original: de ltar lha rnams rtag tu dga' bar byed cing gzhan gar yang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: de ltar lha rnams rtag tu dga' bar byed cing gzhan gar yang mi 'gro ste /
translated: In this way, the gods always enjoy themselves and do not go anywhere else.

original: de bas na lhan cig skyes pa'i yon tan gyis de dga' ba'i tshal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lhan cig skyes pa'i yon tan gyis de dga' ba'i tshal zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of its innate qualities, it is called the forest of joy.

original: de na shing ljon pa thams cad 'dod pa dag gang lha rnams kyi yid kyis yang dag par sems par byed pa de dag nyid lha de rnams kyis shing ljon pa las 'thon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de na shing ljon pa thams cad 'dod pa dag gang lha rnams kyi yid kyis yang dag par sems par byed pa de dag nyid lha de rnams kyis shing ljon pa las 'thon par 'gyur te /
translated: In that forest, all the trees produce whatever objects of desire the gods perfectly imagine in their minds.

original: de ltar lha rnams kyi yid la bdag khyim zhig 'dod do snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar lha rnams kyi yid la bdag khyim zhig 'dod do snyam na /
translated: In this way, if the gods think, ‘I want a house,’

original: de nas de ltar lha des yid la byas ma thag tu shing ljon pa de'i yal ga'i rtse mo la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas de ltar lha des yid la byas ma thag tu shing ljon pa de'i yal ga'i rtse mo la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then as soon as the gods think this, a house will appear at the tip of a branch of a tree.

original: shing ljon pa de'i khang bzang rin po che sna bdun dang ldan zhing nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: shing ljon pa de'i khang bzang rin po che sna bdun dang ldan zhing nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
translated: He will see a mansion made of the seven precious substances,

original: ka ba stong yod pa'i khang bzang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ka ba stong yod pa'i khang bzang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: adorned with a thousand pillars.

original: khang pa de'i ka ba so sor de'i phyogs phyogs bee d'urya las byas shing /
analyzed: khang pa de'i ka ba so sor de'i phyogs phyogs bee d'urya las byas shing /
translated: Each pillar of that mansion is made of beryl in one direction,

original: la la gser las byas /
analyzed: la la gser las byas /
translated: some are made of gold,

original: la la shel las byas /🔽la la ke ke ru las byas /
analyzed: la la shel las byas / la la ke ke ru las byas /
translated: some are made of crystal,🔽some are made of ruby,

original: la la spug las byas pa yin no //
analyzed: la la spug las byas pa yin no //
translated: and some are made of white coral.

original: de nas khyim gyi mchog de shing ljon pa'i rtse mo de la yod pa mthong nas de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽da ni bdag lam 'jam zhing mtho dma' ru gyur pa nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim gyi mchog de shing ljon pa'i rtse mo de la yod pa mthong nas de 'di snyam du sems te / da ni bdag lam 'jam zhing mtho dma' ru gyur pa nas /
translated: Then, seeing that supreme house on the top of the tree, he will think,

original: khyim 'dir 'jug @221a *//🔽par bya'o snyam bsams ma thag nyid du shing ljon pa de nyid la lam mthong ste der 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: khyim 'dir 'jug @221a *// par bya'o snyam bsams ma thag nyid du shing ljon pa de nyid la lam mthong ste der 'jug par byed do //
translated: ‘Now I will enter this house on a smooth and even path.’🔽As soon as he thinks that, he will see a path on the tree and will enter it.

original: de ltar lam de nyid nas zhugs pa dang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ltar lam de nyid nas zhugs pa dang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: As he enters that path, he will think,🔽‘

original: da ni bdag gi khyim 'dir khyim nang du padma'i rdzing zhig yod na rung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: da ni bdag gi khyim 'dir khyim nang du padma'i rdzing zhig yod na rung ngo snyam mo //
translated: “Now, I wish there were a lotus pond in my house.”

original: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du padma'i rdzing rin po che sna bdun las byas pa /
analyzed: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du padma'i rdzing rin po che sna bdun las byas pa /
translated: As soon as he thinks this, a lotus pond made of the seven precious substances appears.

original: bya ngang ba dang / ka randa pa dang / dur ba sna tshogs kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bya ngang ba dang / ka randa pa dang / dur ba sna tshogs kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa 'byung ngo //
translated: It is beautified by various kinds of geese, ducks, and swans.

original: de nas yang lha de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas yang lha de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the god thinks,

original: bdag gi sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa 'byung par gyur cig snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gi sil snyan dang / glu dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa 'byung par gyur cig snyam mo //
translated: ‘May my musical instruments and songs with the five types of instruments appear.’

original: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du gang rlung ngad 'jam pa rab tu ldang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du gang rlung ngad 'jam pa rab tu ldang bar 'gyur te /
translated: As soon as he thinks this, a gentle breeze arises.

original: rnam pa ji srid du phan tshun reg pa na sgra 'byung ba'i rnam pa de srid du sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa ji srid du phan tshun reg pa na sgra 'byung ba'i rnam pa de srid du sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa 'byung ngo //
translated: It blows in such a way that the musical instruments with the five types of instruments sound.🔽The god thinks,

original: lha de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: lha de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The god thinks this:🔽🔽

original: shing ljon pa'i nang gi khang par da ni bza' ba dang / btung ba chu bo ltar 'bab par gyur cig snyam mo //
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i nang gi khang par da ni bza' ba dang / btung ba chu bo ltar 'bab par gyur cig snyam mo //
translated: “I wish that food and drink would flow like rivers in the houses in the trees.”

original: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du shing ljon pa'i yal ga de dag rdol nas bza' ba chu bo snyed dang / btung ba chu bo snyed kha dog dang / ro dang / reg pa phun sum tshogs pa byung ngo //
analyzed: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du shing ljon pa'i yal ga de dag rdol nas bza' ba chu bo snyed dang / btung ba chu bo snyed kha dog dang / ro dang / reg pa phun sum tshogs pa byung ngo //
translated: As soon as he had this thought, the branches of the trees split open and food and drink flowed out like rivers, with perfect color, taste, and texture.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought,

original: da ni bdag bdud rtsi bza' bar bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: da ni bdag bdud rtsi bza' bar bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “Now I will eat ambrosia.”

original: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du bdud rtsi lha'i ro dang / dri dang / mdog phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de sems bskyed ma thag nyid du bdud rtsi lha'i ro dang / dri dang / mdog phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: As soon as he had this thought, ambrosia appeared, with the perfect taste, smell, and color of the gods.

original: de de la za bar byed @221b do; ;de des shing tu tshim pa dang / de nas yang lha mo de rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽yongs su spyod par byed do //
analyzed: de de la za bar byed @221b do; ;de des shing tu tshim pa dang / de nas yang lha mo de rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / yongs su spyod par byed do //
translated: He ate it and became completely satisfied. Then, together with the goddesses, he played and enjoyed himself.

original: de ltar dga' ba'i tshal du lha dag shing gi drung du song ste /
analyzed: de ltar dga' ba'i tshal du lha dag shing gi drung du song ste /
translated: “In this way, the gods in the Joyous Forest go to the foot of the trees and

original: bde ba nye bar spyod par byed do //
analyzed: bde ba nye bar spyod par byed do //
translated: They enjoy the pleasures of the forest.

original: de gal te yang shing ljon pa'i mchog de las 'bebs par byed de /
analyzed: de gal te yang shing ljon pa'i mchog de las 'bebs par byed de /
translated: “If they wish to descend from the supreme trees,

original: de sa'i steng du song nas sa de la 'chag par byed do //
analyzed: de sa'i steng du song nas sa de la 'chag par byed do //
translated: they will walk on the ground.

original: de 'chag pa na bee d'urya'i sdong bu dang ldan pa'i padma gser gyi 'dab ma mtho ris su 'os pa /
analyzed: de 'chag pa na bee d'urya'i sdong bu dang ldan pa'i padma gser gyi 'dab ma mtho ris su 'os pa /
translated: When they walk, there will appear lotuses with stems of beryl and golden petals, which are fit for the higher realms.

original: 'jam zhing 'phar ba kun nas mchog du nyams dga' zhing shin tu dri zhim pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam zhing 'phar ba kun nas mchog du nyams dga' zhing shin tu dri zhim pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are soft, springy, and delightful, and they have a very sweet fragrance.

original: de dag la rkang pas 'gro zhing lha de 'chag par byed la /
analyzed: de dag la rkang pas 'gro zhing lha de 'chag par byed la /
translated: They walk on them with their feet, and the gods enjoy walking on them.

original: lha'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dbyangs len pa na /
analyzed: lha'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i dbyangs len pa na /
translated: When they play divine music with the five types of instruments,

original: de ltar lha de rkang pas 'chag pa'i bde ba nye bar myong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar lha de rkang pas 'chag pa'i bde ba nye bar myong ngo //
translated: the gods experience the pleasure of walking.

original: de rnam par rtog pa 'bum snyed du ma dag 'grub cing bde ba myong ste dbang po lnga rnams kyi yul lnga rnams la myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa 'bum snyed du ma dag 'grub cing bde ba myong ste dbang po lnga rnams kyi yul lnga rnams la myong bar byed do //
translated: They experience hundreds of thousands of thoughts and enjoyments, and they experience the five objects of the five senses.

original: dbang po kun rang gi yul gyis tshim pa med par 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po kun rang gi yul gyis tshim pa med par 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The senses are never satisfied by their objects.

original: mig gis gzugs gang mthong ba de dag zlos pa med par mthong la /🔽gang mthong ba de dag sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs gang mthong ba de dag zlos pa med par mthong la / gang mthong ba de dag sna tshogs pa /
translated: The eyes see forms without satiation.

original: nyams dga' ba mig tu 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: nyams dga' ba mig tu 'ong ba yin no //
translated: Whatever they see is diverse, delightful, and attractive.

original: mig dang bas 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba 'dzin cing mthong ste /
analyzed: mig dang bas 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba 'dzin cing mthong ste /
translated: The eyes, with their delightful, attractive, and captivating vision,

original: de ltar mig gzugs rnams kyis tshim pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar mig gzugs rnams kyis tshim pa med do //
translated: never tire of forms.

original: gang rna bas mnyan pa'ang nyams dga' ba gzhan dang mi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: gang rna bas mnyan pa'ang nyams dga' ba gzhan dang mi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: The ears hear sounds that are delightful and unlike any others.

original: rna ba'ang sgra rnams kyis tshim pa med @222a *//
analyzed: rna ba'ang sgra rnams kyis tshim pa med @222a *//
translated: The ears are never satisfied by sounds.

original: do; ;de ltar snas kyang dri snom bar byed de /
analyzed: do; ;de ltar snas kyang dri snom bar byed de /
translated: The nose smells scents

original: gang snom pa de dag kyang 'dod ba sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnams la snom ste /
analyzed: gang snom pa de dag kyang 'dod ba sdug pa yid du 'ong ba rnams la snom ste /
translated: that are delightful, attractive, and captivating.🔽The nose is never satisfied by scents.

original: sna'ang dri rnams kyis tshim pa med de; ;de ltar lces kyang ro rnams myong bar byed de /
analyzed: sna'ang dri rnams kyis tshim pa med de; ;de ltar lces kyang ro rnams myong bar byed de /
translated: The tongue experiences tastes🔽that are delightful, attractive, and captivating.

original: gang myong bar bya ba de dag kyang shin tu 'dod pa dag la myong bar byed cing yid du 'ong ba dag la myong bar byed do //
analyzed: gang myong bar bya ba de dag kyang shin tu 'dod pa dag la myong bar byed cing yid du 'ong ba dag la myong bar byed do //
translated: Whatever they experience is extremely desirable and delightful.

original: de ltar lus kyis kyang reg bya la reg par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar lus kyis kyang reg bya la reg par byed de /
translated: In this way, they also touch objects with their bodies.

original: gang reg par bya ba de dag kyang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba dag la myong bar byed de //
analyzed: gang reg par bya ba de dag kyang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba dag la myong bar byed de //
translated: Whatever they touch is desirable, attractive, and delightful.🔽In this way, they also think about objects with their minds.

original: de ltar yid kyis gang bsam par bya ba de'ang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba dag la sems par byed de /🔽de ltar sred pa'i tshogs drug la lus rnam par chags pa dag tshal de na rgod par byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: de ltar yid kyis gang bsam par bya ba de'ang 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba dag la sems par byed de / de ltar sred pa'i tshogs drug la lus rnam par chags pa dag tshal de na rgod par byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: Whatever they think about is desirable, attractive, and delightful.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed /
translated: In this way, the six groups of craving are attached to the body, and they frolic, enjoy themselves, and indulge in sexual intercourse in the forest.🔽They play,

original: rtse bar byed kyang 'dod pa rnams kyis tshim pa med do //
analyzed: rtse bar byed kyang 'dod pa rnams kyis tshim pa med do //
translated: but they are not satisfied by their desires.

original: de yul 'og ma dgon pa lta bu la dbang po mthon por byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rlung lta bus bskyod pa'i dge ba med pa shin tu byung ba'i mes nyin gcig bzhin sreg kyang /
analyzed: de yul 'og ma dgon pa lta bu la dbang po mthon por byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rlung lta bus bskyod pa'i dge ba med pa shin tu byung ba'i mes nyin gcig bzhin sreg kyang /
translated: The fire of the absence of virtue that is stirred by the wind-like thoughts of those with higher faculties in the lower realms, such as monasteries, burns them day after day.

original: de sred pa'i 'dod ba rnams kyis tshim pa bskyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de sred pa'i 'dod ba rnams kyis tshim pa bskyed par mi byed do //
translated: However, this fire does not satisfy the craving for objects.

original: de ltar de dag dga' ba'i tshal na rtse zhing yul du ma la dga' ba myong ba kun tu rtse ste /🔽dga' ba myong ba na lha ma yin las rnam par rgyal ba /
analyzed: de ltar de dag dga' ba'i tshal na rtse zhing yul du ma la dga' ba myong ba kun tu rtse ste / dga' ba myong ba na lha ma yin las rnam par rgyal ba /
translated: “ ‘Thus, while they play in the forest of pleasure and experience many pleasures, they will continue to play.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin yang snga ma bzhin du ri brtsegs pa sna tshogs ga la pa der 'gro bar byed do /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin yang snga ma bzhin du ri brtsegs pa sna tshogs ga la pa der 'gro bar byed do /
translated: While they experience such pleasures, Śakra, king of the gods, who is victorious over the asuras, will, as before, go to the place where the various mountains are piled up.

original: @222b song nas kyang lha rnams bos te /
analyzed: @222b song nas kyang lha rnams bos te /
translated: When he arrives, he will call out to the gods:

original: lha dag / dga' ba'i tshal du dga' bar gyis shig /
analyzed: lha dag / dga' ba'i tshal du dga' bar gyis shig /
translated: “ ‘Gods, enjoy yourselves in the forest of pleasure!

original: lha'i 'dod ba'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams kyis rtses shig /
analyzed: lha'i 'dod ba'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams kyis rtses shig /
translated: Play with the five divine pleasures at your disposal.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni bdud kyi sde thags bzang ris la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni bdud kyi sde thags bzang ris la sogs pa las rnam par rgyal te /
translated: In this way, I have defeated the hordes of Māra, including Vemacitrin.

original: bdag dga' ba'i tshal du 'gro yi /
analyzed: bdag dga' ba'i tshal du 'gro yi /
translated: I will go to the pleasure grove.

original: de ltar lha thams cad lha mo'i tshogs dang / bdag cag rnams kyi dbyar zla ba bzhir gnas pa'i skyed mos tshal du dga' spyod bya ba gal ba der dong la /
analyzed: de ltar lha thams cad lha mo'i tshogs dang / bdag cag rnams kyi dbyar zla ba bzhir gnas pa'i skyed mos tshal du dga' spyod bya ba gal ba der dong la /
translated: All of you gods, together with the hosts of goddesses, should go to the pleasure grove where we will stay for the four months of summer.

original: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis nges par dga' bar bya'o zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis nges par dga' bar bya'o zhes bsgo'o //
translated: We will definitely enjoy ourselves with the five divine sense pleasures.”

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyis sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams la bsgo nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyis sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams la bsgo nas /
translated: Then Śakra, King of the Gods, addressed the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three:

original: shin tu dga' ba chen po dang yang dag par ldan pa glang po ches srung gi bu bos te /
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba chen po dang yang dag par ldan pa glang po ches srung gi bu bos te /
translated: “With great joy, I summon Airāvaṇa, the son of the elephant king.

original: 'di ltar glang po che'i mchog chos shig /🔽nga skyed mos tshal du dga' spyod bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar glang po che'i mchog chos shig / nga skyed mos tshal du dga' spyod bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Come here, O supreme elephant!🔽I will go to the pleasure grove in the Nandana Grove

original: dga' ba'i tshal na skyed mos tshal gyi dga' spyod ga la ba der 'gro ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i tshal na skyed mos tshal gyi dga' spyod ga la ba der 'gro ste /
translated: to enjoy myself.

original: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs dang bcas pas yongs su bskor la dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong gi /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs dang bcas pas yongs su bskor la dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong gi /
translated: surrounded by a retinue of gods and goddesses, to the pleasure grove.

original: khyod kyis ji ltar sngon yang yongs su sprul pa byas pa de /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji ltar sngon yang yongs su sprul pa byas pa de /
translated: Just as you have done before,

original: de ltar khyod kyi rgyab tu zhon pa dang / mgo la zhon pa dang / so la zhon pa dang / rtsib logs la zhon pa dang / gdeg pa dang / tshal dang / mtsho dang / ri rtse dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dag sprul pa gyis shig ces bsgo'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyod kyi rgyab tu zhon pa dang / mgo la zhon pa dang / so la zhon pa dang / rtsib logs la zhon pa dang / gdeg pa dang / tshal dang / mtsho dang / ri rtse dang / tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dag sprul pa gyis shig ces bsgo'o //
translated: you should emanate a back, a head, teeth, sides, wings, forests, lakes, mountain peaks, groves, and parks.”

original: de nas brgya byin gyi tshig thos nas /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin gyi tshig thos nas /
translated: Then, having heard Śakra’s words,

original: glang po che'i mchog sa srung gi bu @223a *//
analyzed: glang po che'i mchog sa srung gi bu @223a *//
translated: the supreme elephant Airāvaṇa

original: bdag nyid chen por sprul te lus chen por byas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen por sprul te lus chen por byas so //
translated: manifested himself as a great being with a huge body.

original: de mgo brgyar sprul te mgo re re la so bcu bcu'o //
analyzed: de mgo brgyar sprul te mgo re re la so bcu bcu'o //
translated: He emanated a hundred heads, each with ten teeth.

original: so re re la padma'i rdzing bcu bcu'o //
analyzed: so re re la padma'i rdzing bcu bcu'o //
translated: Each tooth had ten lotus ponds.

original: padma'i rdzing re re la padma stong stong ngo //
analyzed: padma'i rdzing re re la padma stong stong ngo //
translated: Each lotus pond had a thousand lotuses.

original: padma stong stong la ni rin po che sna bdun gyi 'dab ma yod do //
analyzed: padma stong stong la ni rin po che sna bdun gyi 'dab ma yod do //
translated: Each of the thousand lotuses has petals of the seven precious substances.

original: 'dab ma stong stong la rin po che sna bdun gyi bung ba yod cing /
analyzed: 'dab ma stong stong la rin po che sna bdun gyi bung ba yod cing /
translated: Each of the thousand petals has bees of the seven precious substances.

original: 'dab ma stong stong la lha rnams 'khod kyang lha mo'i tshogs dang phan tshun nyam nga ba med do //
analyzed: 'dab ma stong stong la lha rnams 'khod kyang lha mo'i tshogs dang phan tshun nyam nga ba med do //
translated: Even though thousands of gods are seated on each petal, there is no mutual discomfort among the groups of goddesses.

original: de dag glang po che mchog gi mgo la zhon pa /
analyzed: de dag glang po che mchog gi mgo la zhon pa /
translated: They ride on the heads of the best elephants.

original: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der nam mkha' las 'dong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der nam mkha' las 'dong ngo //
translated: Endowed and possessing the five divine sense pleasures, they go through the sky to the Nandana Grove.

original: glang po che mchog gi rtsib logs la'ang tshal gnyis sprul te /
analyzed: glang po che mchog gi rtsib logs la'ang tshal gnyis sprul te /
translated: On the sides of the best elephants, two groves are emanated.

original: tshal rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba dang / tshal gnyis po 'dod bde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshal rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba dang / tshal gnyis po 'dod bde zhes bya'o //
translated: The first grove is called Extremely Joyful, and the second grove is called Pleasure of Desire.

original: tshal gnyis po de na shing ljon pa dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka phun sum tshogs pa dang / rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa phun sum tshogs pa yod do //
analyzed: tshal gnyis po de na shing ljon pa dang / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka phun sum tshogs pa dang / rin po che sna bdun gyi shing ljon pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa phun sum tshogs pa yod do //
translated: In both parks there are perfect trees, waterfalls, and ponds, perfect trees of the seven precious substances, and perfect wish-fulfilling trees.

original: tshal de na gnas pa'i lha rnams dga' zhing dga' mgur spyod la lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis dga' ba na /
analyzed: tshal de na gnas pa'i lha rnams dga' zhing dga' mgur spyod la lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga rnams kyis dga' ba na /
translated: The gods who live in those parks enjoy themselves, reveling in the five divine pleasures of desire.

original: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis gang ba /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyis gang ba /
translated: The parks are filled with hosts of gods and goddesses.

original: glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bu ri rab gnyis pa lta bu dga' ba'i tshal gal ba der 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bu ri rab gnyis pa lta bu dga' ba'i tshal gal ba der 'gro bar byed do //
translated: The king of elephants, Airāvaṇa, who is like a second Mount Sumeru, goes to the Nandana Grove.

original: glang po che mchog gi rgyab tu'ang grong khyer mnyam zhing 'jam pa'i @223b ngos zhes bya ba blta na sdug gnyis pa lta bu sprul te /
analyzed: glang po che mchog gi rgyab tu'ang grong khyer mnyam zhing 'jam pa'i @223b ngos zhes bya ba blta na sdug gnyis pa lta bu sprul te /
translated: On the back of that supreme elephant, a city called Even and Smooth Ground, which is like a second Sudarśana, is emanated.

original: srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / shing ljon pa dang / rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i khang pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas so //
analyzed: srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / shing ljon pa dang / rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i khang pa rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas so //
translated: It is adorned with streets, crossroads, parks, trees, and houses made of the seven precious substances.

original: de'i dbus su khang pa sprul te rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i ka pa brgya yod pa'i ka ba rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas so //
analyzed: de'i dbus su khang pa sprul te rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'i ka pa brgya yod pa'i ka ba rnams kyis nye bar mdzes par byas so //
translated: In the middle of that, he emanates a house with a hundred pillars made of the seven precious substances.

original: de'i dbus su mtsho 'byung ste der lha'i rgyal po lha mo'i tshogs rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar byed cing /
analyzed: de'i dbus su mtsho 'byung ste der lha'i rgyal po lha mo'i tshogs rnams dang lhan cig rtse bar byed cing /
translated: In the middle of that, a lake appears, and there the king of the gods plays with the host of goddesses.

original: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i lha'i rgyal po brgya byin dga' bar byed la /
analyzed: sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i lha'i rgyal po brgya byin dga' bar byed la /
translated: With the five types of musical instruments, Śakra, king of the gods, delights in that.

original: dga' mgur spyod pa bzhin du dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod pa bzhin du dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Just as he wishes, he goes to the Pleasure Grove.

original: de 'gro ba na'ang 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de 'gro ba na'ang 'gyur ba med de /
translated: When he goes there, he does not change.

original: ji ltar ri rab la gnas pa 'gyur bar mi mngon pa de ltar glang po che'i mchog 'gro'ang mi mngon no //
analyzed: ji ltar ri rab la gnas pa 'gyur bar mi mngon pa de ltar glang po che'i mchog 'gro'ang mi mngon no //
translated: Just as one who is on Mount Sumeru does not change, so the king of elephants does not change when he goes there.

original: de nas yang glang po che'i rna ba la padma'i rdzing gnyis sprul te rgyar dpag tshad bcu gcig go /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che'i rna ba la padma'i rdzing gnyis sprul te rgyar dpag tshad bcu gcig go /
translated: Then, two lotus ponds appear in the ears of the elephant, each eleven leagues in width.

original: gnyis pa'ang dpag tshad bcu yod do //🔽gcig ni zab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'ang dpag tshad bcu yod do // gcig ni zab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The second is ten leagues.🔽One is called Deep and

original: gnyis pa ni dang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: the other Clear.

original: chu yon tan yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas shin tu gang ba yin no //
analyzed: chu yon tan yan lag brgyad dang ldan pas shin tu gang ba yin no //
translated: They are completely filled with water endowed with the eight qualities.

original: de na autpal bee d'urya'i 'dab ma dang / rin po che'i sdong bu dag skyes la /
analyzed: de na autpal bee d'urya'i 'dab ma dang / rin po che'i sdong bu dag skyes la /
translated: Blue lotuses with beryl petals and jeweled stalks grow there.

original: kha cig ni padma r'a ga'i mdog lta bu la bung bas nye bar mdzes par byas shing /
analyzed: kha cig ni padma r'a ga'i mdog lta bu la bung bas nye bar mdzes par byas shing /
translated: Some are the color of rubies and are beautified by bees.

original: me tog rgyas la lha'i dri phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: me tog rgyas la lha'i dri phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: They are in full bloom and have the perfect fragrance of divine scents.

original: autpal de dag gi nang gi zer ba'i stan la lha dang / lha mo gang dag lhan cig 'khod de dga' bar byed la @224a *//
analyzed: autpal de dag gi nang gi zer ba'i stan la lha dang / lha mo gang dag lhan cig 'khod de dga' bar byed la @224a *//
translated: On the seats of the stamens of those lotuses, gods and goddesses sit together and enjoy themselves.

original: lha kha cig ni chus rtse zhing padmas rtsa bar kyang lha rnams kyis /
analyzed: lha kha cig ni chus rtse zhing padmas rtsa bar kyang lha rnams kyis /
translated: Some gods play in the water and some play with lotuses.

original: ci / glang po che'i mchog 'di 'gro'am /
analyzed: ci / glang po che'i mchog 'di 'gro'am /
translated: The gods ask, “Is this supreme elephant moving?

original: mi 'gro mi rig go /
analyzed: mi 'gro mi rig go /
translated: He does not go and he does not know.

original: glang po che mchog gi lag pa'i steng du rdzing ring po sprul te srid du dpag tshad lnga yod pa /
analyzed: glang po che mchog gi lag pa'i steng du rdzing ring po sprul te srid du dpag tshad lnga yod pa /
translated: On the elephant’s trunk, he emanates a long pond five leagues long,

original: khang bzang yang thog can gyis yongs su bskor la lha'i shing ljon pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: khang bzang yang thog can gyis yongs su bskor la lha'i shing ljon pa dang ldan pa /
translated: surrounded by a palace with a roof, with divine trees,

original: me tog sna tshogs kyis khebs pa /
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs kyis khebs pa /
translated: covered with various flowers,

original: me tog manda rabs khebs pa /
analyzed: me tog manda rabs khebs pa /
translated: covered with mandārava flowers,

original: bung ba sgra di ri ri 'byin pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bung ba sgra di ri ri 'byin pa dang ldan pa /
translated: with bees humming,

original: lha'i tsandan gor shir sha'i 'dab mas nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: lha'i tsandan gor shir sha'i 'dab mas nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
translated: adorned with leaves of divine sandalwood,

original: gser gyi shing ljon pa dang / me tog rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan rnams kyis shin tu khebs pa yin te /
analyzed: gser gyi shing ljon pa dang / me tog rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan rnams kyis shin tu khebs pa yin te /
translated: and completely covered with golden trees and other various flowers.

original: me tog de rnams kyi nang na 'khod pa'i lha mo me tog gi ze ba'i steng na 'dug pa dag rol mo byed cing de dag glu dbyangs len la /
analyzed: me tog de rnams kyi nang na 'khod pa'i lha mo me tog gi ze ba'i steng na 'dug pa dag rol mo byed cing de dag glu dbyangs len la /
translated: The goddesses who are in those flowers, sitting on the stamen of the flowers, play music and sing songs.

original: lha'i rgyal po de la'ang tshig dge ba rnams kyis bstod par byed de /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po de la'ang tshig dge ba rnams kyis bstod par byed de /
translated: They praise the king of the gods with virtuous words.

original: de ltar glang po che mchog gi lag pa'i steng du'ang rdzing ring po sprul to //
analyzed: de ltar glang po che mchog gi lag pa'i steng du'ang rdzing ring po sprul to //
translated: In the same way, he emanates a long pond on the back of the supreme elephant.

original: de nas yang glang po che'i rgyal po'i sna'i thor to la rdzing chen po rgyar dpag tshad tsam yod pa sprul te /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che'i rgyal po'i sna'i thor to la rdzing chen po rgyar dpag tshad tsam yod pa sprul te /
translated: Then, on the trunk of the king of elephants, he emanates a great pond one league wide.

original: padma rgya che ba 'bum phrag du ma dri shin tu zhim pa yin la /
analyzed: padma rgya che ba 'bum phrag du ma dri shin tu zhim pa yin la /
translated: There are hundreds of thousands of large lotuses with a very sweet scent.

original: gang lha'i dri de dpag tshad bcur ldang ngo //
analyzed: gang lha'i dri de dpag tshad bcur ldang ngo //
translated: The scent of these lotuses rises up to a distance of ten leagues.

original: padma chen po 'dab mas nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i 'dab ma re re la /
analyzed: padma chen po 'dab mas nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i 'dab ma re re la /
translated: On each of the petals of these large lotuses,

original: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs rnams nye bar glu dbyangs len cing rtse bar byed /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo'i tshogs rnams nye bar glu dbyangs len cing rtse bar byed /
translated: crowds of gods and goddesses sing and play.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed kyang lha rnams rtse zhing yongs su spyod pa phan tshun @224b mi mthong la de bzhin du gnod pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed kyang lha rnams rtse zhing yongs su spyod pa phan tshun @224b mi mthong la de bzhin du gnod pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: They enjoy themselves, but the gods who are playing and enjoying themselves do not see each other, and in the same way, they are free from harm.

original: de ltar yang sna'i thor to la gnas pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang sna'i thor to la gnas pa /
translated: In this way, he who resides on the trunk

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha de rnams dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha de rnams dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do //
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three will then proceed to the Pleasure Grove.

original: de ltar ri rab kyi steng du 'gro'ang glang po che'i mchog 'gyur bar lha rnams kyis mi rig go /
analyzed: de ltar ri rab kyi steng du 'gro'ang glang po che'i mchog 'gyur bar lha rnams kyis mi rig go /
translated: Even though they travel to the top of Mount Sumeru, the gods are unaware that the supreme elephant has changed.

original: de nas yang glang po che'i mchog gi sna la ri chen po 'byung khungs kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba sprul te /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che'i mchog gi sna la ri chen po 'byung khungs kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba sprul te /
translated: Next, the supreme elephant emanates a great mountain called Adorned with Mineral Deposits on its trunk.

original: ri de nyid la 'byung khungs sna tshogs kyis brgyan cing lha'i shing ljon pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa /🔽'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / mtsho dang / padma'i rdzing gis brgyan par lha gzhan dag kyang rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: ri de nyid la 'byung khungs sna tshogs kyis brgyan cing lha'i shing ljon pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa / 'bab chu dang / lteng ka dang / nye ba'i tshal dang / mtsho dang / padma'i rdzing gis brgyan par lha gzhan dag kyang rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: On that mountain, adorned with various mineral deposits and beautified by divine trees, other gods play,🔽enjoy themselves,

original: rgod par byed de /
analyzed: rgod par byed de /
translated: and frolic.

original: glang po che'i mchog me tog gis bkra ba de'i mgo la'ang ri sprul to //
analyzed: glang po che'i mchog me tog gis bkra ba de'i mgo la'ang ri sprul to //
translated: On the head of the supreme elephant, which is colorful with flowers, the gods also emanate a mountain.

original: de nas yang glang po che mchog gi so'i thor to zla ba tshes pa lta bu la nye ba'i tshal dag sprul te /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che mchog gi so'i thor to zla ba tshes pa lta bu la nye ba'i tshal dag sprul te /
translated: Then, the supreme elephant emanates a forest of moon-like tusks

original: me tog dang / mtshos sa gzhi rtag tu gang ba'i thang lta bur bkra bar byas shing 'dab mas kyang nye bar mdzes par byas bung ba lang long 'khrigs pa dang / khu phyug gi sgra di ri ri 'byin pa dang / skam la rgyu ba rin po che sna bdun gyi rma bya dang /
analyzed: me tog dang / mtshos sa gzhi rtag tu gang ba'i thang lta bur bkra bar byas shing 'dab mas kyang nye bar mdzes par byas bung ba lang long 'khrigs pa dang / khu phyug gi sgra di ri ri 'byin pa dang / skam la rgyu ba rin po che sna bdun gyi rma bya dang /
translated: and adorns the ground with flowers and ponds, making it like a colorful plain. The forest is also beautified by trees with leaves and by bees buzzing and peacocks calling out.

original: shang shang te'u shin tu yid du 'ong ba du ma dang / gzhan yang /
analyzed: shang shang te'u shin tu yid du 'ong ba du ma dang / gzhan yang /
translated: There are many beautiful birds such as the seven-jeweled peacock and the partridge.

original: lha'i bya rnams kyis so la sprul ba nye bar mdzes par byas so //
analyzed: lha'i bya rnams kyis so la sprul ba nye bar mdzes par byas so //
translated: The forest is also beautified by the emanations of the gods.

original: glang po che'i mchog lus chen por gyur nas dga' ba'i tsha la ga la ba der 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: glang po che'i mchog lus chen por gyur nas dga' ba'i tsha la ga la ba der 'gro bar byed de /
translated: The supreme elephant, having become a large body, goes to the forest of joy.

original: lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing ngal ba med la /🔽stobs dang @225a *//
analyzed: lha'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing ngal ba med la / stobs dang @225a *//
translated: Surrounded by a group of gods, he is tireless.

original: ldan pa 'gros mdzes pas rab tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: ldan pa 'gros mdzes pas rab tu 'gro'o //
translated: Endowed with strength, he moves beautifully.

original: de nas yang glang po che'i mchog de'i sna gnyis kyi nang nas sna chu'i rgyun 'dzag ste /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che'i mchog de'i sna gnyis kyi nang nas sna chu'i rgyun 'dzag ste /
translated: Then, from the two nostrils of that supreme elephant, a stream of water flows out.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dzambu'i gling na mtsho gangg'a dang / ya mu na'i chu 'bab pa shin tu dang zhing rnyog pa med pa /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling na mtsho gangg'a dang / ya mu na'i chu 'bab pa shin tu dang zhing rnyog pa med pa /
translated: In the human realm, the water of the Ganges and Yamunā flows, very clear and unpolluted,

original: bsil ba rab tu 'bab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsil ba rab tu 'bab pa bzhin no //
translated: cool and flowing well.

original: de bzhin du cung zad dpe lta bur bya na /
analyzed: de bzhin du cung zad dpe lta bur bya na /
translated: In that way, it is a little like a simile.

original: ji ltar mi'i gnas bzhi dag na sman dang / rtse dang / nags khrod dang / nas dang / gro tsha bas gdungs shing bskams pa rnams de nas yang sos par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi'i gnas bzhi dag na sman dang / rtse dang / nags khrod dang / nas dang / gro tsha bas gdungs shing bskams pa rnams de nas yang sos par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as in the four human abodes, the herbs, forests, fields, barley, wheat, and so on that are scorched and dried by the heat,

original: 'bru dang / lo ma rnams kyis steng na chu 'bab pa mngon pa de ltar glang po che'i rgyal po de'i rab tu dbye ba'ang rtag tu de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'bru dang / lo ma rnams kyis steng na chu 'bab pa mngon pa de ltar glang po che'i rgyal po de'i rab tu dbye ba'ang rtag tu de lta bu yin no //
translated: in order to revive them, the water flowing above with its grains and leaves, in that way, the divisions of that elephant king are always like that.

original: gal te chu 'bab pa de rlung gis nam mkha' la 'thor bar byed cing /
analyzed: gal te chu 'bab pa de rlung gis nam mkha' la 'thor bar byed cing /
translated: If that flowing water is scattered in the sky by the wind,

original: rlung gis rgyang ring du skam par byed pa de ni zil pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: rlung gis rgyang ring du skam par byed pa de ni zil pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the dew that is dried up by the wind.

original: mi'i gnas gsum na snang ngo //
analyzed: mi'i gnas gsum na snang ngo //
translated: It appears in the three human abodes.

original: de nas yang glang po che'i rgyal po'i mchog de'i sna sgra 'bud pas 'byung ba de ni nam mkha'i dbus na lha rgyu ba rnams kyi nang du 'bab pa /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che'i rgyal po'i mchog de'i sna sgra 'bud pas 'byung ba de ni nam mkha'i dbus na lha rgyu ba rnams kyi nang du 'bab pa /
translated: Then, the sound of the supreme king of elephants trumpeting is heard in the middle of the sky, falling among the moving gods.

original: 'od dkar por rgyu ba mngon pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'od dkar por rgyu ba mngon pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the appearance of the white light moving.

original: gang mu stegs pa gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gang mu stegs pa gzhan dag na re /
translated: Other tīrthikas say,

original: 'di ltar 'di ni dbang po'i lam mo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni dbang po'i lam mo zhes brjod do //
translated: ‘This is the path of the senses.’

original: yang gzhan dag na re; 'di ltar 'di ni glang po che sa srung gi bu'i lam yin no zhes brjod kyang de ltar chu dkar po'i ngo bo nyid de mi shes so ////🔽'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran @225b pa nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re; 'di ltar 'di ni glang po che sa srung gi bu'i lam yin no zhes brjod kyang de ltar chu dkar po'i ngo bo nyid de mi shes so //// 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran @225b pa nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: Others say, ‘This is the path of the elephant Airāvaṇa,’ but they do not know the nature of the white water.

original: bam po sum cu gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu gsum pa /
translated: The noble Dhāraṇī of the Application of Mindfulness of the Good Dharma

original: de dag rlung gis gtor ba dang 'phral la 'bab cing de nyid ri dvags skom pa lta bur mthong la /
analyzed: de dag rlung gis gtor ba dang 'phral la 'bab cing de nyid ri dvags skom pa lta bur mthong la /
translated: The wind scatters them and they fall immediately, seen like thirsty deer.

original: ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur te ngo bo dag ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bor snang ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur te ngo bo dag ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bor snang ngo //
translated: The essence of the elephant king is transformed, and its essence appears as an unclear essence.

original: de nas yang glang po che'i rgyal po'i mchog de'i spyi bo la ri yod pa gang yin pa de'i spyi bo thams cad la rgyal mtshan gyi mchog bee d'urya'i gdub kor dang / gser gyi gdugs sprul te /
analyzed: de nas yang glang po che'i rgyal po'i mchog de'i spyi bo la ri yod pa gang yin pa de'i spyi bo thams cad la rgyal mtshan gyi mchog bee d'urya'i gdub kor dang / gser gyi gdugs sprul te /
translated: Then, on the head of the supreme king of elephants, where there was a mountain, a supreme victory banner was emanated, with a garland of beryl and a golden parasol.

original: ji ltar nyi ma gnyis pa lta bur de de ltar rnam par mdzes so //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma gnyis pa lta bur de de ltar rnam par mdzes so //
translated: It was as beautiful as a second sun.

original: glang po che'i mchog de'i steng na ba dan yang sprul te ring khyad dpag tshad tsam mo; ;ba dan de kun nas 'od dkar po 'byung ste /
analyzed: glang po che'i mchog de'i steng na ba dan yang sprul te ring khyad dpag tshad tsam mo; ;ba dan de kun nas 'od dkar po 'byung ste /
translated: Above the supreme elephant, a banner was emanated, one yojana long. The banner emitted white light in all directions.

original: gang mthong nas lha ma yin rgya mtsho na gnas pa rnams phan tshun du 'di ltar 'di ni lha rnams 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang mthong nas lha ma yin rgya mtsho na gnas pa rnams phan tshun du 'di ltar 'di ni lha rnams 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: Seeing this, the asuras dwelling in the ocean said to each other, “This is the arrival of the gods.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi ba dan rgyal byed ces bya ba snang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin gyi ba dan rgyal byed ces bya ba snang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The banner of the king of the gods Śakra, called Jaya, is appearing.”

original: de nas glang po che'i rgyal po'i mchog de dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas glang po che'i rgyal po'i mchog de dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'gro bar byed do //
translated: Then the supreme king of elephants proceeds to the pleasure grove.

original: tshal de rgyang ring po nyid nas mthong nas lha rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: tshal de rgyang ring po nyid nas mthong nas lha rnams la smras pa /
translated: Seeing the grove from a distance, he says to the gods,

original: khyed cag thams cad du nyams dga' ba chen po de nyid la ltos /
analyzed: khyed cag thams cad du nyams dga' ba chen po de nyid la ltos /
translated: ‘All of you, look at that great source of joy.

original: tshal chen po kun nas mthong na dga' ba gang du lha 'di dag lha ma yin las rgyal ba thob pa /
analyzed: tshal chen po kun nas mthong na dga' ba gang du lha 'di dag lha ma yin las rgyal ba thob pa /
translated: In the great grove that is delightful to behold, the gods have gained victory over the asuras.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang lhan cig tu zla ba bzhir dga' bar gyis shig /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang lhan cig tu zla ba bzhir dga' bar gyis shig /
translated: Together with the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, enjoy yourselves for four months.’

original: de nas lha dag gis tshig de thos nas lha de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas lha dag gis tshig de thos nas lha de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “When the gods hear these words, they will say,

original: ji lta bdag cag la brgya byin gyis bka' @226a *//
analyzed: ji lta bdag cag la brgya byin gyis bka' @226a *//
translated: ‘Just as Śakra has instructed us,

original: stsal pa de ltar bdag cag rnams kyis bsgrub par bgyi'o //
analyzed: stsal pa de ltar bdag cag rnams kyis bsgrub par bgyi'o //
translated: we will do as he has said.’

original: de skad ces smras nas brgya byin gyi glang po che srung gi bu dga' ba'i tshal du nye bar phyin no; ;de nas gang lha gzhan dga' ba'i tshal de na rtse mo byed pa de dag dga' bar byed cing yongs su spyod par byed la lha'i 'dod pa'i🔽yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa de dag thams cad rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang / glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bu nye bar mthong nas /
analyzed: de skad ces smras nas brgya byin gyi glang po che srung gi bu dga' ba'i tshal du nye bar phyin no; ;de nas gang lha gzhan dga' ba'i tshal de na rtse mo byed pa de dag dga' bar byed cing yongs su spyod par byed la lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa de dag thams cad rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang / glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bu nye bar mthong nas /
translated: “Having said this, the son of Airāvaṇa, the protector of Śakra’s elephant, arrived at Nandana Grove. The gods who were playing and enjoying themselves in Nandana Grove, who were endowed with and possessed the five divine pleasures, all saw the supreme banner and the son of Airāvaṇa, the king of elephants.

original: dga' ba'i tshal gyi ril rtse zhing gnas pa'i lha rnams yid rab tu dga' zhing; lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der dang ste phyin nas lha'i rgyal po la mgro thal mo sbyar te mchod nas /
analyzed: dga' ba'i tshal gyi ril rtse zhing gnas pa'i lha rnams yid rab tu dga' zhing; lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ga la ba der dang ste phyin nas lha'i rgyal po la mgro thal mo sbyar te mchod nas /
translated: The gods who were playing and staying in Nandana Grove were overjoyed. They approached Śakra, king of the gods, and with palms joined in homage they made offerings to the king of the gods.

original: brgya byin gyi mdun du sil snyan dang / sgra dbyangs dang / rol mo sna tshogs kyi dga' ba dang / brgya byin gyi mdun na bro gar dag byed bzhin dug dga' ba'i tshal chen po de ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi mdun du sil snyan dang / sgra dbyangs dang / rol mo sna tshogs kyi dga' ba dang / brgya byin gyi mdun na bro gar dag byed bzhin dug dga' ba'i tshal chen po de ga la ba der 'dong bar byed do /
translated: In front of Śakra, various kinds of cymbals, music, and instruments play, and dances are performed in front of Śakra.

original: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin yang glang po che sa srung gi bu las babs nas /
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po brgya byin yang glang po che sa srung gi bu las babs nas /
translated: Then Śakra, King of the Gods, descends from Airāvaṇa,

original: lha'i tshogs dang lhan cig tu dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'jug go /
analyzed: lha'i tshogs dang lhan cig tu dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der 'jug go /
translated: and together with the gods he enters Nandana Grove.

original: steng du zhon pa'i lha kun dang / de bzhin du mgo la zhon pa dang / de bzhin du sol zhon pa dang / de bzhin du rtsi ba log la zhon pa de dag thams cad glang po ches srung gi bu las babs nas /
analyzed: steng du zhon pa'i lha kun dang / de bzhin du mgo la zhon pa dang / de bzhin du sol zhon pa dang / de bzhin du rtsi ba log la zhon pa de dag thams cad glang po ches srung gi bu las babs nas /
translated: All the gods who ride on the back, the head, the tusks, and the ears of Airāvaṇa descend from Airāvaṇa

original: dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der rtse ba dang / dga' ba dang / @226b bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dong ngo //
analyzed: dga' ba'i tshal ga la ba der rtse ba dang / dga' ba dang / @226b bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dong ngo //
translated: and go to Nandana Grove to play, enjoy themselves, and be happy.

original: de nas gang dga' ba'i tshal chen po na snga na 'khod pa'i lha de dag dang / gang brgya byin dang lhan cig lha ma yin gyi g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba thob pa de dag thams cad 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'byor cing ldan par gyur pa rnams /
